Title: 1963 Ankara mid-air collision
Explanation: In the Ankara mid-air collision, Middle East Airlines Flight 265, a Vickers Viscount, collided with a Turkish Air Force Douglas C-47, killing all 17 on board both aircraft and 87 on the ground.

Title: 1991 Los Angeles airport runway collision
Explanation: In the 1991 Los Angeles airport runway collision, USAir Flight 1493, a Boeing 737 landing at Los Angeles International Airport, collided with SkyWest Airlines Flight 5569, a Fairchild Metro commuter plane waiting to take off from the same runway. All 12 people aboard the Metro and 23 of the 89 on the Boeing 737 were killed.

Title: 1983 Chosonminhang Il-62 crash
Explanation: A Chosonminhang Ilyushin Il-62 crashes in mountainous terrain near Labé, Guinea, killing all 23 on board.

Title: Air France Flight 447
Explanation: Air France Flight 447, an Airbus A330 flying from Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, to Paris, France, crashes in the Atlantic Ocean, killing all 228 people on board; bodies and aircraft debris are recovered within days but the main fuselage and the black boxes are not found until 2011; this remains the deadliest accident involving the A330.

Title: American Airlines Flight 1 (1962)
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 1, a Boeing 707 destined for Los Angeles, California, United States, crashed in Jamaica Bay, Queens, New York, due to a rudder malfunction; all 95 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: 1957 Blackbushe Viking accident
Explanation: In the 1957 Blackbushe Viking accident, an Eagle Aviation Vickers VC.1 Viking crashed after engine failure at Blackbushe Airport; of the 35 on board, only a passenger survives.

Title: 1974 Surgut mid-air collision
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 662, an Antonov An-2, collided in mid-air with a Mil Mi-8 helicopter near Surgut, Russia due to ATC errors, killing all 38 on board both aircraft.

Title: 1982 Aerocondor DHC-4 Caribou accident
Explanation: An Aerolíneas Cóndor de Havilland Canada DHC-4 Caribou flies into high ground in the Andes, Ecuador; all 44 on board are killed.

Title: TWA Flight 840 bombing (1986)
Explanation: TWA Flight 840, a Boeing 727, is bombed by Palestinian militants, killing four of the 121 people on board, the plane manages to land safely in Athens.

Title: 1919 Verona Caproni Ca.48 crash
Explanation: A Caproni Ca.48 crashed at Verona, Italy, during a flight from Venice to Taliedo, Milan, killing all on board (14, 15, or 17 people, according to different sources).

Title: 1947 BSAA Avro Lancastrian Star Dust accident
Explanation: In the 1947 BSAA Star Dust accident, an Avro Lancastrian airliner disappeared over the Andes after transmitting an enigmatic coded message ("STENDEC"); the fate of the aircraft remains a mystery for more than 50 years until the crash site is finally located in 2000; it is apparent that all 11 people on board died in the accident.

Title: 1977 Libyan Arab Airlines Tu-154 crash
Explanation: A Libyan Arab Airlines Tupolev Tu-154 crashed near Benghazi, Libya, due to fuel exhaustion, while en route from King Abdulaziz International Airport, Saudi Arabia, to Benina International Airport in Libya; 59 of the 165 people on board lost their lives.

Title: 1953 Skyways Avro York disappearance
Explanation: In the 1953 Skyways Avro York disappearance, a plane with 39 on board disappeared over the North Atlantic.

Title: 2023 Gold Coast mid-air collision
Explanation: In the 2023 Gold Coast mid-air collision, two Eurocopter EC130s operated by Sea World Helicopters collided near Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia, killing four and injuring eight.

Title: 2024 Haneda Airport runway collision
Explanation: In the 2024 Haneda Airport runway collision, Japan Airlines Flight 516, an Airbus A350 operating from New Chitose Airport to Haneda Airport, collided with a Japan Coast Guard De Havilland Canada Dash 8 aircraft while landing. All 379 occupants aboard the Japan Airlines flight were evacuated safely, while five of the six occupants aboard the Coast Guard aircraft were killed. Both aircraft were destroyed. This was the first hull loss of an Airbus A350. The destroyed DHC-8 was set to provide support in the response to the Noto earthquake the day prior.

Title: 1949 MacRobertson Miller Aviation DC-3 crash
Explanation: A MacRobertson Miller Airlines Douglas DC-3 crashed on takeoff from Perth, Western Australia, killing all 18 on board.

Title: 1948 Heathrow disaster
Explanation: In the 1948 Heathrow disaster, a Sabena DC-3 crashed at Heathrow Airport in poor visibility due to pilot error, killing 20 of 22 on board.

Title: 2021 South Sudan Supreme Airlines Let L-410 Turbolet crash
Explanation: A South Sudan Supreme Airlines Let L-410 Turbolet crashed whilst operating a domestic flight from Pieri to Yuai, South Sudan. All eight passengers and two crew members were killed.

Title: October 1926 Air Union Blériot 155 crash
Explanation: An Air Union Blériot 155 crashed at Leigh, Kent, England, after the aircraft caught fire in mid-air during an attempted emergency landing at Penshurst Airfield, killing all seven on board; this was the first in-flight fire to occur on an airliner.

Title: 1934 Hillman's Airways de Havilland Dragon Rapide crash
Explanation: A Hillman's Airways de Havilland Dragon Rapide crashed into the English Channel off Folkestone, Kent, due to pilot error, killing all seven on board.

Title: 1964 Mt. Alcazaba Union de Transports Aériens Douglas DC-6 crash
Explanation: A UTA Douglas DC-6 crashed into Mount Alcazaba, Spain due to an unexplained deviation from the flight route, killing all 80 on board.

Title: 1990 Guangzhou Baiyun airport collisions
Explanation: In the Guangzhou Baiyun airport collisions, a hijacked Boeing 737 operating Xiamen Airlines Flight 8301 clips China Southwest Airlines Flight 2402, a Boeing 707, during landing at Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport, and collides with China Southern Airlines Flight 2812, a Boeing 757; of the 225 occupants on board the three aircraft, 128 died.

Title: 1948 Australian National Airways DC-3 crash
Explanation: In the 1948 Lutana crash, Australian National Airways Flight 331, a Douglas DC-3, crashed into high terrain near Nundle, New South Wales, killing all 13 people on board.

Title: 1958 London Vickers Viking accident
Explanation: An Independent Air Travel Vickers VC.1 Viking crashed near Southall, Middlesex, killing all three crew on board and another four people on the ground.

Title: 2008 Blue Wing Airlines An-28 crash
Explanation: In the 2008 Blue Wing Airlines An-28 crash, an Antonov An-28 operated by Blue Wing Airlines crashes near Benzdorp in Suriname. All 19 on board are killed.

Title: LAN-Chile Flight 621
Explanation: LAN-Chile Flight 621, a Douglas DC-3, crashed in the Andes for reasons unknown, killing all 24 on board including footballers and coaching staff from the CD Green Cross Chilean football team. The fuselage was found in 2015.

Title: Air France Flight 212 (1969)
Explanation: Air France Flight 212, a Boeing 707-328B, crashes into the sea shortly after takeoff from Simón Bolívar International Airport with the loss of all 62 on board.

Title: 1990 Wayne County Airport runway collision
Explanation: In the 1990 Wayne County Airport runway collision, Northwest Airlines Flight 1482, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, collides with Northwest Airlines Flight 299, a Boeing 727, on a runway at Detroit Metropolitan Wayne County Airport; eight of the 54 people on board the DC-9 are killed; all 154 people on board the Boeing 727 survived.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 2003
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 2003, a Tupolev Tu-124, crashed just after takeoff from Vnukovo Airport due to instrument failure, killing all 61 passengers and crew on board and one person on the ground.

Title: Dan-Air Flight 1903
Explanation: Dan-Air Flight 1903, a de Havilland Comet 4 operating a flight from Manchester, England, to Barcelona, Spain, crashed near Arbúcies in Catalonia on approach to El Prat Josep Tarradellas Airport; all 112 people on board the aircraft were killed.

Title: 1968 BKS Air Transport Heathrow crash
Explanation: In the 1968 BKS Air Transport Heathrow crash, an Airspeed Ambassador freight aircraft experienced metal fatigue and crashed while landing, striking two unoccupied British European Airways airliners. Six of the freighter's crew of eight are killed, as are eight racehorses being transported. All Airspeed Ambassadors were grounded until a redesign strengthened the flaps.

Title: 1967 Air Ferry DC-4 accident
Explanation: In the 1967 Air Ferry DC-4 accident, a Douglas DC-4 struck a mountain en route from Manston Airport, England to Perpignan Airport, France due to crew errors stemming from carbon monoxide poisoning, killing all 88 on board.

Title: 2007 Paramount Airlines Mil Mi-8 crash
Explanation: In the 2007 Paramount Airlines Mil Mi-8 crash, a Mil Mi-8 helicopter crashes in Lungi, Sierra Leone, killing all 22 people on board.

Title: 1942 KNILM Douglas DC-3 shootdown
Explanation: KNILM Douglas DC-3 PK-AFV was shot down by three Japanese fighters and crashed 50 miles (80 km) north of Broome, Western Australia, killing four of 12 on board.

Title: 1952 Air France SNCASE Languedoc crash
Explanation: An Air France SNCASE Languedoc crashed on takeoff from Nice, France, due to jammed controls. All 38 people on board are killed.

Title: 1978 LAV HS 748 accident
Explanation: A Línea Aeropostal Venezolana Hawker Siddeley HS 748 crashes on departure from Simón Bolívar International Airport, Venezuela due to a possible instrument failure; all 46 on board were killed.

Title: United Airlines Flight 585
Explanation: United Airlines Flight 585, a Boeing 737, crashes while attempting to land at Colorado Springs Airport, Colorado, killing all 25 people on board. The cause of the crash is not identified until the investigation into the crash of USAir Flight 427 in 1994; both crashes are eventually attributed to defects in a valve associated with the rudder.

Title: 1946 American Overseas Airlines Douglas DC-4 crash
Explanation: An American Overseas Airlines Douglas DC-4 crashed into mountainous terrain after takeoff from Stephenville, Newfoundland, killing all 39 passengers and crew on board.

Title: 1955 MacArthur Airport United Air Lines crash
Explanation: A United Air Lines Douglas DC-6 crashes after takeoff from Long Island MacArthur Airport during a training flight due to pilot error, killing all three on board.

Title: TWA Flight 841 (1979)
Explanation: TWA Flight 841, a Boeing 727, went into a dive over Saginaw, Michigan, following the loss of the number seven slat; despite the loss of 34,000 feet (10,000 m) in altitude within 63 seconds, all 89 passengers and crew survived and the 727 made an emergency landing in Detroit after the first officer regained control of the plane at 5,000 feet (1,500 m).

Title: 2018 Ju-Air Junkers Ju 52 crash
Explanation: A Ju-Air Junkers Ju 52 crashes near Piz Segnas, Switzerland, killing all 20 on board.

Title: 1958 Aviaco SNCASE Languedoc crash
Explanation: An Aviaco SNCASE Languedoc crashed in the Guadarrama Mountains, killing all 21 people on board.

Title: 1965 Carmel mid-air collision
Explanation: The 1965 Carmel mid-air collision; Eastern Air Lines Flight 853, a Lockheed Super Constellation, collided with TWA Flight 42, a Boeing 707 over Carmel, New York. Flight 42 was able to land safely at John F. Kennedy International Airport with no casualties while Flight 853 was forced to crash land on Hunt Mountain near Danbury, Connecticut, killing three passengers and one of the pilots on board.

Title: Northwest Airlines Flight 5 (1990)
Explanation: Northwest Airlines Flight 5, a Boeing 727 with 145 on board, loses an engine over Madison, Florida and the aircraft makes an emergency landing at Tampa International Airport. All on board survive.

Title: 2008 Los Roques archipelago Transaven Let L-410 crash
Explanation: The 2008 Los Roques archipelago Transaven Let L-410 crash kills all 14 on board.

Title: 1948 Northwood mid-air collision
Explanation: The 1948 Northwood mid-air collision, between a Scandinavian Airlines System-operated Douglas DC-6 and an RAF Avro York, killed all 39 passengers and crew on board both aircraft.

Title: 2002 Prestige Airlines Boeing 707 crash
Explanation: In the 2002 Prestige Airlines Boeing 707 crash, a Boeing 707, crashes at Bangui Airport in the Central African Republic while attempting an emergency landing, killing 28 of 30 on board.

Title: 2011 Missinippi Airways Cessna 208 crash
Explanation: A Missinippi Airways Cessna 208 Caravan overran the runway and crashed into a ravine at Pukatawagan Airport, Manitoba, following a failed aborted takeoff. One passenger is killed.

Title: 2013 Compagnie Africaine d'Aviation Fokker 50 crash
Explanation: A Compagnie Africaine d'Aviation Fokker 50 crashed in poor weather conditions on approach to Goma International Airport, Democratic Republic of the Congo, killing all five crew and one of the four passengers on board.

Title: 2020 East African Express Airways Brasilia crash
Explanation: An East African Express Airways Embraer EMB 120 Brasilia crashed after being allegedly fired upon by Ethiopian ground forces during a charter cargo flight carrying pandemic relief supplies to Berdale, Somalia; all four passengers and two crew were killed.

Title: 1938 Jersey Airport disaster
Explanation: In the 1938 Jersey Airport disaster, a Jersey Airways de Havilland DH.86 crashed on take-off from Jersey Airport due to pilot error; all 13 passengers and crew lose their lives as well as one person on the ground.

Title: 2015 Juba An-12 crash
Explanation: In the 2015 Juba An-12 crash, an Allied Services, Ltd. Antonov An-12 crashes near the White Nile shortly after takeoff from Juba International Airport, killing 37 of 39 on board.

Title: 2007 Africa One Antonov An-26 crash
Explanation: The 2007 Africa One Antonov An-26 crashes into a residential area in Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of the Congo, shortly after taking off, killing at least 50 people, most of whom are on the ground.

Title: 1985 Bakhtar Afghan Airlines Antonov An-26 shootdown
Explanation: A Bakhtar Afghan Airlines Antonov An-26 is shot down over Afghanistan by a ground-to-air missile, while operating a domestic flight from Kandahar to Farah; all 52 people on board are killed.

Title: 2022 Mutiny Bay DHC-3 Otter crash
Explanation: A DHC-3 Turbine Otter crashed into Mutiny Bay killing all 10 on board. The flight was carrying tourists from Friday Harbor Seaplane Base to Renton Municipal Airport, Washington.

Title: 1948 Gatow air disaster
Explanation: In the 1948 Gatow air disaster, a British European Airways Vickers VC.1 Viking crashed near RAF Gatow, Berlin, following a collision with a Soviet Air Force Yakovlev Yak-3 fighter; all 14 people on board the Viking were killed, as well as the Soviet pilot.

Title: 1984 Biman Bangladesh Airlines Fokker F27 crash
Explanation: A Biman Bangladesh Airlines Fokker F27-600 crashed into a marsh near Zia International Airport in Dhaka, Bangladesh while landing in poor weather. With a total death toll of 49 people, it is the deadliest aviation disaster to occur on Bangladeshi soil.

Title: 1960 Douglas DC-4 Cochabamba crash
Explanation: In the 1960 Douglas DC-4 Cochabamba crash, a domestic flight from Cochabamba to La Paz, crashed shortly after take off following an apparent engine fire, killing all 59 on board; a technical defect was blamed.

Title: 1950 Sverdlovsk plane crash
Explanation: In the 1950 Sverdlovsk plane crash, a Lisunov Li-2 crashed near Sverdlovsk (now Yekaterinburg), Soviet Union, killing all 19 on board.

Title: 1953 Nutts Corner BEA Vickers Viking accident
Explanation: In the 1953 Nutts Corner BEA Vickers Viking accident, a Vickers Viking operated by British European Airways crashed on approach to Belfast-Nutts Corner Airport, killing 27 of the 31 on board.

Title: 1970 Spantax CV-990 crash
Explanation: A Spantax Convair 990 Coronado crashed shortly after takeoff from Stockholm's Arlanda Airport when the flight crew lost control of the aircraft; five of the ten people on board were killed.

Title: 1973 Nantes mid-air collision
Explanation: In the Nantes mid-air collision, an Iberia McDonnell Douglas DC-9 collided with a Spantax Convair CV-990. All 68 people on board the DC-9 were killed while the CV-990 was able to make a successful emergency landing at Cognac

Title: 2011 Garbuzovo Antonov An-148 crash
Explanation: An Antonov An-148 crashed near Garbuzovo during a test flight operated by VASO. All 6 people on board were killed.

Title: 1998 Occidental Petroleum Boeing 737 crash
Explanation: In the 1998 Occidental Petroleum Boeing 737 crash, a Boeing 737 leased from the Peruvian Air Force crashes while on approach to Alférez FAP Alfredo Vladimir Sara Bauer Airport, killing 75 of 88 on board.

Title: JS Air Flight 201
Explanation: JS Air Flight 201, a Beechcraft 1900 operating a domestic charter flight in Pakistan, crashed shortly after takeoff from Jinnah International Airport, Karachi, following an engine malfunction; all 21 people on board were killed.

Title: 2015 Senegal mid-air collision
Explanation: In the 2015 Senegal mid-air collision, a Boeing 737-800, collides in a mid-air with a BAe 125 air ambulance operated by Senegalair over eastern Senegal. The BAe 125 crashes in the Atlantic killing all seven on board, while the 737 lands safely without any injuries to those on board.

Title: 1961 Malév Hungarian Airlines Douglas C-47 Skytrain crash
Explanation: In the 1961 Malév Hungarian Airlines Douglas C-47 Skytrain crash, a Malév Douglas C-47 crashed into an apartment building in Zugló, Budapest during a sightseeing flight due to pilot error, killing all 27 on board and three more on the ground; all in the apartment survived.

Title: 1952 Bermuda air crash
Explanation: A Cubana de Aviación Douglas DC-4 stalled and crashed into the Atlantic Ocean off Bermuda shortly after takeoff from Kindley Air Force Base for reasons unknown, killing 37 of 41 on board.

Title: 2011 Silk Way Airlines Ilyushin Il-76 crash
Explanation: A Silk Way Airlines Ilyushin Il-76 crashed into a mountain 25 kilometres (16 mi) short of Bagram Air Base in Afghanistan, killing all nine people on board the cargo flight from Baku, operated on behalf of NATO.

Title: Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky Air Flight 251 (2021)
Explanation: Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky Air Enterprise Flight 251, an Antonov An-26 operating a domestic flight from Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky to Palana, Russia, crashed while approach. All 22 passengers and 6 crew were killed.

Title: 1976 Sabah Air GAF Nomad crash
Explanation: In the 1976 Sabah Air GAF Nomad crash, a GAF N-22B Nomad crashed into the sea on approach into Kota Kinabalu International Airport, Malaysia. All 11 passengers and crew were killed. Several local political leaders were on board at the time.

Title: Air France Flight 212 (1968)
Explanation: Air France Flight 212, a Boeing 707, crashed into the northwestern slope of La Soufrière Mountain in Guadeloupe with the loss of all 63 lives on board.

Title: 1962 Channel Airways Dakota accident
Explanation: A Channel Airways Douglas C-47 Dakota crashed into a hill on the Isle of Wight in bad weather, while en route from Jersey to London's Southend Airport, killing 12 of the 18 on board.

Title: 1929 Luft Hansa Junkers G 24 crash
Explanation: A Luft Hansa Junkers G 24 crashed near Marden Park in Godstone, Surrey, England, killing seven of the eight occupants on board.

Title: 1986 British International Helicopters Chinook crash
Explanation: In the 1986 British International Helicopters Chinook crash, a Boeing 234LR Chinook crashes on approach to Sumburgh Airport, Shetland Islands; of 47 people on board, 45 die.

Title: 1929 Jask Imperial Airways de Havilland Hercules crash
Explanation: An Imperial Airways de Havilland Hercules crashed whilst landing at Jask Airport, Iran, killing three of the five occupants on board.

Title: 1922 Picardie mid-air collision
Explanation: In the Picardie mid-air collision, a De Havilland DH.18A, G-EAWO, operated by Daimler Hire Ltd., collided with a Farman F.60 Goliath, F-GEAD, operated by Compagnie des Grands Express Aériens (CGEA), over the Thieulloy-St. Antoine road near Picardie, France, killing all seven people on both aircraft. This is the first mid-air collision of two airliners.

Title: 1995 Air St. Martin Beech 1900 crash
Explanation: In the 1995 Air St. Martin Beech 1900 crash, a Beechcraft 1900D crashes near Belle-Anse, Haiti, killing all 20 people on board.

Title: 2009 Manaus Aerotáxi crash
Explanation: A Manaus Aerotáxi Embraer EMB 110 crashes in the Amazon basin near Santo António, Brazil, due to overloading, killing 24 of the 28 people on board.

Title: 2013 Rediske Air Otter crash
Explanation: A Rediske Air DHC-3 crashed on takeoff from Soldotna Airport, Alaska, killing all 10 people on board.

Title: 1949 Strato-Freight Curtiss C-46A crash
Explanation: In the 1949 Strato-Freight Curtiss C-46A crash, a Curtiss Wright C-46A-50 Modified D, crashed into the Atlantic Ocean shortly after takeoff from San Juan, Puerto Rico. Of the 81 passengers and crew on board, 53 are killed.

Title: 1977 Tavda mid-air collision
Explanation: Two Aeroflot Antonov An-2s collided near Tavda, Russia, killing all 29 people on board both aircraft.

Title: 1961 Derby Aviation crash
Explanation: In the 1961 Derby Aviation crash, a Douglas Dakota, crashed into Canigou mountainside en route to Perpignan from London due to a navigation error, killing all 34 aboard.

Title: 2011 Lokomotiv Yaroslavl plane crash
Explanation: A Yak-Service Yakovlev Yak-42 crashed shortly after takeoff from Tunoshna Airport, Yaroslavl, Russia, due to pilot error, killing 44 of the 45 people on board. Many were players and staff of the Lokomotiv Yaroslavl ice hockey team of the KHL, as the flight was destined for Minsk, Belarus for a league game.

Title: 1967 Cordillera Carpish Faucett Perú Douglas C-54 crash
Explanation: A Faucett Perú Douglas C-54 crashed into a mountain near Cordillera de Carpish, Peru, killing all 72 on board.

Title: 1987 Alianza Lima plane crash
Explanation: In the 1987 Alianza Lima plane crash, a chartered Peruvian Navy Fokker F-27, crashes into the Pacific Ocean 7 miles (11 km) from Jorge Chávez International Airport, whilst carrying the Peruvian football team Alianza Lima. Of the 44 people on board, only the pilot survive.

Title: 1993 Tehran mid-air collision
Explanation: In the 1993 Tehran mid-air collision, an Iran Air Tours Tupolev Tu-154 collides in mid-air with an Iranian Air Force Sukhoi Su-24, killing all 133 on board both aircraft.

Title: Air Midwest Flight 5481
Explanation: Air Midwest Flight 5481, a Beechcraft 1900, crashes on takeoff from Charlotte, North Carolina, United States; all 19 passengers and two pilots are killed.

Title: 1996 Air Africa crash
Explanation: In the 1996 Air Africa crash, an overloaded Antonov An-32 operated by Moscow Airways aborts takeoff and overruns into a market in Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of the Congo, killing 227 people on the ground.

Title: 1962 Taurus Mountains Turkish Airlines F-27 crash
Explanation: A Turkish Airlines Fairchild F-27 crashed into the Bolkar Mountains while on approach to Turkey's Adana Airport, killing all 11 on board.

Title: 1994 Sahara Airlines Boeing 737 crash
Explanation: A Sahara Airlines Boeing 737 crashes during a training flight into an Aeroflot Ilyushin Il-86 at New Delhi, India, killing all eight on both aircraft and one on the ground.

Title: Ameristar Charters Flight 9363
Explanation: Ameristar Charters Flight 9363, an MD-83 chartered to fly the Michigan Wolverines men's basketball team to the 2017 Big Ten Men's Basketball Tournament in Washington, D.C., overruns the runway on takeoff at Willow Run Airport, Ypsilanti, Michigan after suffering a jammed elevator. The aircraft is damaged but all 116 on board survive.

Title: 2003 Congo air disaster
Explanation: In the 2003 Congo air disaster, a Ukrainian Cargo Airways Ilyushin Il-76 suffers a rapid decompression after a cargo door opens mid-flight. The aircraft manages to return to Kinshasa, but not before between 17 and 200 civilians are sucked out to their deaths (casualty numbers vary depending on source).

Title: 1940 Deutsche Lufthansa Ju 90 crash
Explanation: A Deutsche Lufthansa Ju 90 crashed near Schönteichen in Saxony, Germany due to tail icing, killing all 29 passengers and crew on board.

Title: American Airlines Flight 383 (1965)
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 383, a Boeing 727, crashed while on approach to Greater Cincinnati airport; of the 62 people on board, one flight attendant and three passengers survive.

Title: 1983 TAAG Angola Airlines Boeing 737 crash
Explanation: TAAG Angola Airlines Flight 462, a Boeing 737-200, crashes shortly after takeoff from Lubango Airport killing all 130 on board die; the cause is disputed: UNITA guerillas claim to have shot the aircraft down while Angolan authorities conclude that the aircraft suffered a mechanical failure.

Title: TWA Flight 841 (1974)
Explanation: TWA Flight 841, a Boeing 707, broke up after a bomb exploded in the cargo hold and plunged into the Ionian Sea, killing all 88 on board.

Title: 2009 Aviastar British Aerospace 146 crash
Explanation: An Aviastar BAe 146-300 crashes into Pikei Hill during a domestic cargo flight from Jayapura to Wamena, Indonesia, killing all six crew members on board.

Title: 1936 KLM Croydon accident
Explanation: A KLM Douglas DC-2 crashed on takeoff from Croydon Airport, England; 15 of 17 on board died.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 3739 (1976)
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 3739, a Tupolev Tu-104, crashed on takeoff from Irkutsk after the aircraft rolled to the right, killing 24 of 114 on board.

Title: 2007 Balad aircraft crash
Explanation: An AerianTur-M Antonov An-26 crashes near Balad, Iraq, killing 34 of the 35 people on board. The official cause of the crash is poor weather conditions, but other sources claim that the plane was shot down by a missile.

Title: 2005 Logan Airport runway incursion
Explanation: In the 2005 Logan Airport runway incursion, US Airways Flight 1170, a Boeing 737, and Aer Lingus Flight 132, an Airbus A330, almost collide on a runway at Logan International Airport in Boston, Massachusetts. None of the 381 people on either plane is harmed.

Title: 2019 Colombia DC-3 crash
Explanation: A Laser Aéreo Douglas DC-3 crashed while attempting to land at La Vanguardia Airport, Villavicencio, Colombia, killing all 11 passengers and three crew members on board the aircraft.

Title: 1934 Air France Wibault 282T crash
Explanation: An Air France Wibault 282T crashed into the English Channel off Dungeness, Kent, killing all six on board.

Title: 2012 Mount Salak Sukhoi Superjet crash
Explanation: A Sukhoi Superjet 100 crashed, into Mount Salak, Indonesia, on an exhibition flight, killing all 45 passengers and crew on board.

Title: 1976 Anapa mid-air collision
Explanation: In the 1976 Anapa mid-air collision, Aeroflot Flight 7957, an Antonov An-24, collided with Aeroflot Flight C-31, a Yakovlev Yak-40, over the Black Sea off Anapa due to ATC and crew errors, killing all 70 on board both aircraft.

Title: 2018 Horizon Air Q400 incident
Explanation: In the 2018 Horizon Air Q400 incident, a Horizon Air Bombardier Dash 8 Q400 with no passengers on board, is stolen from Seattle

Title: 1935 SABENA Savoia-Marchetti S.73 crash
Explanation: A SABENA Savoia-Marchetti S.73 crashed near Tatsfield, Surrey, England, due to pilot error, while en route from Brussels Airport, Belgium, to Croydon Airport in South London; all 11 people on board died in the accident.

Title: 1930 Air Union Farman Goliath crash
Explanation: An Air Union Farman F.63 Goliath crashed during an emergency landing at Marden Airfield, Marden, Kent, following failure of the right tailplane, killing two of the six on board.

Title: 1952 Aer Lingus C-47 accident
Explanation: An Aer Lingus C-47 crashed near Llyn Gwynant after encountering a mountain wave triggered by Snowdon, killing all 23 on board.[1]

Title: 1984 Balkan Bulgarian Tupolev Tu-134 crash
Explanation: A Balkan Bulgarian Tupolev Tu-134 crashed into a forest near Sofia, Bulgaria, during a snowstorm killing all 50 people on board.

Title: 1965 Skyways Coach-Air Avro 748 crash
Explanation: A Skyways Coach-Air Avro 748 crashed on landing at Lympne Airport, Kent, United Kingdom, due to a waterlogged runway; all 52 on board survive; this crash marks the first loss of the Avro 748/HS 748.

Title: 1974 EgyptAir Tupolev Tu-154 crash
Explanation: An EgyptAir Tupolev Tu-154 crashed near Cairo International Airport during a training flight, killing all six crew members on board.

Title: Swiss International Air Lines Flight 850
Explanation: Swiss International Air Lines Flight 850, a Saab 2000, strikes an earth bank after landing at Werneuchen Airfield, Germany, after multiple diversions due to a storm system; all 20 on board survive the accident but the aircraft is written off.

Title: 1973 Royal Nepal Airlines DHC-6 hijacking
Explanation: In the 1973 Royal Nepal Airlines DHC-6 hijacking, a De Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter operated by Royal Nepal Airlines was hijacked after takeoff from Biratnagar Airport, Nepal. The hijackers forced the pilot-in-command to land in a grass field in Forbesganj, Bihar, India. All 19 occupants survived.

Title: 1946 Australian National Airways DC-3 crash
Explanation: The 1946 Australian National Airways DC-3 crash near Hobart, Tasmania, killed all 25 on board.

Title: 1949 Queensland Airlines Lockheed Lodestar crash
Explanation: A Queensland Airlines Lockheed Lodestar crashed on takeoff from Coolangatta airstrip, killing all 21 on board.

Title: 1971 Indian Ocean Vickers Viscount crash
Explanation: A Merpati Nusantara Vickers Viscount 828 crashed in the Indian Ocean off the west coast of Sumatra, Indonesia, on approach to Tab ing Airport in Padang, due to poor visibility in bad weather; all 69 people on board were killed.

Title: 1998 Lignes Aériennes Congolaises crash
Explanation: The 1998 Lignes Aériennes Congolaises crash occurs when rebels using a Strela 2 missile shoot down the Boeing 727, which crashes near Kindu, Democratic Republic of Congo, killing all 41 on board.

Title: 1976 Zagreb mid-air collision
Explanation: In the 1976 Zagreb mid-air collision,  British Airways Flight 476, a Hawker Siddeley Trident, and Inex-Adria Aviopromet Flight 550, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, collided near Zagreb, Yugoslavia, killing all 176 people on board both aircraft.

Title: 1967 Air Algérie DC-4 crash
Explanation: An Air Algérie DC-4 crashed into a mountain near Tamanrasset, Algeria, killing 35 of 39 on board.

Title: 1979 Dniprodzerzhynsk mid-air collision
Explanation: The 1979 Dniprodzerzhynsk mid-air collision between two Aeroflot Tupolev Tu-134s killed 178.

Title: 1947 BOAC Douglas C-47 crash
Explanation: In the 1947 BOAC Douglas C-47 crash, a BOAC Douglas C-47A crashed into Barley Hill near Stowting, Kent, United Kingdom, due to fuel starvation, killing eight of the 16 on board.

Title: 1979 Garuda Fokker F28 crash
Explanation: A Garuda Indonesia Fokker F28 struck a volcano on approach to Medan Airport, Indonesia, killing all 61 on board.

Title: 1983 Avensa Douglas DC-9 crash
Explanation: In the 1983 Avensa Douglas DC-9 crash, a Douglas DC-9 crashes at Barquisimeto Airport, Venezuela, killing 22 passengers and one crew member.

Title: 2010 Tarco Airlines Antonov An-24 crash
Explanation: A Tarco Airlines Antonov An-24 crashed on landing at Zalingei Airport, Sudan, killing 2-6 of the 44 occupants on board.

Title: 1961 President Airlines Douglas DC-6 crash
Explanation: A President Airlines Douglas DC-6 crashed shortly after takeoff from Shannon Airport en route to Gander due to loss of control caused by possible pilot error, killing all 83 passengers and crew on board. The crash remains the worst in Irish territory.

Title: Delta Air Lines Flight 1989
Explanation: Delta Air Lines Flight 1989, a Boeing 767-332ER was a scheduled flight from Logan International Airport to Los Angeles International Airport. The plane experienced a suspected hijacking and safely landed at Cleveland Hopkins International Airport.

Title: 1990 Faucett Perú Boeing 727 disappearance
Explanation: A Faucett Perú Boeing 727 on a re-positioning flight disappears in an area of the Atlantic Ocean approximately 180 miles (160 nmi; 290 km) southeast of Cape Race, Newfoundland, Canada with 16 passengers and crew on board.

Title: 1952 Palmeiras de Goias Transportes Aéreos Nacional Douglas C-47 crash
Explanation: A Transportes Aéreos Nacional Douglas C-47A crashes on a domestic flight in Brazil following an in-flight fire; all 24 on board die.

Title: 1955 Cincinnati mid-air collision
Explanation: TWA Flight 694, a Martin 2-0-2, collided with a privately owned Douglas DC-3 over Cincinnati, Ohio, killing all 15 on board both aircraft.

Title: ČSA Flight 511 (July 1961)
Explanation: ČSA Flight 511, an Ilyushin Il-18, crashed at Anfa Airport, Morocco for reasons unknown, killing all 72 on board.

Date:
1950 Air France multiple Douglas DC-4 accidents:
June 12
Title: 1950 Air France multiple Douglas DC-4 accidents
Explanation:
An Air France Douglas DC-4 (F-BBDE) on a flight from Saigon to Paris crashed in the Arabian Sea while on approach to Bahrain Airport, killing 46 of 52 on board.
June 14

Title: 1982 TABA Fairchild FH-227 accident
Explanation: A TABA Fairchild FH-227 crashes at Tabatinga Airport, Brazil; all 44 on board are killed.

Title: 2011 Lightship Europe airship crash
Explanation: A Lightship Europe airship crashed and caught fire while landing in Reichelsheim, Germany, after a flight from Oberursel, killing one of the 4 people on board.

Title: Northwest Airlines Flight 4422
Explanation: Northwest Airlines Flight 4422, a Douglas C-54 Skymaster, crashed into Mount Sanford in the Alaska Territory (now Alaska), killing all 30 on board; although found, the wreckage was initially inaccessible and was not rediscovered until 1999 after being buried for more than 50 years.

Title: 1948 Sabena Douglas DC-4 crash
Explanation: In the 1948 Sabena Douglas DC-4 crash, a Douglas DC-4 crashed near Libenge, Belgian Congo (now Democratic Republic of the Congo) after flying into a tornado, killing 31 of 32 on board.

Title: 1962 Godthab Catalina crash
Explanation: An Eastern Provincial Airlines Canso flying boat sunk at Godthab Harbour, Greenland, killing 15 of the 21 on board.

Title: 2021 Centennial Airport mid-air collision
Explanation: Key Lime Air Flight 970, a Swearingen Metroliner on a chartered cargo flight from Salida, Colorado, collided with a Cirrus SR22 on approach to Centennial Airport, Colorado. The Cirrus crash-landed in a nearby field whilst the Swearingen Metroliner made an emergency landing. All three occupants on both aircraft survived.

Title: 1996 Charkhi Dadri mid-air collision
Explanation: 1996 Charkhi Dadri mid-air collision: Saudi Arabian Airlines Flight 763, a Boeing 747, collides in mid-air with Kazakhstan Airlines Flight 1907, an Ilyushin Il-76, near Charkhi Dadri, India. All 312 on board the Boeing 747 and all 37 on board the Ilyushin Il-76 are killed. It is the deadliest mid-air collision in aviation history.

Title: 1948 Aeroflot Ilyushin Il-12 crash
Explanation: An Aeroflot Ilyushin Il-12 disappeared over the Caucasus Mountains near Yevlakh, Azerbaijan with ten on board.

Title: Air France Flight 2005
Explanation: Air France Flight 2005, a Sud Aviation Caravelle, crashes on approach to Rabat

Title: Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky Air Flight 251 (2012)
Explanation: Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky Air Flight 251, an Antonov An-28, crashed in Kamchatka Peninsula, Russia, killing 10 of the 14 passengers and crew on board.

Title: 2016 Sunbird Aviation crash
Explanation: A Sunbird Aviation Britten-Norman Islander crashes on approach to Kiunga Airport in the Western Province of Papua New Guinea, while operating a non-scheduled domestic charter flight, killing all 12 on board.

Title: 1939 Pan Am Sikorsky S-43 crash
Explanation: A Pan Am Sikorsky S-43 crashed into Guanabara Bay, Brazil, due to loss of control following engine failure, killing 12 of the 14 on board.

Title: 1981 Bristow Helicopters Westland Wessex crash
Explanation: In the G-ASWI North Sea ditching, a Bristow Helicopters Westland Wessex suffered an engine failure and ditched in the North Sea, killing all 13 on board.

Title: 1923 Aeromarine 75 Columbus incident
Explanation: An Aeromarine 75 seaplane of Aeromarine West Indies Airways, Columbus, rapidly sank after a botched ditching in the Straits of Florida north of Havana, Cuba, leading to the deaths of four passengers out of the nine occupants in the first airliner disaster of American aviation.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 31 (1955)
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 31, a Lisunov Li-2, crashed on takeoff from Bykovo Airport due to engine failure caused by sabotage, killing the five crew.

Title: 2000 Marsa Brega Short 360 crash
Explanation: A Short 360 operated by Avisto ditches into the sea near Marsa Brega, Libya, as a result of ice buildup, killing 22 of the 41 passengers and crew on board.

Title: 1928 Imperial Airways Vickers Vulcan crash
Explanation: In the 1928 Imperial Airways Vickers Vulcan crash, an Imperial Airways Vickers Vulcan on a test flight from Croydon Airport, England, crashed near Purley, Surrey, 3 miles (4.8 km) from the airport resulting in the deaths of four passengers.

Title: 1988 British International Helicopters Sikorsky S-61N crash
Explanation: The 1988 British International Helicopters Sikorsky S-61N crash: a Sikorsky S-61 ditches in the North Sea due to an engine fire; all 21 on board survive.

Title: 1954 BOAC Lockheed Constellation crash
Explanation: A BOAC Lockheed L-749A Constellation crashed as it attempts to land at Kallang Airport, Singapore; of the 40 passengers and crew on board, 33 are killed.

Title: 2019 Alaska mid-air collision
Explanation: A Taquan Air de Havilland Canada DHC-3 Turbine Otter collided in mid-air with a Mountain Air Service de Havilland Canada DHC-2 Beaver floatplane, while both were operating sightseeing flights over George Inlet, Alaska, United States; the DHC-2 pilot and all four passengers were killed; the DHC-3 attempted an emergency water landing with the loss of one of its 10 passengers.

Title: 1950 Tête de l'Obiou C-54 crash
Explanation: In the 1950 Tête de l'Obiou C-54 crash, a Douglas C-54 Skymaster operated by Curtiss Reid Flying Services crashed 30 miles (48 km) from Grenoble, France, on the Tête de l'Obiou mountain; all 52 passengers and crew die.

Title: 1972 Königs Wusterhausen air disaster
Explanation: In the 1972 Königs Wusterhausen air disaster, an Interflug Ilyushin Il-62 flying from East Germany to Bulgaria, crashed near Königs Wusterhausen, to the southeast of Berlin; all 156 passengers and crew were killed. This was Germany's worst air disaster.

Title: 1920 Golders Green Handley Page O/400 crash
Explanation: A Handley Page O/400 hit a tree and crashed at Golders Green, London, after failing to gain height following takeoff, killing four out of eight on board.

Title: 1942 Aeroflot Tupolev ANT-20bis crash
Explanation: 1942 Aeroflot Tupolev ANT-20bis crash: A Tupolev ANT-20bis crashed outside of Tashkent, after a passenger took control and turned off the autopilot, killing 36.

Title: Loganair Flight 6780
Explanation: Loganair Flight 6780, a Saab 2000, nosedived after a lightning strike. The crew made a safe emergency landing back at Aberdeen. All 33 passengers and crew were unharmed.

Title: American Airlines Flight 1 (1936)
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 1, a Douglas DC-2, crashed into a swamp near Goodwin, Arkansas for reasons unknown, killing all 17 passengers and crew on board.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 5008 (1967) (page does not exist)
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 5007, an Antonov An-12, crashed shortly after takeoff from Tolmachevo Airport following an in-flight fire, killing the six crew.

Title: 2019 Saha Airlines Boeing 707 crash
Explanation: A Saha Airlines Boeing 707 crashed after overshooting the runway at Fath Air Base in Iran, after the crew attempted to land at the wrong airport; 15 of the 16 occupants on board were killed.

Title: May 1923 Air Union Farman Goliath crash
Explanation: An Air Union Farman F.60 Goliath crashed near Monsures, Somme, France, due to the structural failure of a wing, killing all six on board.

Title: 1977 Dan-Air Boeing 707 crash
Explanation: A Dan-Air Boeing 707 crashed near Lusaka Airport, Zambia after a multi-leg flight from London's Heathrow Airport, via Athens and Nairobi, due to structural failure; the one passenger and five crew members are killed.

Title: 2012 Agni Air Dornier 228 crash
Explanation: A Dornier Do-228 crashed, near Jomsom Airport, Nepal, during a go-around; of the 21 on board, 6 survived.

Title: 1946 KLM Douglas DC-3 Amsterdam accident
Explanation: In the 1946 KLM Douglas DC-3 Amsterdam accident, a Douglas DC-3 crashed while attempting to land at Amsterdam Schiphol Airport in the Netherlands; all 26 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: 1953 Sabena Convair CV-240 crash
Explanation: A Sabena Convair 240 lost control and crashed shortly after takeoff from Frankfurt Airport following double engine failure, killing all 44 on board.

Title: 2011 Moremi Air Cessna 208 crash
Explanation: A Cessna 208 Grand Caravan crashed shortly after taking off from Xakanaka Airstrip, Botswana. The pilot and seven passengers are killed, with four passengers surviving the crash.

Title: 2017 Valan International Antonov An-26 crash
Explanation: In the 2017 Valan International Antonov An-26 crash, an Antonov An-26 crashes into the sea just short of Abidjan's Félix Houphouët Boigny International Airport, Ivory Coast. Four of the ten occupants are killed.

Title: 1923 Daimler Airway de Havilland DH.34 crash
Explanation: A Daimler Airway de Havilland DH.34 crashed at Ivinghoe, Buckinghamshire, England, after stalling while attempting an emergency landing, killing all five on board.

Title: 1983 Guilin Airport collision
Explanation: In the 1983 Guilin Airport collision, a PLAAF Harbin H-5 bomber collides with a CAAC Hawker Siddeley Trident 2E as it taxies for takeoff at Guilin Qifengling Airport, China. 11 of the 106 occupants aboard the Trident are killed. It is unknown how many casualties, if any, occurred aboard the Harbin H-5.

Title: SAETA Flight 232
Explanation: SAETA Flight 232, a Vickers Viscount 785D, went missing mid-route from Quito to Cuenca, Ecuador; all four crew members and 55 passengers were killed, but the scene remains undiscovered for 26 years until October 2002, when climbers on the eastern face of the stratovolcano Chimborazo came upon the site.

Title: 2010 Okhaldhunga Twin Otter crash
Explanation: A Tara Air DHC-6 Twin Otter crashed in the Bilandu Forest near Shreechaur, Okhaldhunga District, Nepal, killing all 22 passengers and crew on board.

Title: 1947 Avianca Douglas DC-4 crash
Explanation: An Avianca Douglas DC-4 crashed into Mount El Tabalazo due to pilot error, killing all 53 passengers and crew on board.

Title: 1970 Dominicana de Aviación DC-9 crash
Explanation: A Dominicana Douglas DC-9 crashed shortly after takeoff from Santo Domingo in the Dominican Republic, due to a dual-engine failure; all 102 people on board were killed.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 5003 (1977)
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 5003, an Ilyushin Il-18 operating a domestic flight in the western Soviet Union, crashed due to pilot error after a missed approach to Mineralnye Vody Airport, killing 77 of the 98 people on board.

Title: 1976 Taxi Aereo el Venado Douglas DC-4 accident
Explanation: In the Taxi Aereo el Venado Douglas DC-4 accident, a Douglas DC-4 crashed into a mountain in Colombia killing all 13 on board.

Title: 1951 LOT Li-2 Tuszyn air disaster
Explanation: A LOT Polish Airlines Lisunov Li-2 crashed near Tuszyn shortly after takeoff due to engine failure, killing all 16 passengers and crew on board.

Title: 1957 Aquila Airways Solent crash
Explanation: In the 1957 Aquila Airways Solent crash, a flying boat crashed near Chessell, Isle of Wight, UK, due to engine failure, killing 45 of 58 on board.

Title: 2000 ASA Pesada Antonov An-24 crash
Explanation: An ASA Pesada Antonov An-24RV crashes shortly after takeoff from Luanda's Quatro de Fevereiro International Airport, Angola, after suffering a catastrophic engine failure; all 57 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: 1972 Thandwe crash
Explanation: A Burma Airways Douglas C-47 crashed into the sea shortly after departing from Thandwe Airport in Burma, killing 25 of the 28 on board.

Title: 1951 Miami Airlines C-46 crash
Explanation: A Miami Airlines Curtiss C-46 Commando crashed at Elizabeth, New Jersey, due to loss of control following an engine fire, killing all 58 passengers and crew on board.

Title: 1960 New York mid-air collision
Explanation: The 1960 New York mid-air collision: United Airlines Flight 826, a Douglas DC-8, and TWA Flight 266, a Lockheed Super Constellation, collided in mid-air over Staten Island in New York; all 128 aboard the two planes and six people on the ground are killed. This is the first crash in which a flight recorder was used to provide details in a crash investigation. The accident was the deadliest aviation disaster in history at the time.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 2022
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 2022, a Tupolev Tu-124, crashed near Karacharovo, Russia after entering a nosedive following a failure in the horizontal stabilizer, killing all 51 on board.

Title: 1983 British Airways Sikorsky S-61 crash
Explanation: A British Airways Sikorsky S-61 helicopter crashes into the sea off the Isles of Scilly; 20 of 26 people on board die, in the worst helicopter accident in the United Kingdom to date and results in a review of helicopter safety.

Title: 2002 Bristow Helicopters Sikorsky S-76A crash
Explanation: In the 2002 Bristow Helicopters Sikorsky S-76A crash, a Sikorsky S-76 helicopter carrying oil workers between platforms crashed into the North Sea northeast of Cromer, United Kingdom, killing all 11 on board.

Title: 2005 Equatorial Express Airlines An-24 crash
Explanation: An Equatorial Express Antonov An-24 crashes into a mountainside near Baney in Equatorial Guinea, killing all 60 people on board.

Title: 1978 Balkan Bulgarian Tupolev Tu-134 crash
Explanation: In the 1978 Balkan Bulgarian Tupolev Tu-134 crash, a Tupolev Tu-134 crashed near the village of Gabare, Bulgaria, killing all 73 people on board.

Title: 1937 Sabena Junkers Ju 52 Ostend crash
Explanation: The 1937 Sabena Junkers Ju 52 Ostend crash killed all 11 on board, including the Grand Duke Georg Donatus and Grand Duchess Cecilie of Hesse.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 315 (1959)
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 315, an Antonov An-10, entered a nosedive and crashed on approach to Lviv Airport due to tail icing, killing all 40 on board.

Title: 2023 Manaus Aerotáxi Embraer Bandeirante crash
Explanation: A Manaus Aerotaxi Embraer Bandeirante crashed into an embankment on approach to Barcelos Airport, Brazil, while performing a go-around, killing all 14 occupants on board.

Title: 1957 Kiev mid-air collision
Explanation: In the 1957 Kiev mid-air collision, two Ilyushin Il-14s collided over Kiev, Ukraine killing all nine on board both aircraft; six people on the ground also die.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 36 (1960)
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 36, an Ilyushin Il-18, crashed near Tarasovich, Ukraine following an engine fire, killing all 34 on board.

Title: 1973 Rome airport attacks and hijacking
Explanation: In the 1973 Rome airport attacks and hijacking, armed gunmen killed two people in the terminal, then firebombed Pan Am Flight 110, a Boeing 707, killing 30 inside the aircraft. The gunmen then hijacked Lufthansa Flight 303, a Boeing 737 en route to Munich, killing two more before landing and surrendering in Kuwait.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 36 (1976)
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight N-36, an Antonov An-24, crashed on approach to Kiev-Zhuilany Airport, killing 48 of 55 on board.

Title: 2012 Amazon Sky An-26 crash
Explanation: An Amazon Sky An-26 crashed into steep terrain in Peru killing the four crew on board.

Title: 1959 Turkish Airlines Gatwick crash
Explanation: In the 1959 Turkish Airlines Gatwick crash, a chartered Vickers Viscount 793 carrying the Turkish prime minister and other government officials crashed in heavy fog during its final approach into London Gatwick Airport; five of the eight crew and nine of the 16 passengers die in the accident; Prime Minister Adnan Menderes is among the 10 survivors.

Title: 1929 Imperial Airways Handley Page W.10 crash
Explanation: An Imperial Airways Handley Page W.10 ditched in the English Channel due to an engine failure, killing seven of the 13 on board.

Title: 2001 Faraz Qeshm Airlines Yak-40 crash
Explanation: In the 2001 Faraz Qeshm Airlines Yak-40 crash, a Yakovlev Yak-40 crashes into mountains en route to Gorgan Airport, Iran amid poor weather conditions; all 30 passengers and crew are killed, including Iran's Minister of Roads and Transportation, Rahman Dadman.

Title: 1958 Aeroflot Tu-104 Kanash crash
Explanation: An Aeroflot Tupolev Tu-104 crashed near Kanash, Russia due to a loss of control after encountering severe turbulence, killing all 80 on board.

Title: PenAir Flight 3296
Explanation: PenAir Flight 3296, a Saab 2000 flying from Anchorage, Alaska, United States, to Amaknak Island off the Alaskan coast, overshot the runway after landing in erratic wind conditions, critically injuring two of the 42 people on board, one of whom died the next day.

Title: August 1926 Air Union Blériot 155 crash
Explanation: An Air Union Blériot 155 crashed during a failed emergency landing attempt at College Farm in Aldington, Kent, England, after experiencing an engine failure. Two of the 15 on board were killed on impact and the pilot died of his injuries one day later.

Title: 1949 Sabena DC-3 Crash
Explanation: A Sabena Douglas DC-3 crashed after suffering a structural failure of a wing, killing all eight on board.

Title: 1995 Trans Service Airlift Electra crash
Explanation: In the 1995 Trans Service Airlift Electra crash, a Lockheed L-188 Electra crashes shortly after takeoff from Jamba, Angola, due to overloading and shifting baggage; of the 144 people on board, only three survive.

Title: 1986 Aerovías Guatemala air crash
Explanation: In the 1986 Aerovías Guatemala air crash, a Sud Aviation SE-210 Caravelle crashes into a hill on approach into Santa Elena Airport, Guatemala. All 94 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: 1981 Armenia mid-air collision
Explanation: A Soviet Air Defence Forces Sukhoi SU-15 collided with an Argentine Canadair CL-44 operating an international cargo flight between Iran and Cyprus; the SU-15 pilot ejected and survived the incident, but all four occupants of the CL-44 were killed.

Title: Aerolift Philippines Flight 075
Explanation: Aerolift Philippines Flight 075, a Beechcraft 1900, crashes into a house in the suburban Paranaque neighborhood in Manila just after takeoff from Ninoy Aquino International Airport due to an engine failure; all 21 passengers and crew members on board are killed as well as four people inside the house.

Title: 2016 Silk Way Airlines Antonov An-12 crash
Explanation: In the 2016 Silk Way Airlines Antonov An-12 crash,  a Silk Way Airlines Antonov An-12 cargo plane crashes after an engine failure, killing seven and injuring two.

Title: 2009 Pel-Air Westwind ditching
Explanation: An IAI 1124 Westwind ditches in the Pacific Ocean 3.2 nautical miles (6 km) west of Norfolk Island after failing to land at the island's airport, en route from Samoa to Melbourne, Australia; all six people on board survive the incident.

Title: 1961 Ndola Transair Sweden DC-6 crash
Explanation: In the 1961 Ndola Transair Sweden DC-6 crash, a Douglas DC-6B carrying Dag Hammarskjöld, second Secretary-General of the United Nations, crashes near Ndola, killing all 16 on board.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 213 (1962)
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 213, an Ilyushin Il-14 operating a domestic flight in the Soviet Union, crashed near Chersky Airport, Sakha Republic, after controlled flight into terrain caused by poor weather; all 32 people on board are killed.

Title: 1981 Zheleznogorsk mid-air collision
Explanation: In the 1981 Zheleznogorsk mid-air collision, a Yakovlev Yak-40 collided with a Mil Mi-8 helicopter, both operated by Aeroflot, near Zheleznogorsk-Ilimskiy Airport due to ATC errors, killing all 40 occupants on both aircraft.

Title: 1949 Manchester DC-3 accident
Explanation: A British European Airways Douglas DC-3 crashed into a hillside near Oldham, United Kingdom; of the 32 on board, only eight survive.

Title: 1959 Transair Douglas Dakota accident
Explanation: A Transair Douglas Dakota crashed into a mountain in Spain, killing all 32 on board.

Title: 2012 Sudan Antonov An-26 crash
Explanation: An Alfa Airlines Antonov An-24-100 crashed in the Nuba mountain range near Talodi, Sudan, on approach to Talodi Airstrip, killing all 32 people on board.

Title: 1946 Railway Air Services Dakota crash
Explanation: In the 1946 Railway Air Services Dakota crash, a Douglas DC-3 crashed shortly after taking off from Northolt Airport, England and comes to rest on top of a house. All five occupants survive the crash without injury.

Title: 1962 LOT Vickers Viscount Warsaw crash
Explanation: A LOT Vickers Viscount Warsaw crashed on approach to Okecie International Airport, Warsaw, Poland, due to loss of control; all 33 passengers and crew on board lose their lives.

Title: 1937 Airlines of Australia Stinson crash
Explanation: An Airlines of Australia Stinson Model A suffered a controlled flight into terrain in Queensland, killing four of the seven people on board.

Title: 1949 Exhall mid-air collision
Explanation: A British European Airways Douglas Dakota collided with a RAF Avro Anson over Exhall, Warwickshire, killing all 14 on board both aircraft.

Title: United Arab Airlines Flight 869 (1962)
Explanation: United Arab Airlines Flight 869, a de Havilland Comet 4C operating an international scheduled flight from Hong Kong to Cairo, via Bangkok, crashed into Khao Yai mountain while descending to Bangkok; all 26 people on board lose their lives.

Title: 1954 Swissair Convair CV-240 crash
Explanation: In the 1954 Swissair Convair CV-240 crash, a Convair 240 ditched in the English Channel after running out of fuel. All survive the ditching, but three of the passengers drown due to a lack of lifejackets.

Title: 2010 Cameroon Aéro Service C-212 crash
Explanation: A CASA C-212 Aviocar crashed near Djoum, Cameroon, while operating a charter flight to Yangadou, Republic of the Congo; all 11 occupants were killed, including the entire board of Sundance Resources, an Australian mining conglomerate.

Title: 2010 Air Service Berlin Douglas C-47 crash
Explanation: An Air Service Berlin Douglas C-47 Skytrain crashed following an engine failure shortly after taking off from Berlin Schönefeld Airport, Germany, for a sightseeing flight over Berlin; 7 of the 28 on board were injured in the accident.

Title: 1998 Ariana Afghan Airlines crash
Explanation: In the 1998 Ariana Afghan Airlines crash, a Boeing 727 crashes into Sharki Baratayi Mountain while on approach to Kabul International Airport, killing all 45 on board.

Title: United Express Flight 5925
Explanation: United Express Flight 5925, a Beechcraft 1900, collides with a privately owned Beechcraft King Air at Quincy Regional Airport, Illinois; killing all 14 on board both aircraft.

Title: 2021 Houston MD-87 crash
Explanation: A  corporate McDonnell Douglas MD-87 crashed on take-off from Houston Executive Airport, Houston, Texas. All 21 people on board survived.

Title: UTA Flight 772
Explanation: UTA Flight 772, a McDonnell Douglas DC-10, explodes in mid-air over the Sahara Desert when a bomb hidden in its forward cargo hold detonates. All 170 people on board are killed. Responsibility for the bombing is later traced back to Abdullah Senussi, the brother-in-law of Libyan leader Muammar al-Gaddafi, whose government in 2003 agrees to pay compensation to the victims.

Title: 1967 Nicosia Britannia disaster
Explanation: The 1967 Nicosia Britannia disaster: a Globe Air-operated Bristol Britannia on a charter flight crashed near Lakatamia, Cyprus, killing 126 of 130 on board.

Title: 1972 Chicago–O'Hare runway collision
Explanation: In the 1972 Chicago

Title: Linea Aeropostal Venezolana Flight 253 (June 1956)
Explanation: Linea Aeropostal Flight 253, a Lockheed L-1049 Constellation, crashed into the Atlantic Ocean off Asbury Park, New Jersey. All 74 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: 1969 Aswan Ilyushin Il-18 crash
Explanation: In the 1969 Aswan Ilyushin Il-18 crash, a United Arab Airlines flight crashes while attempting to land at Aswan International Airport. 100 of the 105 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: 1982 Garuda Fokker F28 crash
Explanation: In the 1982 Garuda Fokker F28 crash, the Fokker F28 overruns the runway in bad weather at Tanjung Karang-Branti Airport; all 27 are killed when the aircraft bursts into flames.

Title: 1948 KLM Constellation air disaster
Explanation: In the 1948 KLM Constellation air disaster, a Lockheed Constellation named Nijmegen, flying from Schiphol Airport, Netherlands, to New York City, United States, crashed near Prestwick, Scotland, killing all 40 on board.

Title: 1963 Aeroflot Tupolev Tu-124 Neva river ditching
Explanation: An Aeroflot Tupolev Tu-124 ditched in the Neva river in Leningrad after engine failure; there are no fatalities among the 52 on board, but the aircraft is destroyed.

Title: Air Littoral Flight 1919
Explanation: Air Littoral Flight 1919, an Embraer EMB-120, strikes trees during approach to Bordeaux

Title: 1939 Imperial Airways flying boat ditching
Explanation: An Imperial Airways flying boat ditched in the North Atlantic, 285 miles (459 km) southeast of New York, due to loss of power; the aircraft later sinks and three of the 12 on board die.

Title: 2006 Yeti Airlines Twin Otter crash
Explanation: In the 2006 Yeti Airlines Twin Otter crash, a DHC-6 Twin Otter crashes during a go-around at Jumla Airport, Nepal. All nine passengers and crew are killed.

Title: 2007 Free Airlines L-410 crash
Explanation: The 2007 Free Airlines L-410 crash occurs shortly after takeoff from Kamina Town, Democratic Republic of Congo because of severe overloading. Of the 21 passengers and crew on board, one is killed and four are injured.

Title: 1931 Avro Ten Southern Cloud disappearance
Explanation: An Australian National Airways Avro 618 Ten, Southern Cloud, disappeared in severe weather on a flight from Sydney to Melbourne, killing all eight on board in Australia's first significant airline disaster; the crash site in the Snowy Mountains remained undiscovered until 1958.

Title: Transbrasil Flight 801
Explanation: Transbrasil Flight 801, a Boeing 707, crashes on a high speed approach into São Paulo Guarulhos International Airport, the left wing striking a building and crashing into a residential area. All three crewmembers and 22 people on the ground were killed. The 707 involved was used in the 1970 movie Airport when it was owned by Flying Tigers.

Title: 2011 Trans Air Congo Antonov An-12 crash
Explanation: An Trans Air Congo Antonov An-12 crashed on approach to Pointe Noire Airport, Republic of the Congo, killing all 4 crew on board and another 19 on the ground.

Title: 1927 KLM Fokker F.VIII crash
Explanation: A KLM Fokker F. VIII crashed near Sevenoaks, Kent, England, due to a structural failure of the tailfin, killing one of 11 on board.

Title: 2002 Shangri-La Air Twin Otter crash
Explanation: In the 2002 Shangri-La Air Twin Otter crash, a DHC-6 Twin Otter crashes in thick cloud whilst on approach into Pokhara Airport, Nepal, killing all 18 passengers and crew.

Title: 2020 South West Aviation Antonov An-26 crash
Explanation: A South West Aviation Antonov An-26 crashed in a residential area after taking off for a charter cargo flight from Juba International Airport, South Sudan, killing eight of nine people on board.

Title: 1951 Misrair SNCASE Languedoc crash
Explanation: A Misrair SNCASE Languedoc crashed west of Tehran in a snowstorm, killing all 20 people on board.

Title: 1973 Royal Air Maroc Sud Aviation Caravelle crash
Explanation: In the 1973 Royal Air Maroc Sud Aviation Caravelle crash, a Sud Aviation Caravelle operated by Sobelair crashed into Mount Mellaline near Tanger-Boukhalef Airport, Morocco, killing all 106 on board.

Title: 2001 shoe bomb attempt
Explanation: On board American Airlines Flight 63, a Boeing 767, a passenger, Richard Reid, attempts to detonate explosives hidden in his shoes, but fails and is subdued by two flight attendants and passengers; the aircraft lands safely in Boston.

Title: 1971 January 22 Surgut Aeroflot Antonov An-12 crash
Explanation: An Aeroflot Antonov An-12 crashed due to icing while on approach to Surgut International Airport, RSFSR, Soviet Union, killing all 14 on board the aircraft.

Title: Aviastar-TU Flight 1906
Explanation: Aviastar-TU Flight 1906, a Tupolev Tu-204 flying from Hurghada, Egypt, to Moscow, Russia, crashed on landing at Domodedovo International Airport in foggy weather; all eight crew on board survived, but the aircraft was written off; this was the first loss involving a Tu-204.

Title: 2003 Baghdad DHL attempted shootdown incident
Explanation: A DHL Airbus A300 is struck by a missile near Baghdad, Iraq and loses hydraulic system function, but manages to land safely with only engine controls without any fatalities. This is the first non-fatal landing of an airliner without control surfaces.

Title: Alaska Airlines Flight 2059
Explanation: Alaska Airlines Flight 2059, an Embraer 175 operated by Horizon Air from Everett to San Francisco, diverted to Portland after an off-duty pilot attempted to shut off both engines with the fire handles. The off-duty pilot was subdued and arrested after landing. There were no injuries.

Title: 1959 Air Charter Turkey crash
Explanation: In the 1959 Air Charter Turkey crash, an Avro Super Trader IV crashed on Mount Süphan, Turkey; all 12 crew on board die.

Title: SAETA Flight 011 (1979)
Explanation: SAETA Flight 011, a Vickers Viscount, crashed in a mountainous region of Pastaza, Ecuador, killing all 57 people on board.

Title: 1979 Turkish Airlines Ankara crash
Explanation: A Turkish Airlines Fokker F28 crashed on a hillside near Kuyumcuköy, Ankara, Turkey, while on approach to Esenboğa Airport; of the 45 on board, only four survived.

Title: 1983 Anchorage runway collision
Explanation: In the 1983 Anchorage runway collision, Korean Air Lines Flight 084, a McDonnell Douglas DC-10, collides with SouthCentral Air Flight 59, a Piper PA-31-350, on a runway at Anchorage International Airport; all 12 occupants on both aircraft survive.

Title: Finnair Flight 915
Explanation: Finnair Flight 915, a McDonnell Douglas DC-10, is the target of an attempted missile attack by the Soviet Union. The allegations come out in 2014 when Finnish media reports a claim by two of the flight's pilots that the missile explodes less than 30 seconds before impact. It causes outrage in Finland among those politicians and civil servants, to whom it should have been reported at the time.

Title: 1934 United Air Lines Boeing 247 crash
Explanation: A United Air Lines Boeing 247 crashed into a Utah canyon in bad weather, killing all eight on board.

Title: 1954 Cathay Pacific Douglas DC-4 shootdown
Explanation: The 1954 Cathay Pacific Douglas DC-4 shootdown: a Cathay Pacific Douglas DC-4 was shot down by two PLAAF La-7 fighters and crashed off Hainan Island, killing 10 of 19 on board.

Title: 2006 O'Hare International Airport runway incursion
Explanation: In the 2006 O'Hare International Airport runway incursion, United Airlines Flight 1015, a Boeing 737-322, nearly collided with Atlas Air Flight 6972, a Boeing 747-47UF. All 131 occupants onboard both aircraft survive without injury.

Title: 1969 Yukhnov mid-air collision
Explanation: In the Yukhnov mid-air collision, Aeroflot Flight 831, an Ilyushin Il-14, collides in mid-air with a Soviet Air Force Antonov An-12 over Yukhnovsky District, Russia, killing all 120 people on both aircraft.

Title: 2007 Mogadishu TransAVIAexport Airlines Il-76 crash
Explanation: In the 2007 Mogadishu TransAVIAexport Airlines Il-76 crash, an Ilyushin Il-76 crashes near Mogadishu, Somalia, after allegedly being hit by a surface-to-air missile killing all 11 on board.

Title: TWA Flight 800 (1964)
Explanation: TWA Flight 800, a Boeing 707, suffered engine failure and crashed at Leonardo da Vinci-Fiumicino Airport when a thrust reverser failed to deploy, killing 50 of 73 on board.

Title: 2006 Shree Air Mil Mi-8 crash
Explanation: A Shree Air Mil Mi-8 helicopter crashed near Ghusna, Nepal, after a flight from Phungling, killing all 24 people on board.

Title: 2004 Russian aircraft bombings
Explanation:
Siberia Airlines Flight 1047, a Tupolev Tu-154, explodes in mid-air while flying over Rostov Oblast, Russia, killing all 38 passengers and eight crew members on board.
August 24

Title: 2008 Aéreo Ruta Maya crash
Explanation: In the 2008 Aéreo Ruta Maya crash, a Cessna 208 Caravan, crashes 45 minutes after takeoff from La Aurora International Airport, Guatemala en route to El Estor, Guatemala. 11 of the 14 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: 1924 Imperial Airways de Havilland DH.34 crash
Explanation: An Imperial Airways de Havilland DH.34 crashed near Purley, Surrey, England, due to a stall during an attempted emergency landing in response to an unknown mechanical defect. All eight on board were killed.

Title: 1958 Bristol Britannia 312 crash
Explanation: A BOAC Bristol Britannia crashed near Christchurch, Dorset, England, killing nine of 12 on board.

Title: 1966 Flying Tiger Line Canadair CL-44 crash
Explanation: A Flying Tiger Line Canadair CL-44 crashed into the village of Binh Thai, South Vietnam due to pilot error, killing all four crew and another 107 on the ground.

Title: 2024 Saurya Airlines Bombardier CRJ200 crash
Explanation: A Saurya Airlines Bombardier CRJ-200ER crashed shortly after taking off from Kathmandu Tribhuvan Airport, whilst en route to Pokhara International Airport, killing 18 of the 19 occupants on board.

Title: 1956 Kano Airport BOAC Argonaut crash
Explanation: In the 1956 Kano Airport BOAC Argonaut crash, a Canadair C-4 Argonaut crashed shortly after taking off from Kano Airport, Nigeria, into a thunderstorm, killing 32 of the 38 passengers and three of the seven crew.

Title: 2019 Busy Bee Congo crash
Explanation: A Busy Bee Dornier Do 228 crashed into a densely populated area shortly after takeoff from Goma International Airport in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, killing all 19 occupants of the aircraft and 10 people on the ground.

Title: Japan Airlines Flight 472 (1972)
Explanation: Japan Airlines Flight 472, a Douglas DC-8 flying from London to Tokyo with 122 on board, overshot the runway after landing at the wrong airport; there were no fatalities.

Title: 2010 Filair Let L-410 crash
Explanation: A Filair Let L-410 Turbolet crashed on approach to Bandundu Airport, Democratic Republic of the Congo, killing all but one of the 21 on board.

Title: 1954 Prestwick air disaster
Explanation: In the 1954 Prestwick air disaster a British Overseas Airways Corporation Boeing 377 Stratocruiser crashed on landing at Prestwick Airport, Scotland due to pilot error, killing 28 of the 36 on board.

Title: Turkish Airlines Flight 1951
Explanation: Turkish Airlines Flight 1951, a Boeing 737-800 flying from Istanbul, Turkey, to Amsterdam, Netherlands, stalls and crashes into a field during final approach to Schiphol Airport, killing nine of the 135 people on board.

Title: 1960 Rio de Janeiro mid-air collision
Explanation: The 1960 Rio de Janeiro mid-air collision: A United States Navy Douglas R6D-1 (DC-6A) collided with Real Transportes Aéreos Flight 753, a Douglas DC-3, over Rio de Janeiro, Brazil; of the 64 total on board both aircraft, there were only three survivors, all from the R6D-1.

Title: 1962 Avensa Fairchild F-27 accident
Explanation: An Avensa Fairchild F-27 crashed into San Juan mountain on Margarita Island in the Caribbean Sea, killing all 23 on board.

Title: 1947 Croydon Dakota accident
Explanation: In the 1947 Croydon Dakota accident, a Spencer Airways Douglas C-47A failed to get airborne at Croydon Airport, United Kingdom, and crashes into a parked ČSA aircraft; 12 of the 22 on board are killed.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 1912
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 1912, a Tupolev Tu-104 operating a multi-leg domestic flight between Odessa and Vladivostok in the Soviet Union, landed hard and crashed short of the runway at Irkutsk Airport, killing 97 of the 126 people on board.

Title: 1958 Dan-Air Avro York crash
Explanation: An Avro York 685 cargo aircraft crashed during a forced landing after an engine catches fire en route from Karachi to Delhi, killing four of the five people on board.

Title: 2003 Angola Boeing 727 disappearance
Explanation: A Boeing 727-200 is stolen from Quatro de Fevereiro Airport in Angola, possibly by two men known to the authorities, and disappears over the Atlantic Ocean; despite an extensive search effort, the aircraft has never been found.

Title: 1938 Kyeema crash
Explanation: Kyeema, an Australian National Airways Douglas DC-2, crashed in heavy fog into Mount Dandenong in Victoria, Australia, killing all 18 people on board.

Title: 1996 Texel Douglas DC-3 crash
Explanation: A Douglas DC-3 operated by Dutch Dakota Association crashed in the Wadden Sea due to an engine failure, while flying from Texel to Amsterdam. All 32 people on board were killed.

Title: 2009 Aéro-Frêt An-12 crash
Explanation: An Aéro-Frêt Antonov An-12 crashes whilst en route to Maya-Maya Airport, Brazzaville, Republic of the Congo, after breaking up in mid-air as a result of an inflight fire; all six occupants of the aircraft are killed.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 315 (1960)
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 315, an Antonov An-10A, crashed short of the runway at Lviv Airport due to tail icing; of the 33 on board, only a passenger survived.

Title: 2016 Air Kasthamandap crash
Explanation: In the 2016 Air Kasthamandap crash, an Air Kasthamandap PAC 750XL crash-lands in Nepal, killing the two crew members and injuring nine passengers.

Title: 1947 KLM Douglas DC-3 Copenhagen accident
Explanation: In the 1947 KLM Douglas DC-3 Copenhagen accident, a Douglas DC-3 crashed shortly after takeoff from Kastrup Airport in Denmark, killing all 22 passengers and crew on board.

Title: 1950 Australian National Airways Douglas DC-4 crash
Explanation: Australian National Airways Amana, a Douglas DC-4, crashed after takeoff from Perth Airport, killing all 29 people on board.

Title: 1998 MIAT Mongolian Airlines crash
Explanation: The 1998 MIAT Mongolian Airlines crash: a Harbin Y-12 crashes 13 minutes after takeoff from Erdenet Airport, Mongolia, killing all 28 passengers and crew.

Title: 1949 Mexicana DC-3 crash
Explanation: A Mexicana de Aviacion DC-3 crashed into Popocatepetl volcano, killing all 23 on board.

Title: 1994 Vanavara air disaster
Explanation: In the 1994 Vanavara air disaster, a Yakovlev Yak-40 operated by Cheremshanka Airlines crashes near Vanavara, Russia after running out of fuel in bad weather, killing 28 passengers and crew.

Title: 1974 Leningrad Aeroflot Il-18 crash
Explanation: An Aeroflot Ilyushin Il-18 crashed shortly after takeoff from Pulkovo Airport, Leningrad (now St. Petersburg), Russia due to loss of control following engine failure; all 109 on board died.

Title: 1977 Aviateca Convair 240 crash
Explanation: An Aviateca Convair 240 crashed shortly after taking off from La Aurora International Airport, Guatemala City, Guatemala, in Central America, due to a maintenance error; all 28 people on board survived.

Title: August 1923 Air Union Farman Goliath crash
Explanation: An Air Union Farman F.60 Goliath crashed near East Malling, Kent, England, due to an engine failure, and the passengers misunderstanding given instructions, killing one of 13 on board.

Title: 1947 Korangi Creek crash
Explanation: In the 1947 Korangi Creek crash, an Air India Douglas C-48 crashed shortly after takeoff, killing all 23 on board.

Title: 1934 Swissair Tuttlingen accident
Explanation: A Swissair Curtiss T-32 Condor II crashed near Tuttlingen, Germany, after a wing separated in a thunderstorm, killing all 12 passengers and crew on board.

Title: United Arab Airlines Flight 869 (1963)
Explanation: United Arab Airlines Flight 869, a de Havilland Comet 4C, crashed into the sea while on approach to Bombay Airport, India, killing all 63 on board.

Title: 2000 Royal Nepal Airlines Twin Otter crash
Explanation: A Royal Nepal Airlines de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter crashes into Jarayakhali Hill in western Nepal, while operating a domestic passenger flight from Bajhang Airport to Dhangadhi Airport, killing all 25 people on board.

Title: 1951 Ringway Dakota crash
Explanation: In the 1951 Ringway Dakota crash, an Air Transport Charter Douglas DC-3 crashed shortly after taking off from Manchester-Ringway Airport, England. Two of the three crew members were killed.

Title: Linea Aeropostal Venezolana Flight 253 (November 1956)
Explanation: Linea Aeropostal Flight 253, a Lockheed L-749 Constellation, crashed on approach to Caracas International Airport, killing all 25 on board.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 10 (1954)
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 10, an Ilyushin Il-12, struck trees and crashed near Severny Airport, killing all 29 on board.

Title: 1993 Tajik Air Yakovlev Yak-40 incident
Explanation: A Tajik Air Yakovlev Yak-40 crashes after overshooting the runway on takeoff from Khorog Airport, killing 82 of the 86 people on board; the accident is the deadliest involving the Yak-40 as well as the deadliest accident in Tajikistan to date.

Title: 1948 Airborne Transport DC-3 (DST) disappearance
Explanation: In the 1948 Airborne Transport DC-3 (DST) disappearance, a Douglas DC-3 flying from San Juan, Puerto Rico to Miami, Florida, disappeared without a trace off the coast of Florida with 32 on board.

Title: United Airlines Flight 826 (1997)
Explanation: United Airlines Flight 826, a Boeing 747, encounters severe turbulence two hours into the flight; the aircraft safely lands back in Tokyo; all survive the accident, but a passenger dies later; despite having no damage, the aircraft is written off.

Title: 1948 Los Gatos DC-3 crash
Explanation: In the 1948 Los Gatos DC-3 crash, an Airline Transport Carriers Douglas DC-3 crashed in the Diablo Range, California, after an engine fire; all 32 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: 1933 Imperial Airways Diksmuide crash
Explanation: The 1933 Imperial Airways Diksmuide crash: An Armstrong Whitworth Argosy II caught fire in mid-air and crashed near Diksmuide, Belgium in the first suspected case of air sabotage; all 15 on board were killed.

Title: ČSA Flight 511 (March 1961)
Explanation: ČSA Flight 511, an Ilyushin Il-18, broke up and crashed at Gräfenberg, West Germany. All 52 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: American Airlines Flight 383 (2016)
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 383, a Boeing 767-300ER, suffers an uncontained engine failure and fire at Chicago O'Hare Airport; 20 of the 170 people on board suffer injuries.

Title: Japan Airlines Flight 472 (1977)
Explanation: Japan Airlines Flight 472, a McDonnell Douglas DC-8 bound for Tokyo, was hijacked by Japanese Red Army (JRA) militants shortly after departing from Bombay, India, and forced to land in Dhaka, Bangladesh; the hijackers' demands are eventually met and all 151 passengers and crew were released unharmed.

Title: 2024 Mari Petroleum Mil Mi-8 crash
Explanation: A Mari Petroleum Mil Mi-8 crashed while transporting oil workers near the Shiwa oil field, in Waziristan, Pakistan. 6 of the 15 people on board were killed, with the 8 survivors being injured.

Title: 2016 Turøy helicopter crash
Explanation: In the 2016 Turøy helicopter crash, a Eurocopter EC225L Super Puma helicopter crashes near Turøy, an island off the coast of Norway; all 13 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: British Airways Flight 2069
Explanation: British Airways Flight 2069, a Boeing 747-436 en route from Gatwick Airport, England, to Nairobi in Kenya, experiences an attempted hijacking by a mentally ill passenger who storms the cockpit at 35,000 feet (11 km) and sends the aircraft into a nosedive; the flight crew rescue the situation and none of the 398 people on board is seriously injured.

Title: 1972 Lake Winnebago mid-air collision
Explanation: In the 1972 Lake Winnebago mid-air collision, North Central Airlines Flight 290, a Convair CV-580, and Air Wisconsin Flight 671, a de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter, collided over Lake Winnebago near Appleton, Wisconsin, killing all 13 people on board the two aircraft.

Title: Tianjin Airlines Flight 7554
Explanation: Six people attempted to hijack Tianjin Airlines Flight 7554, an Embraer E-190, 10 minutes after takeoff; passengers and crew were able to restrain the hijackers until the aircraft made an emergency landing; of the 101 on board, 2 hijackers died and 11 passengers and crew were injured; this was China's first serious hijacking attempt since the Guangzhou Baiyun Airport collisions in 1990.

Title: 2001 Avjet Aspen crash
Explanation: In the 2001 Avjet Aspen crash, an Avjet charter flight, a Gulfstream III jet with 15 passengers and three crew, crashes on approach into Aspen, Colorado, killing all on board.

Title: 1947 Héðinsfjörður air crash
Explanation: In the 1947 Héðinsfjörður air crash, a Flugfélag Islands Douglas DC-3 crashed into Hestfjall on the west side of Héðinsfjörður fjord, killing all 25 on board in Iceland's deadliest air disaster.

Title: 2023 Rio Branco Cessna Grand Caravan crash
Explanation: A Cessna 208B Caravan operated by ART Táxi Aéreo crashed and exploded shortly after takeoff from Rio Branco International Airport, Brazil, killing all 12 people on board.

Title: Gol Transportes Aéreos Flight 1907
Explanation: Gol Transportes Aéreos Flight 1907, a Boeing 737-800, collides with an Embraer Legacy business jet and crashes in Mato Grosso, Brazil; the Embraer Legacy, with seven on board, lands safely with no reported injuries while all 154 people on board the Boeing 737 die; this crash marks the first loss of a Boeing 737-800.

Title: 2008 Conviasa Boeing 737 crash
Explanation: In the 2008 Conviasa Boeing 737 crash, a Boeing 737-200 crashes into Illiniza, Ecuador whilst en route to Cotopaxi International Airport, Ecuador. All three on board are killed.

Title: 1933 Imperial Airways Ruysselede crash
Explanation: In the 1933 Imperial Airways Ruysselede crash in Belgium, an Avro Ten struck a radio mast, killing all 10 on board.

Title: 1942 Qantas Short Empire shootdown
Explanation: Qantas Short Empire G-AEUH was shot down by seven Japanese fighters and crashed 13 nautical miles (24 km) from East Timor; 13 of 18 on board are killed.

Title: 1971 Indian Airlines hijacking
Explanation: In the 1971 Indian Airlines hijacking, a Fokker F-27 Friendship 100 operating a domestic passenger flight was hijacked en route from Srinagar to Jammu and flown to Lahore in Pakistan where the passengers and crew were released and the plane subsequently destroyed.

Title: 1987 Belize Air International C-97 Mexico City crash
