The aircraft disintegrates mid-air, resulting in the deaths of all 21 passengers and crew on board.

Title: AVAir Flight 3378
Explanation: AVAir Flight 3378, a Swearingen Metroliner III, crashes on takeoff from Raleigh-Durham Airport due to pilot error, killing all 12 on board.

Title: TAT Flight 230
Explanation: TAT Flight 230, a Fairchild FH-227, crashes near Fontainebleau, France, killing all 23 on board; an electrical problem is suspected.

Title: Avianca Flight 410
Explanation: Avianca Flight 410, a Boeing 727, crashes into terrain near Cúcuta, Colombia after takeoff as a result of pilot error. All 143 people on board die.

Title: Kuwait Airways Flight 422
Explanation: Kuwait Airways Flight 422, a Boeing 747, is hijacked en route from Bangkok to Kuwait by Lebanese guerillas demanding the release of Shi'ite prisoners held by Kuwait, leading to a hostage crisis lasting 16 days and encompassing three continents. The flight, initially forced to land at Mashhad in northeastern Iran, travels 3,200 miles to Larnaca, Cyprus and finally to Algiers. Two passengers are shot dead by the hijackers.  The remainder of the 112 passengers and crew, including three members of the Kuwaiti royal family, are eventually released and the hijackers allowed to leave Algeria.

Title: Aloha Airlines Flight 243
Explanation: Aloha Airlines Flight 243, a Boeing 737, suffers explosive decompression during flight but manages to land safely. Of 95 people on board, one flight attendant is blown out of the plane and killed, and several passengers are injured.

Title: Widerøe Flight 710
Explanation: Widerøe Flight 710, a Dash 7, crashes in Torghatten, Norway, in thick fog, killing all 36 passengers in the worst-ever Dash 7 accident.

Title: TACA Flight 110
Explanation: TACA Flight 110, a Boeing 737, suffers dual engine failure due to water ingestion; the aircraft lands safely at NASA's Michoud Assembly Facility in New Orleans; all on board survive.

Title: Austral Líneas Aéreas Flight 46
Explanation: Austral Líneas Aéreas Flight 46, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, crashes short of the runway at Libertador General Jose de San Martin Airport, killing all 22 on board.

Title: Air France Flight 296
Explanation: Air France Flight 296, an Airbus A320, makes a low pass over Mulhouse-Habsheim Airport in landing configuration during an air show and crashes into trees at the end of the runway. Of 130 passengers aboard, three die.

Title: Iran Air Flight 655
Explanation: Iran Air Flight 655, an Airbus A300, is shot down over Iranian waters by the missile cruiser USS Vincennes; all 290 people on board are killed.

Title: CAAC Flight 301
Explanation: CAAC Flight 301, a Hawker Siddeley Trident operating a Guangzhou Baiyun Airport to Hong Kong Kai Tak Airport flight, runs off the runway. Seven of the 89 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: Delta Air Lines Flight 1141
Explanation: Delta Air Lines Flight 1141, a Boeing 727, crashes on takeoff from Dallas-Fort Worth International Airport as a result of pilot error and poor design Boeing's mechanical failsafe system on the 727; of 108 people on board, 12 passengers and two crew members are killed.

Title: Vietnam Airlines Flight 831
Explanation: Vietnam Airlines Flight 831, a Tupolev Tu-134, crashes on approach to Don Mueang International Airport in Bangkok. 76 of the 90 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 604
Explanation: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 604, a Boeing 737, crashes on takeoff after suffering multiple bird strikes; 35 of 98 passengers die, all six crew survive.

Title: Uganda Airlines Flight 775
Explanation: Uganda Airlines Flight 775, a Boeing 707-338C, crashed while attempting to land at Rome's Fiumicino Airport; 33 of the 52 passengers and crew on board were killed.

Title: Indian Airlines Flight 113
Explanation: Indian Airlines Flight 113, a Boeing 737, crashes on approach 2.6 km short of the runway in poor visibility in Ahmedabad, India, killing 133 of the 135 people on board.

Title: LOT Polish Airlines Flight 703
Explanation: LOT Polish Airlines Flight 703, an Antonov An-24, crashes on approach to Rzeszów-Jasionka Airport, killing one passenger, all others survive.

Title: Pan Am Flight 103
Explanation: Pan Am Flight 103, a Boeing 747, disintegrates in the air over Lockerbie, Dumfries and Galloway, Scotland, after a terrorist bomb explodes on board. All 259 people on board and 11 on the ground are killed. The incident is also known as the Lockerbie air disaster.

Title: Kegworth air disaster
Explanation: British Midland Airways Flight 092, a Boeing 737, crashes near Kegworth, Leicestershire, United Kingdom, after one of its engines loses a fan blade and fails. Of the 118 passengers and eight crew, 79 survive. The incident became known as the Kegworth air disaster and is the first loss of a Boeing 737-400.

Title: Independent Air Flight 1851
Explanation: Independent Air Flight 1851, a Boeing 707, crashes into a hill on approach to Santa Maria, the Azores. All 144 people on board are killed.

Title: Flying Tiger Line Flight 66
Explanation: Flying Tiger Line Flight 66, a Boeing 747 crashes near Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, on approach to land, killing all four on board. The crash is caused by miscommunication between ATC and the crew.

Title: United Airlines Flight 811
Explanation: United Airlines Flight 811, a Boeing 747, suffers an explosive decompression shortly after takeoff from Honolulu, Hawaii, United States, caused by a cargo door that burst open during flight. Of 355 people on board, nine passengers are blown out of the plane, but the crew manage to land safely at Honolulu.

Title: Air Ontario Flight 1363
Explanation: Air Ontario Flight 1363, a Fokker F28, crashes immediately after takeoff from Dryden, Ontario, Canada, because of ice on the wings, killing 24 of 69 people on board.

Title: Evergreen International Airlines Flight 17
Explanation: Evergreen International Airlines Flight 17, a Douglas DC-9, crashes while attempting an emergency landing at Carswell Air Force Base in Fort Worth, Texas, after the main cargo door burst open immediately after takeoff, killing both pilots.

Title: Surinam Airways Flight 764
Explanation: Surinam Airways Flight 764, a Douglas DC-8, crashes while attempting to land in heavy fog at Paramaribo, Suriname. The plane hits trees and flips upside down, killing 176 of 187 people on board.

Title: Interflug Flight 102
Explanation: Interflug Flight 102, an Ilyushin Il-62, overruns the runway whilst taking off from Berlin Schönefeld Airport, East Germany, killing 21 of 113 people on board.

Title: United Airlines Flight 232
Explanation: United Airlines Flight 232, a McDonnell Douglas DC-10, suffers a complete hydraulic system failure over Iowa, United States, after the tail-mounted engine disintegrates. The crew maintains partial control of the aircraft using differential throttle, bringing it to a crash landing on the runway of the Sioux City, Iowa, airport. Of the 296 people on board, 112 die.

Title: Korean Air Flight 803
Explanation: Korean Air Flight 803, a McDonnell Douglas DC-10, crashes while attempting to land in heavy fog at Tripoli, Libya. 75 of the 199 passengers and crew on board plus four people on the ground are killed in the accident.

Title: Olympic Aviation Flight 545
Explanation: Olympic Aviation Flight 545, a Shorts 330

Title: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 404
Explanation: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 404, a Fokker F27, disappears on a flight with 54 on board; the wreckage has never been found.

Title: Cubana de Aviación Flight 9046
Explanation: Cubana de Aviación Flight 9046, an Ilyushin Il-62M, crashes while trying to take off from José Martí International Airport in Havana, Cuba. All 126 people on board the aircraft plus 24 people on the ground are killed in the crash.

Title: Varig Flight 254
Explanation: Varig Flight 254, a Boeing 737, runs out of fuel because of incorrect navigation and crashes in the Brazilian jungle, killing 13 of the 54 people on board.

Title: Partnair Flight 394
Explanation: Partnair Flight 394, a Convair 580, crashes into the North Sea after its tail section falls off in mid-air. All 55 people on board die. The disaster is blamed on counterfeit aircraft parts.

Title: USAir Flight 5050
Explanation: USAir Flight 5050, a Boeing 737, overruns the runway at LaGuardia Airport attempting to abort takeoff after a tire on a nosewheel bursts due to a mistrimmed rudder; two passengers die.

Title: Tan-Sahsa Flight 414
Explanation: Tan-Sahsa Flight 414, a Boeing 727, crashes into a mountain known as Cerro de Hula near Tegucigalpa, Honduras, due to pilot error; 127 of 146 on board die.

Title: China Airlines Flight 204
Explanation: China Airlines Flight 204, a Boeing 737, crashes into the Chiashan mountain range after takeoff from Hualien Airport due to pilot error; all 54 on board die.

Title: Avianca Flight 203
Explanation: Avianca Flight 203, a Boeing 727, explodes in mid-air over Colombia, killing all 107 people on board and three people on the ground. The Medellín Cartel claimed responsibility for the attack.

Title: KLM Flight 867
Explanation: KLM Flight 867, a Boeing 747 flying from Amsterdam to Anchorage, Alaska, flies through a cloud of volcanic debris, subsequently losing power from all four engines. The crew is able to restart the engines and land the plane safely.

Title: United Express Flight 2415
Explanation: United Express Flight 2415, a BAe Jetstream 31 operated by North Pacific Airlines crashes while attempting to land at Tri-Cities Airport, Washington. All six passengers and crew are killed.

Title: SANSA Flight 32
Explanation: SANSA Flight 32, crashes into a mountain just after takeoff from Juan Santamaria International Airport in San José, Costa Rica, killing all 20 passengers and three crew on board.

Title: Avianca Flight 052
Explanation: Avianca Flight 052, a Boeing 707, runs out of fuel and crashes while attempting to land at John F. Kennedy International Airport in New York; of the 158 people on board, 85 survive.

Title: Indian Airlines Flight 605
Explanation: Indian Airlines Flight 605, an Airbus A320, crashes on its final approach to Bangalore Airport. 92 out of 146 people on board are killed.

Title: Atlantic Southeast Airlines Flight 2254
Explanation: Atlantic Southeast Airlines Flight 2254, an Embraer EMB 120 Brasilia, collides with a Cessna 172, both on the Cessna die. Flight 2254 lands; all seven on board survive.

Title: Widerøe Flight 839
Explanation: Widerøe Flight 839, a DHC-6 Twin Otter, crashes into water just after takeoff from Værøy Airport, killing all five people on board.

Title: Philippine Airlines Flight 143
Explanation: Philippine Airlines Flight 143, a Boeing 737, explodes and burns on the ground at Ninoy Aquino International Airport, killing eight of 120 on board.

Title: British Airways Flight 5390
Explanation: British Airways Flight 5390, a BAC One-Eleven, suffers explosive decompression over Didcot, Oxfordshire, England, when one of the front windscreen panes blows out. The captain is partially blown out of the cockpit, but a flight attendant manages to keep the unconscious pilot from falling out of the aircraft. The first officer lands the aircraft safely at Southampton Airport. All on board survive.

Title: British Airways Flight 149
Explanation: British Airways Flight 149, a Boeing 747, is taken hostage by Iraqi forces after landing at its scheduled stopover at 	Kuwait International Airport hours after the invasion of Kuwait. All 385 people on board are evacuated and captured, and later released at various stages, but one passenger is listed as being murdered by Iraqi soldiers. The empty aircraft is destroyed on the ground by an aircraft attack during the latter stages of the conflict.

Title: Alitalia Flight 404
Explanation: Alitalia Flight 404, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, crashes on approach to Zürich Airport, Switzerland, killing all 46 people on board.

Title: Bangkok Airways Flight 125
Explanation: Bangkok Airways Flight 125, a De Havilland Canada DHC-8-103, crashes on approach to Koh Samui Airport in Thailand, killing all 33 passengers and five crew on board.

Title: Ryan International Airlines Flight 590
Explanation: Ryan International Airlines Flight 590, a Douglas DC-9, crashes on takeoff from Cleveland Hopkins International Airport, Ohio, killing both pilots.

Title: LAN Chile Flight 1069
Explanation: LAN Chile Flight 1069, a BAe 146, overruns the runway while landing at Puerto Williams, Chile, killing 20 of the 72 people on board.

Title: Aeropostal Alas de Venezuela Flight 108
Explanation: Aeropostal Alas de Venezuela Flight 108, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9 crashes into a mountain shortly after taking off from La Chinita International Airport, Venezuela. All 45 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Singapore Airlines Flight 117
Explanation: Singapore Airlines Flight 117, an Airbus A310, is hijacked by Pakistani militants en route to Singapore Changi Airport, where, upon landing, it is stormed by Singapore Special Operations forces. All of the hijackers are killed in the operation, with no fatalities among the passengers and crew.

Title: Atlantic Southeast Airlines Flight 2311
Explanation: Atlantic Southeast Airlines Flight 2311, an Embraer EMB 120RT, rolls sharply and crashes on final approach to Brunswick, Georgia, killing all 23 people on board.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 8556
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 8556, a Tupolev Tu-154, hits the ground short of the runway after an unstabilized approach. 13 people are killed.

Title: Lauda Air Flight 004
Explanation: Lauda Air Flight 004, a Boeing 767, disintegrates in mid-air over Uthai Thani Province and Suphan Buri Province, Thailand, killing all 223 people on board. A thrust reverser had accidentally deployed in flight, causing the disaster. It is the first fatal crash of a Boeing 767.

Title: L'Express Airlines Flight 508
Explanation: L'Express Airlines Flight 508, a Beechcraft Model 99, crashes while on approach Birmingham Municipal Airport, Alabama, due to severe thunderstorms, killing 13 people on board.

Title: Nigeria Airways Flight 2120
Explanation: Nigeria Airways Flight 2120, a Nationair McDonnell Douglas DC-8 chartered by Nigeria Airways to transport Nigerian pilgrims to Mecca, crashes shortly after takeoff from King Abdulaziz International Airport, Jeddah, Saudi Arabia, because of a fire caused by tire failure, killing all 261 people on board, including 14 Canadian crew members.

Title: Indian Airlines Flight 257
Explanation: Indian Airlines Flight 257, a Boeing 737, hits high ground during descent about 30 km from Imphal Airport. All six crew members and 63 passengers are killed.

Title: Continental Express Flight 2574
Explanation: Continental Express Flight 2574, an Embraer EMB 120RT, crashes on descent in Eagle Lake, Texas, killing all 14 people on board. Maintenance crews traded work shifts during repairs to the horizontal stabilizer, inadvertently leaving 47 bolts missing. Reformers pointed to this error and called for development of a "safety culture".

Title: Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 751
Explanation: Both engines of Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 751, a McDonnell Douglas MD-81 disintegrate shortly after takeoff from Stockholm Arlanda Airport. The pilots successfully make an emergency landing on a nearby field, injuring 25 onboard. No deaths were reported in the crash.

Title: China Airlines Flight 358
Explanation: China Airlines Flight 358, a Boeing 747 freighter, suffers double engine separation and crashes into a hill near Wanli, Taipei, Taiwan, killing all five crew on board.

Title: CommutAir Flight 4281
Explanation: CommutAir Flight 4281, a Beechcraft 1900C crashes on approach into Adirondack Regional Airport, New York. Two of the four occupants are killed.

Title: Air Inter Flight 148
Explanation: Air Inter Flight 148, an Airbus A320, crashes in the Vosges Mountains on approach to Strasbourg, France, killing 87 of 96 people on board.

Title: Air Transport International Flight 805
Explanation: Air Transport International Flight 805, a Douglas DC-8 operated by Burlington Air Express, crashes during a second go-around attempt at Toledo Express Airport, Ohio, killing all four people on board and injuring 13 people on the ground.

Title: USAir Flight 405
Explanation: USAir Flight 405, a Fokker F-28, crashes on takeoff from New York because of ice buildup. Twenty-seven of the 51 people on board are killed.

Title: Trans-Air Service Flight 671
Explanation: Trans-Air Service Flight 671, a Boeing 707-321C, experiences an in-flight separation of two engines on the right wing. Despite substantial control difficulties and a fire that breaks out on the right wing during approach, the pilots safely land at a military airbase in Istres, France. None of the five occupants are injured.

Title: Copa Airlines Flight 201
Explanation: Copa Airlines Flight 201, a Boeing 737-200 Advanced, crashes near Darién, Panama, killing all 47 passengers and crew on board; a faulty attitude indicator is the cause.

Title: American Eagle Flight 5456
Explanation: American Eagle Flight 5456, a CASA C-212 Aviocar operated by Executive Airlines crashes on approach into Eugenio María de Hostos Airport, Puerto Rico. All five passengers and crew are killed.

Title: GP Express Flight 861
Explanation: GP Express Flight 861, a Beechcraft Model 99 crashes on approach into Anniston Metropolitan Airport, Alabama. Three of the six passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: Mandala Airlines Flight 660
Explanation: Mandala Airlines Flight 660, a Vickers Viscount 816, crashes on approach to Pattimura Airport, Ambon, Indonesia, killing all 63 passengers and seven crew on board.

Title: TWA Flight 843
Explanation: TWA Flight 843 aborts takeoff at John F. Kennedy International Airport. The Lockheed L-1011 turns off the runway onto grass in order to avoid striking a concrete barrier. The plane is destroyed by fire shortly after all 292 passengers and crew evacuate with no loss of life.

Title: Thai Airways International Flight 311
Explanation: Thai Airways International Flight 311, an Airbus A310, crashes on approach into Kathmandu, Nepal, killing all 14 crew and 99 passengers on board.

Title: China General Aviation Flight 7552
Explanation: China General Aviation Flight 7552, a Yakovlev 42D, loses control just after takeoff from Nanjing Airport and crashes into a pond; 108 of 126 on board die.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 2808
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 2808, a Tupolev Tu-134, crashes into buildings while attempting to land at Ivanovo Yuzhny Airport, killing all 84 on board.

Title: Vietnam Airlines Flight 850
Explanation: Vietnam Airlines Flight 850, an Airbus A310-200, is hijacked by a former pilot in the Republic of Vietnam Air Force. He then drops anti-communist leaflets over Ho Chi Minh City before parachuting out. Vietnamese security forces later arrest him on the ground. The aircraft lands safely, and no one on board is injured.

Title: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 268
Explanation: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 268, an Airbus A300, crashes near Kathmandu, Nepal, killing all 12 crew and 155 passengers.

Title: El Al Flight 1862
Explanation: El Al Flight 1862, a Boeing 747, freighter, crashes into high-rise apartment buildings in Amsterdam after two of its engines detach from the wing. Forty-three people, including the plane's crew of three plus an additional passenger, are killed.

Title: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 5601
Explanation: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 5601, a CASA/IPTN CN-235, crashes into Mount Papandayan near the town Garut in Indonesia. All 31 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: Vietnam Airlines Flight 474
Explanation: Vietnam Airlines Flight 474, a Yakovlev Yak-40, crashes while on approach to Nha Trang Airport in a tropical storm. Thirty people on board are killed.

Title: China Southern Airlines Flight 3943
Explanation: China Southern Airlines Flight 3943, a Boeing 737-300, crashes on descent to Guilin Airport, killing all 141 aboard.

Title: Martinair Flight 495
Explanation: Martinair Flight 495 crashes in Faro, Portugal, killing 54 people and injuring 106.

Title: Libyan Arab Airlines Flight 1103
Explanation: Libyan Arab Airlines Flight 1103, a Boeing 727, collides with a Libyan Air Force MiG-23 near Tripoli International Airport, killing all 157 people aboard the 727. The two crew in the MiG-23 survive and later dispute the official explanation for the crash, claiming that the 727 was purposely destroyed while they were flying nearby.

Title: Lufthansa CityLine Flight 5634
Explanation: Lufthansa CityLine Flight 5634, a de Havilland Canada DHC-8, crashes short of the runway at Paris

Title: Lufthansa Flight 592
Explanation: Lufthansa Flight 592, an Airbus A310-300, is hijacked and the pilot is forced to fly to John F. Kennedy International Airport. The plane lands safely and the hijacker surrenders. All 104 on board survive.

Title: Palair Macedonian Airlines Flight 301
Explanation: Palair Macedonian Airlines Flight 301, a Fokker 100, crashes shortly after takeoff from Skopje Airport in Macedonia; 83 of the 97 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: China Eastern Airlines Flight 583
Explanation: China Eastern Airlines Flight 583, a McDonnell Douglas MD-11, makes an emergency landing at Shemya Air Force Base after the slats are accidentally deployed in mid-air near the Aleutian Islands; all on board initially survive, but two die later.

Title: American Airlines Flight 102
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 102, a McDonnell Douglas DC-10, veers off the runway on landing at Dallas/Fort Worth International Airport; all on board survive.

Title: Japan Air System Flight 451
Explanation: Japan Air System Flight 451, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, encounters windshear and skids off the runway at Hanamaki Airport; all on board survive.

Title: Indian Airlines Flight 427
Explanation: Indian Airlines Flight 427, a Boeing 737-200, is hijacked on a flight between New Delhi and Srinagar, India. The plane lands at Amritsar Airport where it is stormed by commandos; the hijacker is killed and the 140 passengers and crew survive without injury.

Title: Indian Airlines Flight 491
Explanation: Indian Airlines Flight 491, a Boeing 737, strikes a large vehicle on a road just outside Aurangabad Airport, killing 55 of the 118 people on board.

Title: SAM Colombia Flight 501
Explanation: SAM Colombia Flight 501, a Boeing 727, crashes into Mount Paramo Frontino, killing all 132 on board.

Title: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 724
Explanation: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 724, a Fokker F28, collides with a small hill near the sea, breaks up and plunges into the sea shortly afterwards, killing 41 people on board.

Title: China Northwest Airlines Flight 2119
Explanation: China Northwest Airlines Flight 2119, a BAe 146, overruns the runway at Yinchuan Hedong Airport, Ningxia, China after an aborted takeoff; the aircraft crashes into a lake, killing 54 passengers and one crew member.

Title: Asiana Airlines Flight 733
Explanation: Asiana Airlines Flight 733, a Boeing 737, crashes into a mountain in Haenam, South Korea, after failed landing attempts, killing 68 of the 116 people on board; this crash is the first loss of a Boeing 737-500.

Title: American International Airways Flight 808
Explanation: American International Airways Flight 808, a DC-8, stalls on approach to Guantanamo Bay and crashes. Everyone survives.

Title: Sakha Avia Flight 301
Explanation: Sakha Avia Flight 301, a Let L-410 Turbolet, crashes on approach to Aldan Airport in Russia, killing all 24 people on board.

Title: Lufthansa Flight 2904
Explanation: Lufthansa Flight 2904, an Airbus A320, crashes after overrunning the runway in Warsaw, Poland, killing two and injuring 68 of the 72 people on board.

Title: Transair Georgia airliner shootdowns
Explanation: In the first of the three Transair Georgia airliner shootdowns, a Tupolev Tu-134A is hit on approach to Sukhumi-Babusheri Airport by a surface-to-air missile; the plane crashes into the Black Sea, killing all five crew members and all 22 passengers.

Title: Transair Georgia airliner shootdowns
Explanation: In the second of the three Transair Georgia airliner shootdowns, a Tupolev Tu-154, carrying soldiers from Tbilisi, is shot down on landing in the Sukhumi-Babusheri Airport; the plane crashes on the runway and catches fire, killing 108 of the 132 people on board.

Title: China Eastern Airlines Flight 5398
Explanation: China Eastern Airlines Flight 5398, a McDonnell Douglas MD-82, overruns the runway at Fuzhou Changle International Airport in heavy weather, killing two of 80 on board.

Title: Widerøe Flight 744
Explanation: Widerøe Flight 744, a de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter, crashes in Overhalla, Norway, on approach to Namsos Airport, killing both pilots and four passengers; the crash is also known as the Namsos Accident.

Title: China Airlines Flight 605
Explanation: China Airlines Flight 605, a Boeing 747-400, overruns Kai Tak Airport's runway 13 on landing during a typhoon; the aircraft is unable to stop before crashing into Hong Kong harbor; all 374 on board escape safely; this crash is the first loss of a Boeing 747-400.

Title: China Northern Airlines Flight 6901
Explanation: China Northern Airlines Flight 6901, a McDonnell Douglas MD-82, crashes on approach to Ürümqi Diwopu International Airport, Xinjiang, China; killing 12 of the 102 on board; pilot error is blamed.

Title: Avioimpex Flight 110
Explanation: Avioimpex Flight 110, a Yakovlev Yak-42, crashes on approach to Ohrid Airport in Macedonia; all 116 passengers and crew die as a result of the crash, though one passenger lived for 11 days before succumbing to his injuries.

Title: Northwest Airlink Flight 5719
Explanation: Northwest Airlink Flight 5719, a Jetstream 31, crashes into two ridges east of Hibbing, Minnesota, killing all 18 on board.

Title: Baikal Airlines Flight 130
Explanation: Baikal Airlines Flight 130, a Tupolev Tu-154, loses control and crashes near Irkutsk, Russia, after the hydraulic system failed due to an engine fire, killing all 124 on board and one person on the ground.

Title: United Express Flight 6291
Explanation: United Express Flight 6291, a BAe Jetstream 41 crashes on approach into Port Columbus International Airport, Ohio. Five of the eight passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Pulkovo Aviation Enterprise Flight 9045
Explanation: Pulkovo Aviation Enterprise Flight 9045, an Antonov An-12BP crashes on approach into Nalchik Airport, Russia. All 13 passengers and crew are killed. The aircraft was carrying 12,515 kg of coins from the Saint Petersburg Mint.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 593
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 593, an Airbus A310, crashes into a wooded hillside in Siberia. All 75 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: KLM Cityhopper Flight 433
Explanation: KLM Cityhopper Flight 433, a Saab 340, crashes while trying to return to Schiphol Airport, due to pilot error and equipment failure; the pilot and two passengers die, nine passengers are injured.

Title: Federal Express Flight 705
Explanation: Federal Express Flight 705, a McDonnell Douglas DC-10-30, experiences an attempted hijacking by a FedEx employee; the three crew members are severely injured, but manage to subdue the attacker and land the aircraft safely with no loss of life.

Title: China Airlines Flight 140
Explanation: China Airlines Flight 140, an Airbus A300, crashes while landing at Nagoya, Japan, as a result of pilot error. 264 of the 271 people on board die.

Title: China Northwest Airlines Flight 2303
Explanation: China Northwest Airlines Flight 2303, a Tupolev Tu-154M, breaks up in mid-air and crashes near Xian, China, killing all 160 on board. The deadliest airplane crash ever to occur in China is attributed to a maintenance error.

Title: Airbus Industrie Flight 129
Explanation: Airbus Industrie Flight 129, an Airbus A330 on a test flight, crashes at France's Toulouse-Blagnac Airport, killing all seven on board.

Title: Air Mauritanie Flight 625
Explanation: Air Mauritanie Flight 625, a Fokker F28 Fellowship crashes on landing at Tidjikja Airport, Mauritania in sandstorm conditions. 80 of the 93 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: USAir Flight 1016
Explanation: USAir Flight 1016, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, crashes while attempting to land at Charlotte, North Carolina, during a thunderstorm. 37 of the 57 people on board are killed.

Title: Alas Chiricanas Flight 901
Explanation: Alas Chiricanas Flight 901, an Embraer EMB-110, explodes in mid-air over Panama, killing all 21 people on board. Investigators conclude that a suicide bomber caused the plane to explode, although motives and affiliation of the bomber remain unclear.

Title: Royal Air Maroc Flight 630
Explanation: Royal Air Maroc Flight 630, an ATR-42, is deliberately crashed into the Atlas Mountains, killing all 44 on board.

Title: USAir Flight 427
Explanation: USAir Flight 427, a Boeing 737, crashes while attempting to land at Pittsburgh International Airport, killing all 132 people on board. Investigations showed that a fault in the Boeing 737 rudder was to blame for the crash.

Title: Iran Aseman Airlines Flight 746
Explanation: Iran Aseman Airlines Flight 746, a Fokker F-28, crashes into a mountain near Natanz, Iran, due to double engine failure, killing all 66 on board.

Title: American Eagle Flight 4184
Explanation: American Eagle Flight 4184, an ATR 72 turboprop, crashes near Roselawn, Indiana, while waiting to land at Chicago, because of ice buildup on its wings. All 68 people on board die.

Title: Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 347
Explanation: Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 347, a McDonnell Douglas MD-82 operating a domestic flight in Norway, is hijacked by a Bosnian national; after landing at Bodø Airport to release some hostages, the aircraft flies on to Oslo Airport where the hijacker later surrenders.

Title: TWA Flight 427
Explanation: TWA Flight 427, a McDonnell Douglas MD-82, collides with a Superior Aviation Cessna 441 on the runway at Lambert-St. Louis International Airport, killing the pilot and passenger in the Cessna; there are no fatalities on board the MD-82.

Title: Philippine Airlines Flight 434
Explanation: A bomb explodes on board Philippine Airlines Flight 434, a Boeing 747, killing one passenger, in a prelude to the terrorist Bojinka plot. Despite subsequent difficulties in controlling the aircraft, the crew succeeds in making an emergency landing at Naha, Okinawa.

Title: Nigeria Airways Flight 9805
Explanation: Nigeria Airways Flight 9805, a Boeing 707 operating a cargo flight between Saudi Arabia and Nigeria, suffers an in-flight fire before crashing into marshland in Nigeria; both passengers and one of the three crew members are killed.

Title: Air Algérie Flight 702P
Explanation: Air Algérie Flight 702P, a Boeing 737, crashes on approach to Coventry Airport, England, killing all five on board.

Title: Air France Flight 8969
Explanation: Air France Flight 8969, an Airbus A300, is hijacked on the tarmac at Algiers, Algeria, by the militant group GIA. After a two-day standoff, the plane is allowed to fly to Marseille, France, where it is stormed by French commandos, who kill the four hijackers.

Title: Turkish Airlines Flight 278
Explanation: Turkish Airlines Flight 278, a Boeing 737-400, crashes on final approach to Van Ferit Melen Airport in eastern Turkey in driving snow. Five of the seven crew and 52 of the 69 passengers are killed.

Title: Intercontinental de Aviación Flight 256
Explanation: Intercontinental de Aviación Flight 256, a Douglas DC-9, crashes in a lagoon near María La Baja, Colombia due to an improperly set altimeter, killing 51 of 52 on board.

Title: Bristow Helicopters Flight 56C
Explanation: Bristow Helicopters Flight 56C, a Eurocopter Super Puma, is struck by lightning and is forced to make an emergency landing in the North Sea. All 18 onboard survive.

Title: TransAsia Airways Flight 510A
Explanation: TransAsia Airways Flight 510A, an ATR 72

Title: Air Transport International Flight 782
Explanation: Air Transport International Flight 782, a Douglas DC-8 on a re-positioning flight, crashes after failing to get airborne at Kansas City International Airport, Missouri, killing all three crew members.

Title: TAROM Flight 371
Explanation: TAROM Flight 371, an Airbus A310, crashes near Balotești, Romania due to mechanical failure and pilot error, killing all 60 on board.

Title: Knight Air Flight 816
Explanation: Knight Air Flight 816, an Embraer EMB 110 Bandeirante crashes whilst trying to return to Leeds Bradford Airport, UK in poor weather. All 12 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Ansett New Zealand Flight 703
Explanation: Ansett New Zealand Flight 703, a de Havilland Canada DHC-8, crashes during a landing approach near the Tararua Ranges, New Zealand, killing four of the 21 people on board.

Title: All Nippon Airways Flight 857
Explanation: All Nippon Airways Flight 857, a Boeing 747SR, is hijacked on a domestic flight between Tokyo and Hakodate in Japan; after landing at its destination, the aircraft is later stormed by police and the hijacker is arrested; all 365 people on board survive the incident.

Title: Airstan incident
Explanation: In the Airstan incident, an Airstan Ilyushin Il-76TD operated as Flight 199 is intercepted by a Taliban-controlled fighter aircraft before being forced to divert to Kandahar International Airport in Afghanistan; the seven crew are held captive for over a year before overpowering their captors and fleeing in the aircraft.

Title: Aviateca Flight 901
Explanation: Aviateca Flight 901, a Boeing 737, crashes into San Vicente volcano while on approach to Cuscatlán International Airport; all 65 on board die.

Title: Atlantic Southeast Airlines Flight 529
Explanation: Atlantic Southeast Airlines Flight 529, an Embraer EMB 120, crashes in a field near Carrollton, Georgia, United States, killing nine of the 29 people on board.

Title: Malaysia Airlines Flight 2133
Explanation: Malaysia Airlines Flight 2133, a Fokker 50, crashes into a shantytown in Malaysia due to pilot error, killing 34 of 53 on board.

Title: MIAT Flight 557
Explanation: MIAT Flight 557, an Antonov An-24, crashes into a mountain near Mörön Airport, Mongolia due to pilot error; of the 43 on board, only a passenger survives. The accident remains the deadliest in Mongolia.

Title: United Airlines Flight 976
Explanation: United Airlines Flight 976, a Boeing 767-300ER, a passenger threatned to crash the plane and kill everyone onboard upon landing. The plane safely landed at John F. Kennedy International Airport. The suspect was later arrested. No casualties happened.

Title: American Airlines Flight 1572
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 1572, a McDonnell Douglas MD-83, collides with trees on approach causing a loss of both engines. It loses altitude, and strikes runway antennas before rolling to a stop. There is one minor injury of the 78 people on board.

Title: Nigeria Airways Flight 357
Explanation: Nigeria Airways Flight 357, a Boeing 737, overruns the runway while landing at Kaduna Airport, killing 11 of 138 on board.

Title: Cameroon Airlines Flight 3701
Explanation: Cameroon Airlines Flight 3701, a Boeing 737, loses control and crashes while on approach to Douala International Airport, Cameroon; of the 76 on board, five survive.

Title: Azerbaijan Airlines Flight 56
Explanation: Azerbaijan Airlines Flight 56, a Tupolev Tu-134, crashes on climbout from Nakhchivan Airport after an engine fails due to improper maintenance, killing 52 of 82 on board.

Title: Khabarovsk United Air Group Flight 3949
Explanation: Khabarovsk United Air Group Flight 3949, a Tupolev Tu-154B crashes after entering a steep downward spiral while at cruising altitude. All 98 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Banat Air Flight 166
Explanation: Banat Air Flight 166, a Romavia Antonov An-24, crashes after taking off from Verona Airport, because of overloading and ice accumulation on the wings; all 49 people on board are killed.

Title: American Airlines Flight 965
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 965, a Boeing 757, crashes into a mountain while approaching Alfonso Bonilla Aragón International Airport in Palmira, Colombia, killing 159 of 163 on board.

Title: Tower Air Flight 41
Explanation: Tower Air Flight 41, a Boeing 747, veers off the runway during takeoff from John F. Kennedy International Airport, New York. All 468 people on board survive, but 25 people are injured; the aircraft is written off.

Title: Birgenair Flight 301
Explanation: Birgenair Flight 301, a Boeing 757, with 189 people on board, crashes into the ocean off Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic shortly after taking off. All passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Faucett Flight 251
Explanation: Faucett Flight 251, a Boeing 737, crashes into a hill while attempting to land at Arequipa, Peru. All 123 people on board die.

Title: ValuJet Flight 592
Explanation: ValuJet Flight 592, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, crashes in the Everglades near Miami, Florida, because of a fire in its cargo hold. All 110 people on board are killed.

Title: Eastwind Airlines Flight 517
Explanation: Eastwind Airlines Flight 517, a Boeing 737-200, loses rudder control while on approach to Richmond International Airport, Richmond, Virginia, and makes an emergency landing; no fatalities.

Title: Garuda Indonesia Flight 865
Explanation: Garuda Indonesia Flight 865, a McDonnell Douglas DC-10, aborts takeoff due to an engine failure and crashes into a threshold at Fukuoka Airport, Fukuoka, Japan, killing three of 275 on board.

Title: Delta Air Lines Flight 1288
Explanation: Delta Air Lines Flight 1288, a McDonnell Douglas MD-88, experiences an uncontained engine failure during takeoff on Runway 17 at Pensacola, Florida. Fragments from the number one (left) Pratt & Whitney JT8D-219 turbofan engine penetrate the fuselage, killing two and seriously injuring two of the 142 people on board.

Title: TWA Flight 800
Explanation: TWA Flight 800, a Boeing 747, explodes in mid-air above the ocean off East Moriches, New York, killing all 230 people on board; 70% of passengers are sucked out during the explosion.

Title: Spair Airlines Flight 3601
Explanation: Spair Airlines Flight 3601, an Ilyushin Il-76, crashes near Belgrade, Yugoslavia, with 11 fatalities.

Title: Vnukovo Airlines Flight 2801
Explanation: Vnukovo Airlines Flight 2801, a Tupolev Tu-154, crashes into a mountain on Spitsbergen, an island in the Norwegian archipelago of Svalbard, killing all 141 on board. It remains Norway's worst air disaster to date.

Title: Hemus Air Flight 7081
Explanation: Hemus Air Flight 7081, a Tupolev Tu-154 is hijacked while en route from Beirut, Lebanon to Varna, Bulgaria. After landing in Varna, the 150 passengers are traded for fuel. The plane then flies on to Oslo Gardermoen Airport, Norway, where the hijacker later surrenders.

Title: Aeroperú Flight 603
Explanation: Aeroperú Flight 603, a Boeing 757, crashes into the ocean off Pasamayo, Peru, because of a maintenance error. All 70 people on board are killed.

Title: Millon Air Flight 406
Explanation: Millon Air Flight 406, a Boeing 707-323C, crashed shortly after takeoff from Manta Airport. All four on board were killed and so were 30 on the ground.

Title: TAM Transportes Aéreos Regionais Flight 402
Explanation: TAM Transportes Aéreos Regionais Flight 402, a Fokker 100, crashes shortly after takeoff from Congonhas-São Paulo Airport, Brazil, striking an apartment building and several houses. All 89 passengers and six crew members on board die. Four people are killed on the ground.

Title: ADC Airlines Flight 086
Explanation: ADC Airlines Flight 086, a Boeing 727, crashes when the crew loses control of the aircraft while avoiding a mid-air collision on approach to Lagos, Nigeria. All 144 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 961
Explanation: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 961, a Boeing 767, is hijacked over Kenya. The aircraft runs out of fuel, and the pilot attempts to ditch the aircraft in the ocean off Moroni, Comoros. Of the 175 people on board, 125 are killed (including the three hijackers).

Title: Dirgantara Air Service Flight 5940
Explanation: Dirgantara Air Service Flight 5940, a CASA C-212 Aviocar crashes into a gas factory shortly after takeoff from Syamsudin Noor International Airport, Indonesia following an engine failure. 16 of the 17 passengers and crew are killed, as well as two on the ground.

Title: Airborne Express Flight 827
Explanation: Airborne Express Flight 827, a Douglas DC-8, stalls and crashes during a test flight in Narrows, Virginia, killing all six people on board.

Title: Comair Flight 3272
Explanation: Comair Flight 3272, an Embraer EMB 120 Brasília, crashes near Ida, Michigan, during a snowstorm, killing all 29 on board.

Title: Stavropolskaya Aktsionernaya Avia Flight 1023
Explanation: Stavropolskaya Aktsionernaya Avia Flight 1023, an Antonov An-24, breaks up in flight and crashes near Cherkessk, Russia; all 50 on board die.

Title: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 106
Explanation: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 106, a BAe ATP crashes during a failed go-around in bad weather at Buluh Tumbang International Airport, Indonesia. 15 of the 53 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: China Southern Airlines Flight 3456
Explanation: China Southern Airlines Flight 3456, a Boeing 737, makes a hard landing in Shenzhen, China, during poor weather and crashes, killing 35 of the 74 people on board.

Title: Sempati Air Flight 304
Explanation: Sempati Air Flight 304, a Fokker F27, crashes shortly after takeoff from Husein Sastranegara International Airport, killing 28 people on board.

Title: Air Littoral Flight 701
Explanation: Air Littoral Flight 701, an ATR 42 flying from France to Italy, overshoots the runway at Florence Airport and crashes into a ditch; all 14 passengers and two of the three crew members survive, but the pilot is killed in the accident.

Title: FedEx Express Flight 14
Explanation: FedEx Express Flight 14, a McDonnell Douglas MD-11, crashes upon landing at Newark Liberty International Airport; the two crew members and three passengers escape uninjured.

Title: Korean Air Flight 801
Explanation: Korean Air Flight 801, a Boeing 747, crashes while attempting to land in heavy rain at Guam International Airport; of the 254 people on board, 229 die.

Title: Fine Air Flight 101
Explanation: Fine Air Flight 101, a McDonnell Douglas DC-8-61F, crashes after take-off at Miami International Airport; all four people on board and one person on the ground are killed.

Title: Formosa Airlines Flight 7601
Explanation: Formosa Airlines Flight 7601, a Dornier Do 228, crashes while attempting to land at Beigan, Lienchiang, in the Matsu Islands. All 16 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: Vietnam Airlines Flight 815
Explanation: Vietnam Airlines Flight 815, a Tupolev Tu-134, crashes on approach to Phnom Penh International Airport in heavy rain, killing 65 of the 66 people on board.

Title: Royal Brunei Airlines Flight 238
Explanation: Royal Brunei Airlines Flight 238, a Dornier Do 228, crashes into a hillside in Lambir Hills National Park, killing all 10 on board.

Title: Garuda Indonesia Flight 152
Explanation: Garuda Indonesia Flight 152, an Airbus A300, crashes into a mountain near Buah Nabar, Indonesia, killing all 234 on board.

Title: Austral Líneas Aéreas Flight 2553
Explanation: Austral Líneas Aéreas Flight 2553, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, crashes near Fray Bentos, Uruguay, traveling from Posadas to Buenos Aires, resulting in the death of all 74 occupants.

Title: Tajikistan Airlines Flight 3183
Explanation: Tajikistan Airlines Flight 3183, a Tupolev Tu-154, crashes into the desert near Sharjah Airport, of the 86 on board, only the flight engineer survives.

Title: Air Canada Flight 646
Explanation: Air Canada Flight 646, a Bombardier CRJ100ER operating a domestic flight in Canada, crashes on landing at Fredericton, New Brunswick, after a failed go-around attempt; all 42 passengers and crew survive the accident.

Title: Aerosvit Flight 241
Explanation: Aerosvit Flight 241, a Yakovlev Yak-42, crashes near Thessaloniki, Greece, killing all 70 people on board.

Title: SilkAir Flight 185
Explanation: SilkAir Flight 185, a Boeing 737, crashes into the Musi River near Palembang, Indonesia, killing all 104 people on board.

Title: Cebu Pacific Flight 387
Explanation: Cebu Pacific Flight 387, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, crashes into a mountain near Mount Sumagaya in Misamis Oriental in the Philippines, killing all 104 passengers and crew members on board.

Title: China Airlines Flight 676
Explanation: China Airlines Flight 676, an Airbus A300, crashes into a residential area while attempting to land in Taipei, Taiwan. All 196 people on board are killed, in addition to six on the ground.

Title: Formosa Airlines Flight 7623
Explanation: Formosa Airlines Flight 7623, a Saab 340, crashes in the ocean in Taiwan shortly after take-off following an electrical failure, killing all 13 on board.

Title: Philippine Airlines Flight 137
Explanation: Philippine Airlines Flight 137, an Airbus A320, overshoots the end of the runway while landing at Bacolod City in the Philippines, plowing through several houses. None of the passengers was harmed, but three people on the ground are killed and several more injured.

Title: Air France Flight 422
Explanation: Air France Flight 422, a Boeing 727 leased from TAME Airlines, crashes into the mountains east of Bogotá, Colombia, on takeoff from El Dorado International Airport of Bogotá in foggy weather. All 53 passengers and crew die.

Title: PIA Flight 544
Explanation: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 544, a Fokker F-27, is hijacked shortly after takeoff by three armed men. F-16 fighter jets intercept the plane and force it to land. The hijackers are arrested and sentenced to death. All 38 on board survive.

Title: Propair Flight 420
Explanation: Propair Flight 420, a Fairchild Metroliner crashes shortly after takeoff from Dorval Airport (now Montréal

Title: Proteus Airlines Flight 706
Explanation: Proteus Airlines Flight 706: a Beechcraft 1900D collides in mid-air with a light aircraft over Quiberon Bay. Both aircraft crash into the sea, killing 15 people.

Title: Indian Airlines Flight 503
Explanation: Indian Airlines Flight 503, a Dornier 228 flying from Agatti to Thiruvananthapuram, with a stopover in Kochi, crashes near Kochi killing all 6 people on board and 3 people on the ground.

Title: Korean Air Flight 8702
Explanation: Korean Air Flight 8702, a Boeing 747-400 flying from Japan to South Korea, rolls off the runway at Gimpo Airport in Seoul and crashes into a ditch; all 395 passengers and crew survive the accident.

Title: Myanma Airways Flight 635
Explanation: Myanma Airways Flight 635, a Fokker F-27 Friendship, crashes while on approach to Tachilek Airport; all 36 on board die.

Title: Cubana de Aviación Flight 389
Explanation: Cubana de Aviación Flight 389, a Tupolev Tu-154M, overruns the runway whilst taking off from Quito's Mariscal Sucre International Airport, Ecuador, proceeding to crash into a soccer field. 70 of the 91 passengers and crew are killed, along with 10 on the ground.

Title: Swissair Flight 111
Explanation: Swissair Flight 111, a McDonnell Douglas MD-11, crashes into the sea near Halifax, Nova Scotia in Canada, because of an onboard fire. All 229 people on board die.

Title: PauknAir Flight 4101
Explanation: PauknAir Flight 4101, a BAe 146, leaves Málaga but never reaches its destination in Melilla. All 38 passengers and four crew on board die.

Title: Lionair Flight 602
Explanation: Lionair Flight 602, an Antonov An-24, is shot down by the Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam and crashes off the coast of Jaffna, Sri Lanka, killing all 55 on board.

Title: Thai Airways International Flight 261
Explanation: Thai Airways International Flight 261, an Airbus A310, crashes during poor weather near Surat Thani, Thailand. Of the 146 people on board, 101 are killed.

Title: China Southwest Airlines Flight 4509
Explanation: China Southwest Airlines Flight 4509, a Tupolev Tu-154, crashes while on approach to Wenzhou Airport, killing all 61 passengers and crew on board.

Title: Alitalia Flight 1553
Explanation: Alitalia Flight 1553, a Dornier 328, loses control and overruns the runway while landing at Genoa Airport in Italy; three passengers and one crew member are killed.

Title: Korean Air Flight 1533
Explanation: Korean Air Flight 1533, a McDonnell Douglas MD-83 operating a domestic flight in South Korea, overshoots the runway on landing in Pohang; all 156 people on board survive the incident but the aircraft is destroyed.

Title: Turkish Airlines Flight 5904
Explanation: Turkish Airlines Flight 5904, a Boeing 737-400, crashes in poor weather near Hamdilli, Ceyhan, Turkey; all six crew die.

Title: Korean Air Cargo Flight 6316
Explanation: Korean Air Cargo Flight 6316, a McDonnell Douglas MD-11F, crashes shortly after takeoff from Shanghai Hongqiao Airport, China. All three crew members, as well as five on the ground, are killed.

Title: American Airlines Flight 1420
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 1420, a McDonnell Douglas MD-82 with 139 passengers on board, skids off the runway on landing and crashes into a steel walkway at Little Rock, Arkansas during strong winds; 11 are killed, and 86 are injured.

Title: Hinduja Cargo Services Flight 8533
Explanation: Hinduja Cargo Services Flight 8533, a Boeing 727, impacts Champadevi Hills after takeoff from Kathmandu. All five crew members are killed.

Title: All Nippon Airways Flight 61
Explanation: All Nippon Airways Flight 61, a Boeing 747, is hijacked by a passenger, Yuji Nishizawa, wielding a knife; after fatally stabbing the captain, he is overpowered by the crew; the first officer lands the plane safely at Haneda, Japan.

Title: Air Fiji Flight 121
Explanation: Air Fiji Flight 121, an Embraer EMB 110 Bandeirante, crashes into a mountain en route to Nadi International Airport, Fiji. All 17 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: TACV Flight 5002
Explanation: TACV Flight 5002, a Dornier Do 228, crashes into a mountain whilst returning to São Pedro Airport, Cape Verde in poor weather. All 18 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: China Airlines Flight 642
Explanation: China Airlines Flight 642, a McDonnell Douglas MD-11, crashes on landing at Hong Kong International Airport during Typhoon Sam; of the 315 people on board, three die.

Title: Uni Air Flight 873
Explanation: Uni Air Flight 873, a McDonnell Douglas MD-90, suffers an explosion and catches fire after landing in Hualien, Taiwan due to hazardous materials stored in the overhead bins, killing one passenger.

Title: LAPA Flight 3142
Explanation: LAPA Flight 3142, a Boeing 737, overshoots the runway in Buenos Aires, Argentina, and crashes into a golf course; of the 103 people on board, 63 are killed, as well as two on the ground.

Title: Necon Air Flight 128
Explanation: Necon Air Flight 128, a BAe 748, collides with a telecommunications tower whilst on approach into Kathmandu Airport, Nepal. All 15 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Britannia Airways Flight 226A
Explanation: Britannia Airways Flight 226A, a Boeing 757, veers off the runway at Girona, Spain, while landing in a thunderstorm and comes to rest in a field, broken apart in two places; 43 on board are injured, two seriously, but a passenger initially diagnosed as "lightly injured" dies five days later of unnoticed internal injuries.

Title: Qantas Flight 1
Explanation: Qantas Flight 1, a Boeing 747, runs off the runway due to a storm and comes to a complete stop just short of a golf course. All on board, including 30 injured passengers, survive.

Title: EgyptAir Flight 990
Explanation: EgyptAir Flight 990, a Boeing 767 bound for Cairo, Egypt, crashes into the Atlantic Ocean off Nantucket, Massachusetts, killing all 217 passengers and crew; cause is disputed: a deliberate suicide/homicide act by the relief first officer according to the NTSB, vs. a Boeing mechanical flaw according to Egyptian aviation authorities.

Title: TAESA Flight 725
Explanation: TAESA Flight 725, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, crashes near Uruapan, Mexico, killing all 18 on board.

Title: Si Fly Flight 3275
Explanation: Si Fly Flight 3275, an ATR 42-300 operating a UN relief flight strikes a mountain in poor weather whilst on approach into Pristina Airport, Kosovo. All 24 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Asian Spirit Flight 100
Explanation: Asian Spirit Flight 100, a Let L-410 Turbolet, crashes into a mountain while on approach to Cauayan Airport, killing all 15 passengers and crew on board.

Title: SATA Air Açores Flight 530M
Explanation: SATA Air Açores Flight 530M, a BAe ATP crashes into a mountain during approach into Flores Airport in the Azores. All 35 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Cubana de Aviación Flight 1216
Explanation: Cubana de Aviación Flight 1216, a McDonnell Douglas DC-10, overruns the runway at La Aurora International Airport, killing 16 of 314 people on board and another two on the ground.

Title: Korean Air Cargo Flight 8509
Explanation: Korean Air Cargo Flight 8509, a Boeing 747-200F, crashes after takeoff near Great Hallingbury, England; killing all four crew.

Title: Indian Airlines Flight 814
Explanation: Indian Airlines Flight 814, an Airbus A300, is hijacked en route to Delhi, India; one hostage is killed.

Title: Cubana de Aviación Flight 310
Explanation: Cubana de Aviación Flight 310, a Yakovlev Yak-42D, crashes into the San Luis Hill near Bejuma, Venezuela, while on approach to Arturo Michelena International Airport; all 22 on board die.

Title: Crossair Flight 498
Explanation: Crossair Flight 498, a Saab 340, crashes two minutes after takeoff in Niederhasli, Switzerland, killing all 10 people on board.

Title: Kenya Airways Flight 431
Explanation: Kenya Airways Flight 431, an Airbus A310, carrying 169 passengers and 10 crew members, crashes into the Atlantic Ocean off Côte d'Ivoire after takeoff from Abidjan; only 10 of the 179 people on board survive.

Title: Alaska Airlines Flight 261
Explanation: Alaska Airlines Flight 261, an MD-83, crashes into the Pacific Ocean off Point Mugu, California, after experiencing problems with its horizontal stabilizer; all 83 passengers and five crew members are killed.

Title: Emery Worldwide Airlines Flight 17
Explanation: Emery Worldwide Airlines Flight 17, a DC-8-71F crashes into a salvage yard shortly after takeoff from Sacramento Mather Airport, California, killing the three crew members on board.

Title: Southwest Airlines Flight 1455
Explanation: Southwest Airlines Flight 1455, a Boeing 737-300, overshoots the runway in Burbank, California; 44 of the 142 people on board are injured, two seriously.

Title: Air Philippines Flight 541
Explanation: Air Philippines Flight 541, a Boeing 737-200, crashes in a coconut plantation on Samal Island, Davao del Norte while preparing to approach the Davao International Airport, killing all 131 people on board in one of the deadliest accidents involving the 737-200 and the deadliest in Philippines.

Title: Philippine Airlines Flight 812
Explanation: Philippine Airlines Flight 812, an Airbus A330-301 operating a domestic flight in the Philippines, undergoes an attempted hijacking shortly before landing at Ninoy Aquino International Airport in Manila; all 290 passengers and crew survive the incident, but the hijacker jumps from the aircraft to his death.

Title: Wuhan Airlines Flight 343
Explanation: Wuhan Airlines Flight 343, a Xian Y-7, is struck by lightning and crashes in Hanyang District, Wuhan, killing all 42 on board and another seven on the ground in the worst ever accident involving the Y-7.

Title: Malév Flight 262
Explanation: Malév Flight 262, a Tupolev Tu-154, lands on its belly at Thessaloniki International Airport in Greece; there are no serious injuries or fatalities.

Title: Aerocaribe Flight 7831
Explanation: Aerocaribe Flight 7831, a British Aerospace Jetstream 32, crashes near Chulum Juárez, Mexico, killing all 19 on board.

Title: Hapag-Lloyd Flight 3378
Explanation: Hapag-Lloyd Flight 3378, an Airbus A310, crash lands 650 metres (2,130 ft) short of the runway in Vienna after running out of fuel in flight; there are no serious injuries or fatalities.

Title: Alliance Air Flight 7412
Explanation: Alliance Air Flight 7412, a Boeing 737-200, crashes into government housing in Patna, India, as it approaches the airport, killing 55 of the 58 on board and five people on the ground.

Title: Air France Flight 4590
Explanation: Air France Flight 4590, a Concorde crashes during takeoff from Paris, France, after striking debris on the runway, killing all 100 passengers and nine crew aboard as well as four people on the ground; the entire Concorde fleet is grounded for one year.

Title: Southwest Airlines Flight 1763
Explanation: Southwest Airlines Flight 1763, a Boeing 737-7H4 experienced air rage when a 19-year-old stormed the cockpit and attempted to crash the plane before being subdued by six to eight people; the aircraft landed safely; the 19-year-old was killed, and one other person was injured.

Title: Gulf Air Flight 072
Explanation: Gulf Air Flight 072, an Airbus A320, crashes into the Persian Gulf off Manama, Bahrain, while attempting to land; all 135 passengers and eight crew members are killed.

Title: Lao Aviation Flight 703
Explanation: Lao Aviation Flight 703, a Harbin Y-12 flying a domestic passenger flight in Laos, crashes into a mountain 12 km from Nathong Airport, killing eight of the 17 people on board.

Title: Singapore Airlines Flight 006
Explanation: Singapore Airlines Flight 006, a Boeing 747-400, strikes construction equipment after using a closed runway for takeoff at Chiang Kai-shek International Airport, Taiwan, killing 83 out of 179 people on board.

Title: Dirgantara Air Service Flight 3130
Explanation: Dirgantara Air Service Flight 3130, a Britten Norman BN-2 Islander operating a domestic flight in Indonesia, crashes into a forest on takeoff from Datah Dawai Airport in East Kalimantan due to overloading and pilot error; all 18 occupants survive the incident but 11 are seriously injured.

Title: Sabena Flight 877
Explanation: Sabena Flight 877, an Airbus A330-223, is damaged by Hutu rebels firing machine guns during landing at Bujumbura International Airport, Burundi; all 170 on board escape without fatalities, two people are injured.

Title: Yemenia Flight 448
Explanation: Yemenia Flight 448, a Boeing 727, is hijacked 15 minutes after takeoff from Sana'a International Airport, Yemen; the crew makes an emergency landing at Djibouti; the hijacker is subdued with no casualties to the 91 passengers or 10 crew members on board.

Title: RUTACA Airlines Flight 225
Explanation: RUTACA Airlines Flight 225, a Douglas DC-3, crashes shortly after takeoff from Tomás de Heres Airport, Venezuela, as a result of an engine failure; all 24 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Loganair Flight 670A
Explanation: Loganair Flight 670A, a Short 360 operating a postal flight, crashes shortly after takeoff from Edinburgh Airport, Scotland, as a result of a double engine failure; both crew members are killed.

Title: Thai Airways International Flight 114
Explanation: Thai Airways International Flight 114, a Boeing 737-400, is destroyed by an explosion while on the tarmac at Don Mueang Airport, Thailand, prior to boarding; one flight attendant is killed in the explosion.

Title: Air Caraïbes Flight 1501
Explanation: Air Caraïbes Flight 1501, a DHC-6 Twin Otter, crashes into a house whilst on approach into Saint Barthélemy Airport, Guadeloupe; all 19 passengers and crew, as well as one person on the ground, are killed.

Title: Vladivostok Air Flight 352
Explanation: Vladivostok Air Flight 352, a Tupolev Tu-154, enters a flat spin on approach to Irkutsk Airport in Irkutsk, Russia, crashes down onto its belly and bursts into flames in a wooded area, killing all 145 aboard.

Title: Rus Flight 9633
Explanation: Rus Flight 9633, an Ilyushin Il-76TD, crashed on take-off from Chkalovsky Air Base, Moscow Oblast, Russia. The cause is attributed to aircraft overloading and take-off configuration. All 10 people on board are killed.

Title: Air Transat Flight 236
Explanation: Air Transat Flight 236, an Airbus A330, makes an emergency landing in the Azores after running out of fuel over the Atlantic Ocean; some tires blow out upon landing, causing a fire that is extinguished by emergency personnel on the ground; none of the 293 passengers or 13 crew on board the aircraft is seriously injured.

Title: Binter Mediterráneo Flight 8261
Explanation: Binter Mediterráneo Flight 8261, a CASA CN-235, suffers port engine failure and crashes onto the N-340 road while attempting to make an emergency landing at Ruiz Picasso International Airport, killing four of 43 on board; the pilot initially survives, but dies several hours later.

Title: September 11 attacks
Explanation:
American Airlines Flight 11, a Boeing 767-200ER with 92 people on board, is hijacked after taking off from Boston, and is flown into the north tower of the World Trade Center in New York City; all on board are killed as well as around 1600 people on the ground and in the building; the collapse of both towers brings the total death toll from the two crashes to at least 2,763, the deadliest disaster involving commercial aircraft.
September 11

Title: American Airlines Flight 11
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 11, a Boeing 767-200ER with 92 people on board, is hijacked after taking off from Boston, and is flown into the north tower of the World Trade Center in New York City; all on board are killed as well as around 1600 people on the ground and in the building; the collapse of both towers brings the total death toll from the two crashes to at least 2,763, the deadliest disaster involving commercial aircraft.

Title: United Airlines Flight 175
Explanation: United Airlines Flight 175, a Boeing 767-200 with 65 people on board, is hijacked after taking off from Boston and is flown into the south tower of the World Trade Center in New York City; all on board are killed as well as around 900 people on the ground and in the building; the collapse of both towers brings the total death toll from the two crashes to at least 2,763, the deadliest disaster involving commercial aircraft.

Title: American Airlines Flight 77
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 77, a Boeing 757-200 with 64 people on board, is hijacked after taking off from Dulles International Airport and is flown into the Pentagon; all on board are killed as well as 125 people in the building and on the ground.

Title: United Airlines Flight 93
Explanation: United Airlines Flight 93, a Boeing 757-200 with 44 people on board, is hijacked after taking off from Newark, New Jersey; passengers struggle with the hijackers, and the aircraft crashes in a field near Shanksville, Pennsylvania, killing all on board.

Title: Korean Air Flight 085
Explanation: Korean Air Flight 085 (false alarm). A Boeing 747-4B5, received information about the September 11 attacks. The plane later sent a distress signal indicating that the plane was hijacked.

Title: TAM Flight 9755
Explanation: TAM Airlines Flight 9755, a Fokker 100 operating a domestic flight in Brazil, suffers an uncontained engine failure near Belo Horizonte; debris shatters three windows causing decompression of the aircraft; one passenger is partially blown out of the cabin and later dies, but the other 87 passengers and crew survive.

Title: Siberia Airlines Flight 1812
Explanation: Siberia Airlines Flight 1812, a Tupolev Tu-154, is shot down by the Ukrainian military over the Black Sea; all 66 passengers and 12 crew members are killed.

Title: Linate Airport disaster
Explanation: In the Linate Airport disaster, Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 686, an MD-87, crashes into a Cessna business jet on takeoff from Milan, Italy, then swerves into a baggage handling building and catches fire; all 110 people on board the MD-87 and all four in the Cessna are killed, as well as four people on the ground.

Title: Flightline Flight 101
Explanation: Flightline Flight 101, a Fairchild Swearingen Metroliner, crashes into the Mediterranean Sea near the Columbretes Islands after a lightning strike, killing all 10 on board.

Title: American Airlines Flight 587
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 587, an Airbus A300, crashes into a Queens neighborhood in New York City when the plane's vertical tail fin snaps off just after takeoff due to overuse of the rudder by the first officer during a wake turbulence encounter; all 251 passengers and nine crew members on board are killed as well as five people on the ground.

Title: Crossair Flight 3597
Explanation: Crossair Flight 3597, an Avro RJ100, crashes near Bassersdorf, Switzerland, while attempting to land in Zürich; 24 of the 33 people on board lose their lives.

Title: Garuda Indonesia Flight 421
Explanation: Garuda Indonesia Flight 421, a Boeing 737-300, experiences a dual flameout after entering a thunderstorm, and is forced to ditch in the Bengawan Solo River in Indonesia; a flight attendant is killed. All other 59 people on board survive the accident.

Title: TAME Flight 120
Explanation: TAME Flight 120, a Boeing 727, crashes into a volcano on approach to Tulcán, Ecuador, in low-visibility conditions; all 94 on board are killed.

Title: Iran Air Tours Flight 956
Explanation: Iran Air Tours Flight 956, a Tupolev Tu-154, crashes into the Sefid Kooh mountains during heavy rain, snow, and dense fog, while descending for Khorramabad Airport; all twelve crew members and 107 passengers are killed.

Title: Air China Flight 129
Explanation: Air China Flight 129, a Boeing 767-200ER, crashes into a hill during a landing attempt at Busan, South Korea, in misty conditions; of the 155 passengers and 11 crew, 37 survive.

Title: EAS Airlines Flight 4226
Explanation: EAS Airlines Flight 4226, a BAC 1-11 500 series, crashes into the Gwammaja neighborhood at Kano, Nigeria, shortly after takeoff; the ensuing crash results in the deaths of 73 on board and at least 30 civilians on the ground.

Title: EgyptAir Flight 843
Explanation: EgyptAir Flight 843, a Boeing 737-566, crashes near Tunis, Tunisia, while landing in rough weather; of the 62 people on board, 14 die.

Title: China Northern Airlines Flight 6136
Explanation: China Northern Airlines Flight 6136, a McDonnell Douglas MD-82, crashes near Dalian, China, after a passenger sets fire to the cabin with gasoline; all 103 passengers and nine crew are killed.

Title: China Airlines Flight 611
Explanation: China Airlines Flight 611, a Boeing 747-200B, disintegrates above the Taiwan Strait in mid-flight due to maintenance error, killing all 225 people on board.

Title: Überlingen mid-air collision
Explanation: In the Überlingen mid-air collision, Bashkirian Airlines Flight 2937, a Tupolev Tu-154 with 60 passengers and nine crew members on board, collides with DHL Flight 611, a Boeing 757 freighter with two pilots on board near Lake Constance, Germany; all people on both planes die.

Title: FedEx Express Flight 1478
Explanation: FedEx Express Flight 1478, a Boeing 727, crashes during landing at Tallahassee International Airport, Florida; all three crew members survive but the aircraft is written off.

Title: Pulkovo Aviation Enterprise Flight 9560
Explanation: Pulkovo Aviation Enterprise Flight 9560, an Ilyushin Il-86 on a re-positioning flight, crashes after takeoff from Sheremetyevo International Airport in Moscow, Russia, killing 14 out of 16 crew members on board.

Title: Rico Linhas Aéreas Flight 4823
Explanation: Rico Linhas Aéreas Flight 4823, an Embraer EMB 120 Brasília, crashes on approach to Rio Branco International Airport, Brazil, in a rainstorm; the aircraft breaks up into three pieces and catches fire; 23 of 31 on board die.

Title: Total Linhas Aéreas Flight 5561
Explanation: Total Linhas Aéreas Flight 5561, an ATR 42, crashes near Paranapanema, São Paulo, Brazil, due to a pitch trim control system failure, killing both pilots.

Title: Northwest Airlines Flight 85
Explanation: Northwest Airlines Flight 85, a Boeing 747, experiences a rudder hardover; the crew make an emergency landing at Ted Stevens Anchorage International Airport and all 404 people on board are unharmed.

Title: Luxair Flight 9642
Explanation: Luxair Flight 9642, a Fokker F50, crashes short of the runway on approach to Luxembourg Findel Airport in foggy weather conditions; of the 19 passengers and three crew on board, only two survive.

Title: Laoag International Airlines Flight 585
Explanation: Laoag International Airlines Flight 585, a Fokker F-27 Friendship, crashes into Manila Bay shortly after takeoff from Ninoy Aquino International Airport; of the 34 people on board, 19 are killed.

Title: TransAsia Airways Flight 791
Explanation: TransAsia Airways Flight 791, an ATR 72-200 operating a cargo flight from Taipei to Macau, crashes into the sea near Penghu, Taiwan, killing both pilots.

Title: Aeromist-Kharkiv Flight 2137
Explanation: Aeromist-Kharkiv Flight 2137, an Antonov An-140, crashes near Ardestan in Iran whilst descending into Isfahan International Airport, claiming the lives of all 44 on board; the accident is found to have been caused by insufficient crew training.

Title: Turkish Airlines Flight 634
Explanation: Turkish Airlines Flight 634, an Avro RJ100, crashes during its final approach to land at Diyarbakır Airport, Turkey, in extensive fog; 5 crew and 70 passengers are killed, while 5 passengers survive with serious injuries.

Title: TANS Perú Flight 222
Explanation: TANS Perú Flight 222, a Fokker F28, crashes while on approach to Chachapoyas Airport; all 46 on board die.

Title: Air Algérie Flight 6289
Explanation: Air Algérie Flight 6289, a Boeing 737-200, veers off the runway on takeoff in Tamanrasset, Algeria; 96 of the 97 passengers and all six crew members die.

Title: UM Airlines Flight 4230
Explanation: UM Airlines Flight 4230, a Yakovlev Yak-42 crashes into the side of a mountain near the town of Maçka, Turkey. All 75 people are killed.

Title: Qantas Flight 1737
Explanation: A man attempts to hijack Qantas Flight 1737, a Boeing 717, in Melbourne, Australia, intending to crash the plane in Tasmania. He is overpowered by the flight crew and passengers, but injures three people.

Title: Air France Flight 5672
Explanation: Air France Flight 5672, a Bombardier CRJ100ER operating a domestic flight from Nantes to Brest in France, crashes on approach to Brest-Guipavas Airport due to pilot error, killing one of the 24 people on board.

Title: Sudan Airways Flight 139
Explanation: Sudan Airways Flight 139, a Boeing 737-200, crashes shortly after taking off from Port Sudan, Sudan. 116 of the 117 people on board the plane die; a two-year-old boy is the sole survivor.

Title: Tropical Airways Flight 1301
Explanation: Tropical Airways Flight 1301, a Let L-410 Turbolet operating a domestic flight in Haiti, crashes into a field shortly after taking off from Cap-Haïtien International Airport, due to a cargo door failure; all 21 people on board are killed.

Title: Colgan Air Flight 9446
Explanation: Colgan Air Flight 9446, a Beech 1900D crashes into the sea just after taking off from Barnstable Municipal Airport, Massachusetts. Both pilots are killed.

Title: FedEx Express Flight 647
Explanation: FedEx Express Flight 647, a McDonnell Douglas MD-10-10, veers off the runway upon landing after a landing gear collapse and catches fire at Memphis International Airport; two crew members and five passengers escape with only minor injuries.

Title: UTA Flight 141
Explanation: UTA Flight 141, a Boeing 727, runs off the end of the runway upon takeoff at Cotonou, Benin, and crashes onto the beach on the Bight of Benin, killing 138 of the 160 occupants and three people on the ground.

Title: Flash Airlines Flight 604
Explanation: Flash Airlines Flight 604, a Boeing 737-300, crashes into the Red Sea, killing all 135 passengers and 13 crew members in the worst ever accident involving the 737-300.

Title: Uzbekistan Airways Flight 1154
Explanation: Uzbekistan Airways Flight 1154, a Yakovlev Yak-40 collides with a radar station on approach into Tashkent International Airport, Uzbekistan in poor weather. All 37 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Kish Air Flight 7170
Explanation: Kish Air Flight 7170, a Fokker 50, crashes at Sharjah International Airport, killing 43 people. Three survive with serious injuries.

Title: Rico Linhas Aéreas Flight 4815
Explanation: Rico Linhas Aéreas Flight 4815, an Embraer 120ER, crashes while on approach to Eduardo Gomes International Airport, killing all 33 passengers and crew on board; the cause is never determined.

Title: Gabon Express Flight 221
Explanation: Gabon Express Flight 221, a Hawker Siddeley HS 748 crashes into the sea after attempting an emergency landing at Libreville International Airport, Gabon after an engine failure. 19 of the 30 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Air Tahoma Flight 185
Explanation: Air Tahoma Flight 185, a Convair 580, crashes near Covington, Kentucky, while descending to land, killing the first officer.

Title: No title
Explanation: Siberia Airlines Flight 1047, a Tupolev Tu-154, explodes in mid-air while flying over Rostov Oblast, Russia, killing all 38 passengers and eight crew members on board.

Title: No title
Explanation: Volga-AviaExpress Flight 1303, a Tupolev Tu-134, explodes in mid-air while flying over Tula Oblast, Russia, killing all 34 passengers and nine crew members on board.

Title: MK Airlines Flight 1602
Explanation: MK Airlines Flight 1602, a Boeing 747-200F, crashes on takeoff from Halifax Stanfield International Airport, killing all seven on board.

Title: Pinnacle Airlines Flight 3701
Explanation: Pinnacle Airlines Flight 3701, a CRJ-200 on a repositioning flight with no passengers, crashes near Jefferson City, Missouri, killing both pilots.

Title: Corporate Airlines Flight 5966
Explanation: Corporate Airlines Flight 5966, a British Aerospace Jetstream, crashes near Kirksville, Missouri, United States; 13 of the 15 people on board die.

Title: China Eastern Airlines Flight 5210
Explanation: China Eastern Airlines Flight 5210, a Bombardier CRJ200, stalls and crashes near Baotou, China, shortly after takeoff because of frost contamination; all 53 on board and two people on the ground are killed.

Title: Lion Air Flight 583
Explanation: Lion Air Flight 583, a McDonnell Douglas MD-82, crash-lands in Solo City, Indonesia, killing 25 of the 154 people on board.

Title: Kam Air Flight 904
Explanation: Kam Air Flight 904, a Boeing 737-200, crashes due to a snowstorm in the Pamir Mountains of Afghanistan. All 96 passengers and eight crew members die.

Title: British Airways Flight 268
Explanation: British Airways Flight 268, a Boeing 747-400, taking off from Los Angeles to London suffers fire in engine 2. The plane flies on three engines to Manchester, where it performs an emergency landing. None of the 369 people on board are harmed.

Title: Air Transat Flight 961
Explanation: Air Transat Flight 961, an Airbus A310, suffers rudder failure after takeoff from Varadero, Cuba; the aircraft returns to Cuba with no casualties.

Title: Regional Airlines Flight 9288
Explanation: Regional Airlines Flight 9288, an Antonov An-24RV, stalls and crashes into a small hill near Varandey Airport, Russia, due to a possible instrument failure, killing 28 of 52 on board.

Title: West Caribbean Airways Flight 9955
Explanation: West Caribbean Airways Flight 9955, a Let L-410 Turbolet operating a domestic flight in Colombia, South America, stalls due to engine failure and crashes into a forest shortly after departing from El Embrujo Airport on Providencia Island, killing nine of the 14 people on board.

Title: Airwork Flight 23
Explanation: Airwork Flight 23, a Fairchild SA227-AC Metro III operating a cargo flight between the north and south islands of New Zealand, breaks up in mid-air and crashes in Stratford, North Island, due to pilot error, killing the two crew members on board.

Title: Lockhart River air disaster
Explanation: In the Lockhart River air disaster, an Aero-Tropics Air Services Fairchild Swearingen Metroliner operating on behalf of Transair strikes terrain on approach into Lockhart River Airport, Australia. All 15 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Air France Flight 358
Explanation: Air France Flight 358, an Airbus A340-300, skids off a runway at Toronto Pearson International Airport, Ontario, while landing and catches fire; all 309 on board escape without fatalities, 43 people are injured, the aircraft is completely destroyed by the fire.

Title: Tuninter Flight 1153
Explanation: Tuninter Flight 1153, an ATR 72, ditches into the Mediterranean Sea near Palermo, Sicily, with 35 passengers and four crew members on board; 14 passengers and two crew members die.

Title: Copterline Flight 103
Explanation: Copterline Flight 103, a Sikorsky S-76 helicopter crashes off Tallinn, Estonia, killing all 14 on board.

Title: Helios Airways Flight 522
Explanation: Helios Airways Flight 522, a Boeing 737-300, crashes near Kalamos, Greece, with 115 passengers and six crew members on board; there are no survivors.

Title: West Caribbean Airways Flight 708
Explanation: West Caribbean Airways Flight 708, a McDonnell Douglas MD-80, crashes in western Venezuela. All on board, 152 passengers and eight crew members, die.

Title: TANS Perú Flight 204
Explanation: TANS Perú Flight 204, a Boeing 737-200, crashes on approach to Captain Rolden International Airport, Pucallpa, Peru. Thirty-five of the 91 passengers on board, as well as five of the seven crew members, die.

Title: Mandala Airlines Flight 091
Explanation: Mandala Airlines Flight 091, a Boeing 737-200, crashes in Medan, Indonesia, killing 103 of the 111 passengers and all five crew members on board the aircraft and an additional 47 people on the ground.

Title: JetBlue Flight 292
Explanation: JetBlue Flight 292, an Airbus A320, makes an emergency landing at Los Angeles International Airport because of landing gear steering failure. There are no injuries to the 139 passengers and six crew members.

Title: Bellview Airlines Flight 210
Explanation: Bellview Airlines Flight 210, a Boeing 737-200, crashes shortly after takeoff from Murtala Muhammed International Airport in Lagos, Nigeria, killing all 117 people on board.

Title: Southwest Airlines Flight 1248
Explanation: Southwest Airlines Flight 1248, a Boeing 737-700, slides off the runway during landing at Chicago Midway International Airport in Chicago in heavy snow. None of the people on board are injured, but the plane hits two automobiles on the ground, killing a passenger.

Title: Sosoliso Airlines Flight 1145
Explanation: Sosoliso Airlines Flight 1145, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9 with 110 people on board, crashes during landing in Port Harcourt, Nigeria. Of the 110 people on board; only two survive.

Title: Chalk's Ocean Airways Flight 101
Explanation: Chalk's Ocean Airways Flight 101, a Grumman Mallard, crashes off the coast of Miami Beach, Florida, killing all 20 on board.

Title: Azerbaijan Airlines Flight 217
Explanation: Azerbaijan Airlines Flight 217, an Antonov An-140, crashes shortly after takeoff from Baku Airport due to instrument failure, killing all 23 on board.

Title: TEAM Linhas Aéreas Flight 6865
Explanation: TEAM Linhas Aéreas Flight 6865, a Let L-410 Turbolet crashes whilst conducting a VFR approach to Macaé Airport, Brazil. All 19 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Armavia Flight 967
