Explanation: Armavia Flight 967, an Airbus A320, crashes into the Black Sea near the Russian city of Sochi, killing all 113 on board.

Title: S7 Airlines Flight 778
Explanation: S7 Airlines Flight 778, an Airbus A310, crashes into a concrete barricade at Irkutsk International Airport, Russia, upon landing and catches fire. Of the 203 people on board, 125 are killed.

Title: PIA Flight 688
Explanation: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 688, a Fokker F27, crashes into a wheat field near Multan, Pakistan, ten minutes after taking off, killing all 41 passengers and four crew members on board.

Title: FedEx Express Flight 630
Explanation: FedEx Flight 630, a McDonnell Douglas MD-10, crashes on landing at Memphis International Airport, Tennessee, after the left main landing gear collapses shortly after touchdown, all three crew members are seriously injured.

Title: Air Algérie Flight 2208
Explanation: Air Algérie Flight 2208, a Lockheed L‑100 Hercules in Northern Italy crashes as a result of an autopilot malfunction. All three on board are killed.

Title: Pulkovo Aviation Enterprise Flight 612
Explanation: Pulkovo Aviation Enterprise Flight 612, a Tupolev Tu-154, crashes near Donetsk, Ukraine, killing all 170 people on board.The cockpit section of Comair Flight 5191

Title: Comair Flight 5191
Explanation: Comair Flight 5191, a Bombardier Canadair CRJ-100, crashes on takeoff at Blue Grass Airport, Kentucky, due to runway confusion; of the 50 passengers and crew on board, the only survivor is the first officer.

Title: Iran Airtour Flight 945
Explanation: Iran Airtour Flight 945, a Tupolev Tu-154, crashes while attempting to land in Mashad, Iran, killing 28 of 154 on board.

Title: EasyJet Flight 6074
Explanation: EasyJet Flight 6074, an Airbus A319, en route from Alicante to Bristol, suffers an in-flight electric failure that causes loss of communication and most of the digital display of the instruments. The aircraft nearly collided with American Airlines Flight 63, a Boeing 777. All 144 on board the A319 survived without injury.

Title: Turkish Airlines Flight 1476
Explanation: Turkish Airlines Flight 1476, a Boeing 737, is hijacked in Greek airspace. The plane landed at Brindisi Airport, Italy, where the hijacker was arrested. All 113 people on board survive.

Title: Atlantic Airways Flight 670
Explanation: Atlantic Airways Flight 670, a BAe 146, slides off the runway at Stord Airport, Norway, due to hydroplaning and brake failure, killing four of the 16 people on board.

Title: Continental Airlines Flight 1883
Explanation: Continental Airlines Flight 1883, a Boeing 757, accidentally lands on a taxiway at Newark Liberty International Airport, New Jersey, none of the 154 people on board are injured.

Title: ADC Airlines Flight 053
Explanation: ADC Airlines Flight 053, a Boeing 737-200, crashes near Abuja, Nigeria, after encountering wind shear, killing 96 of the 105 people on board.

Title: Adam Air Flight 574
Explanation: Adam Air Flight 574, a Boeing 737-400 with 102 people on board, crashes into the ocean off the island of Sulawesi in Indonesia, killing all on board in the worst ever crash involving the 737-400.

Title: Air West Flight 612
Explanation: Air West Flight 612, a Boeing 737, is hijacked shortly after takeoff. The plane landed safely at N'Djamena International Airport, where the hijacker surrendered. All 103 people on board survive.

Title: Adam Air Flight 172
Explanation: Adam Air Flight 172, a Boeing 737-300, suffers structural damage while landing near Surabaya, Indonesia; none of the 149 people on board are seriously injured.

Title: Garuda Indonesia Flight 200
Explanation: Garuda Indonesia Flight 200, a Boeing 737-400, overshoots the runway and crashes while landing at Yogyakarta, Indonesia, killing 21 of the 140 people on board.

Title: UTair Flight 471
Explanation: UTair Flight 471, a Tupolev Tu-134, suffers severe structural damage while landing in Samara, Russia, killing six of the 63 people on board.

Title: Kenya Airways Flight 507
Explanation: Kenya Airways Flight 507, a Boeing 737-800 with 114 people on board, crashes near Douala, Cameroon, killing all on board.

Title: PMTair Flight 241
Explanation: PMTair Flight 241, an Antonov An-24, crashes in southwestern Cambodia, killing all 22 on board.

Title: TAM Airlines Flight 3054
Explanation: TAM Airlines Flight 3054, an Airbus A320, crashes at Congonhas-São Paulo Airport, Brazil, killing all 187 people on board and 12 on the ground.

Title: Air Moorea Flight 1121
Explanation: Air Moorea Flight 1121, a de Havilland Canada DHC-6, crashes into the lagoon of the island of Moorea in French Polynesia just 11 seconds after takeoff, killing all 20 on board.

Title: China Airlines Flight 120
Explanation: China Airlines Flight 120, a Boeing 737-800, bursts into flames after landing at Naha, Japan; none of the 165 passengers on board are seriously injured.

Date:
Scandinavian Airlines System Dash 8 landing gear incidents:
September 9
Title: Dash 8 landing gear incidents
Explanation:
Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 1209, a de Havilland Canada Dash 8, experiences a landing gear failure in Aalborg, Denmark; none of the 73 people on board is seriously injured, but three days later, after a similar incident, the airline grounds the aircraft type.
September 12

Title: No title
Explanation: Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 1209, a de Havilland Canada Dash 8, experiences a landing gear failure in Aalborg, Denmark; none of the 73 people on board is seriously injured, but three days later, after a similar incident, the airline grounds the aircraft type.

Title: No title
Explanation: Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 2748, a de Havilland Canada Dash 8, experiences a landing gear failure in Vilnius, Lithuania; none of the 52 people on board is injured, but because of a similar incident three days earlier, all their Dash 8s are grounded.

Title: No title
Explanation: Scandinavian Airlines System Flight 2867, a de Havilland Canada Dash 8, experiences a landing gear failure in Copenhagen, Denmark; none of the 44 people on board are injured, but because of similar incidents in September, the airline "permanently" removes its Dash 8s from service; the cause is eventually ascribed to maintenance error.

Title: One-Two-GO Airlines Flight 269
Explanation: One-Two-GO Airlines Flight 269, a McDonnell Douglas MD-82 carrying 130 people, crashes and bursts into flames after attempting to land in Phuket, Thailand, during poor weather conditions, killing 90 people.

Title: Atlasjet Flight 4203
Explanation: Atlasjet Flight 4203, a McDonnell Douglas MD-83, crashes into a mountain near Isparta, Turkey, killing all 57 on board.

Title: TAROM Flight 3107
Explanation: TAROM Flight 3107, a Boeing 737-300, is written-off after hitting a maintenance car on the runway and veering off the runway during takeoff run at Henri Coandă International Airport, Otopeni, Romania; none of the 123 passengers and crew on board are injured

Title: British Airways Flight 38
Explanation: British Airways Flight 38, a Boeing 777-200ER, lands short of the runway at London Heathrow Airport due to a fuel system problem; all 152 on board survive. This is the first loss of a Boeing 777-200ER, and the first loss of any 777 due to an operational incident.

Title: Eagle Airways Flight 2279
Explanation: Eagle Airways Flight 2279, a BAe Jetstream 32, is hijacked 10 minutes after taking off from Blenheim, New Zealand by a passenger who attacks both pilots. The hijacker is eventually restrained by the co-pilot and the flight lands safely at Christchurch. All nine on board survive the incident.

Title: Belavia Flight 1834
Explanation: Belavia Flight 1834, a Bombardier CRJ100, hits its left wing on the runway while taking off from Yerevan, Armenia. All 21 on board escape the aircraft before it erupts into flames.

Title: Santa Bárbara Airlines Flight 518
Explanation: Santa Bárbara Airlines Flight 518, an ATR 42-300, crashes shortly after taking off from Mérida, Venezuela, killing all 46 on board.

Title: Kata Air Transport Flight 007
Explanation: Kata Air Transport Flight 007, a Sudanese airline Antonov An-32 crashes when returning shortly after taking off from Chişinău International Airport, Moldova, for Turkey. All eight on board are killed.

Title: Hewa Bora Airways Flight 122
Explanation: Hewa Bora Airways Flight 122, a McDonnell Douglas DC-9, crashes into a market near Goma, Democratic Republic of the Congo, killing 40 people, including three passengers.

Title: Kalitta Air Flight 207
Explanation: Kalitta Air Flight 207, a Boeing 747-200, overruns the runway at Brussels, Belgium. No one is injured but the aircraft is written off.

Title: Moskovia Airlines Flight 9675
Explanation: Moskovia Airlines Flight 9675, a Moskovia Airlines Antonov An-12 crashes shortly after takeoff from Chelyabinsk Airport, Russia due to an onboard fire. All nine crew members are killed.

Title: TACA Flight 390
Explanation: TACA Flight 390, an Airbus A320, overruns the runway at Toncontín International Airport in Tegucigalpa, Honduras, killing five (including two on ground).

Title: Sudan Airways Flight 109
Explanation: Sudan Airways Flight 109, an Airbus A310, overruns the runway at Khartoum International Airport and breaks apart due to a long flaring distance. Of the 214 people on board, 30 are killed.

Title: Centurion Air Cargo Flight 164
Explanation: Centurion Air Cargo Flight 164, a Boeing 747-200BSF operated by Kalitta Air, crashes shortly after taking off from Bogota's El Dorado International Airport, Colombia due to an engine failure. All eight crew survive, but two on the ground are killed.

Title: Qantas Flight 30
Explanation: Qantas Flight 30, a Boeing 747-400 en route from Hong Kong to Melbourne, performs an emergency descent and lands in Manila after a hull penetration results in rapid decompression; all aboard survive.

Title: East Coast Jets Flight 81
Explanation: East Coast Jets Flight 81, a Hawker 800 overran the runway and crashed into a cornfield near Owatonna Degner Regional Airport in Minnesota. All eight onboard were killed.

Title: Spanair Flight 5022
Explanation: Spanair Flight 5022, a McDonnell Douglas MD-82, crashes on takeoff at Barajas Airport in Madrid, Spain. Of the 172 people on board, 154 are killed.

Title: Iran Aseman Airlines Flight 6895
Explanation: Iran Aseman Airlines Flight 6895, a Boeing 737, crashes just after takeoff from Manas Airport in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. 68 of the 90 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: Sriwijaya Air Flight 062
Explanation: Sriwijaya Air Flight 062, a Boeing 737-200 overruns the runway at Sultan Thaha Airport, Indonesia during a landing attempt, resulting in 26 injuries (14 of them serious). One person on the ground later dies from their injuries.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 821
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 821, a Boeing 737, crashes on approach to Perm Airport from Moscow due to pilot error, killing all 88 people on board in the worst ever accident involving the Boeing 737-500.

Title: Qantas Flight 72
Explanation: Qantas Flight 72, an Airbus A330-300, makes an emergency landing in Exmouth, Australia, following a rapid descent that leaves over 70 people injured, 14 of them seriously.

Title: Yeti Airlines Flight 103
Explanation: Yeti Airlines Flight 103, a de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter, crashes 60 nautical miles (110 km) from Mt Everest, Nepal, killing 18 of 19 people on board.

Title: Ryanair Flight 4102
Explanation: Ryanair Flight 4102, a Boeing 737, suffers up to 90 bird strikes on its final approach to Rome Ciampino Airport, damaging landing gear and both engines. The aircraft lands safely; 10 of the 172 on board are treated for minor injuries.

Title: XL Airways Germany Flight 888T
Explanation: XL Airways Germany Flight 888T, an Airbus A320, crashes into the Mediterranean Sea on approach into Perpignan-Rivesaltes Airport, France. All seven on board are killed.

Title: Continental Airlines Flight 1404
Explanation: Continental Airlines Flight 1404, a Boeing 737-500 with 115 people on board, veers off the runway upon takeoff from Denver International Airport, comes to rest in a ravine near the runway and catches fire; 38 people are injured.

Title: US Airways Flight 1549
Explanation: US Airways Flight 1549, an Airbus A320 bound for Charlotte, North Carolina, ditches in the Hudson River shortly after taking off from LaGuardia Airport, New York City, due to total engine failure caused by multiple bird strikes; all 155 people on board survive the accident.

Title: Empire Airlines Flight 8284
Explanation: Empire Airlines Flight 8284, an ATR 42-300 operating a FedEx cargo flight in Texas, United States, crashes on approach to Lubbock Preston Smith International Airport due to pilot error; the two pilots on board survive the accident but the aircraft is destroyed.

Title: Colgan Air Flight 3407
Explanation: Colgan Air Flight 3407, a Bombardier Dash 8 Q400 flying from Newark, New Jersey, to Buffalo, New York, United States, crashes into a house in Clarence Center, New York state, killing all 49 on board the aircraft and one person on the ground.

Title: Cougar Helicopters Flight 91
Explanation: Cougar Helicopters Flight 91, a Sikorsky S-92 transporting workers to oil platforms off Canada's Newfoundland coast, ditches in the Atlantic Ocean 34 miles (55 km) east-southeast of Newfoundland due to a main gearbox failure; 17 of the 18 on board are killed.

Title: Emirates Flight 407
Explanation: Emirates Flight 407, an Airbus A340-500 en route from Auckland, New Zealand, to Dubai, United Arab Emirates, suffers a tailstrike when attempting to take off from its intermediate stopover at Melbourne's Tullamarine Airport; the aircraft returns to the airport with no casualties.

Title: FedEx Express Flight 80
Explanation: FedEx Express Flight 80, a McDonnell Douglas MD-11 operating a cargo flight from Guangzhou, China, to Narita, Japan, crashes while attempting to land at Tokyo Narita International Airport, killing the two crew members on board the flight.

Title: Bond Offshore Helicopters Flight 85N
Explanation: Bond Offshore Helicopters Flight 85N, a Eurocopter AS332 Super Puma returning from the Miller oilfield off the Aberdeenshire coast, Scotland, crashes 11 nautical miles (20 km) northeast of Peterhead due to a catastrophic failure of the main rotor gearbox; all 16 on board are killed.

Title: Mimika Air Flight 514
Explanation: Mimika Air Flight 514, a Pilatus PC-6 operating a domestic flight in Western New Guinea, Indonesia, crashes into Mount Gergaji due to pilot error, killing all 11 people on board.

Title: CanJet Flight 918
Explanation: CanJet Flight 918, a Boeing 737 operating a flight from Montego Bay, Jamaica, bound for Halifax, Canada, is seized on the ground before takeoff by a lone gunman; all 174 passengers are quickly released, but six crew members are taken hostage for several hours before being freed unharmed.

Title: Yemenia Flight 626
Explanation: Yemenia Flight 626, an Airbus A310 flying from Sanaa, Yemen, to Moroni, Comoros, crashes into the Indian Ocean on approach to Prince Said Ibrahim International Airport due to pilot error; all but one of the 153 occupants are killed, the sole survivor being a 12-year-old girl who is found clinging to the wreckage.

Title: Southwest Airlines Flight 2294
Explanation: Southwest Airlines Flight 2294, a Boeing 737 en route from Nashville, Tennessee, to Baltimore, Maryland, United States, makes an emergency landing in Charleston, West Virginia, after a large hole opens in the skin of the fuselage at 34,000 feet (10,000 m) causing a loss of cabin pressure; the aircraft lands safely and no-one is injured.

Title: Caspian Airlines Flight 7908
Explanation: Caspian Airlines Flight 7908, a Tupolev Tu-154 flying from Tehran, Iran, to Yerevan, Armenia, crashes 16 minutes after takeoff due to uncontained engine failure, killing all 168 people on board.

Title: Aria Air Flight 1525
Explanation: Aria Air Flight 1525, an Ilyushin Il-62 operating a domestic flight in Iran, overshoots the runway while attempting to land at Mashhad International Airport, killing 16 of the 173 on board.

Title: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 9760
Explanation: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 9760, a de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter operating a domestic flight in the Indonesian province of Papua, crashes into a mountain on approach to Oksibil Airport in good weather, due to pilot error; all 15 people on board are killed.

Title: Bangkok Airways Flight 266
Explanation: Bangkok Airways Flight 266, an ATR 72-200 operating a domestic flight in Thailand, crashes while attempting to land at Samui Airport on Ko Samui island, resulting in at least one confirmed death and 37 injuries amongst the 72 people on board.

Title: Airlines PNG Flight 4684
Explanation: Airlines PNG Flight 4684, a de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter operating a domestic flight in southeastern Papua New Guinea, crashes into mountainous terrain while on approach to Kokoda Airport due to poor visibility; all 13 people on board die in the accident.

Title: Aeroméxico Flight 576
Explanation: Aeroméxico Flight 576, a Boeing 737 flying from Cancún to Mexico City, Mexico, is hijacked by a Bolivian man carrying a fake explosive device; after landing in Mexico City, the aircraft is stormed by officials and all 107 passengers and crew are released unharmed.

Title: Airlink Flight 8911
Explanation: Airlink Flight 8911, a BAe Jetstream 41 operating a domestic flight in South Africa, crashes into a school shortly after taking off from Durban International Airport; the pilot dies two weeks later from injuries sustained in the crash.

Title: Azza Transport Flight 2241
Explanation: Azza Transport Flight 2241, a Boeing 707 bound for Khartoum, Sudan, crashes on takeoff from Sharjah International Airport, United Arab Emirates, due to pilot error; all six on board the aircraft are killed.

Title: RwandAir Flight 205
Explanation: RwandAir Flight 205, a Bombardier CRJ-100 bound for Entebbe, Uganda, crashes into a terminal building at Kigali International Airport in Rwanda shortly after returning for an emergency landing due to difficulties with the flight controls; one of the 10 passengers is killed.

Title: Avient Aviation Flight 324
Explanation: Avient Aviation Flight 324, a McDonnell Douglas MD-11F bound for Manas International Airport, Kyrgyzstan, overshoots the runway during takeoff at Shanghai Pudong International Airport, China, killing three of the seven crew members on board.The aftermath of American Airlines Flight 331

Title: American Airlines Flight 331
Explanation: American Airlines Flight 331, a Boeing 737-800 operating a flight from the United States to Kingston, Jamaica, overshoots the runway on landing at Norman Manley International Airport due to pilot error; there are multiple injuries amongst the 154 people on board.

Title: Northwest Airlines Flight 253
Explanation: Northwest Airlines Flight 253, an Airbus A330-300 flying from Amsterdam Airport Schiphol, Netherlands, to Detroit Metropolitan Airport, Michigan, United States, is attacked by a man using a small explosive device, causing a small onboard fire; the perpetrator is subdued by passengers and crew, and the fire quickly extinguished.

Title: Taban Air Flight 6437
Explanation: Taban Air Flight 6437, a Tupolev Tu-154M operating a domestic flight in Iran, crashed while making an emergency landing at Mashhad International Airport; all 170 occupants on board survived with 47 receiving minor injuries.

Title: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 409
Explanation: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 409, a Boeing 737-800 bound for the Ethiopian capital, Addis Ababa, crashed into the Mediterranean Sea shortly after takeoff from Beirut Rafic Hariri International Airport; all 90 people on board were killed.

Title: AeroUnion Flight 302
Explanation: AeroUnion Flight 302, an Airbus A300B4F operating a cargo flight from Mexico City, crashed following a missed approach to Monterrey International Airport, Mexico; all five crew members were killed, as well as one person on the ground.

Title: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 836
Explanation: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 836, a Boeing 737 operating a domestic flight in Indonesia, overshot the runway at Rendani Airport; all 103 people on board survived with three seriously injured.

Title: Cathay Pacific Flight 780
Explanation: Cathay Pacific Flight 780, an Airbus A330 flying from Juanda International Airport, Indonesia, to Hong Kong, conducted an emergency landing after the engine thrust controls malfunctioned due to contaminated fuel; 57 of the 309 passengers were injured in the following evacuation.

Title: Afriqiyah Airways Flight 771
Explanation: Afriqiyah Airways Flight 771, an Airbus A330 operating a flight from Johannesburg, South Africa, to Tripoli International Airport, Libya crashed while attempting to land in low visibility killing all but one of the 104 people on board.

Title: Pamir Airways Flight 112
Explanation: Pamir Airways Flight 112, an Antonov An-24 operating a domestic flight in Afghanistan, crashed shortly after taking off from Kunduz Airport; all 44 occupants were killed.

Title: Air India Express Flight 812
Explanation: Air India Express Flight 812, a Boeing 737-800 flying from Dubai, United Arab Emirates, to Mangalore, India, crashed after overshooting the runway at Mangalore International Airport; 158 of the 166 people on board were killed.

Title: Lufthansa Cargo Flight 8460
Explanation: Lufthansa Cargo Flight 8460, a McDonnell Douglas MD-11 operating a multi-leg flight from Frankfurt, Germany, to Hong Kong in southern China, crashed on landing at King Khalid International Airport in Saudi Arabia; both occupants of the aircraft survived the accident.

Title: Airblue Flight 202
Explanation: Airblue Flight 202, an Airbus A321 operating a domestic flight in Pakistan, crashed in the Margalla Hills northeast of Islamabad, resulting in the deaths of all 152 occupants on board; it was the first fatal accident involving an Airbus A321 and Pakistan's worst aviation accident.

Title: Katekavia Flight 9357
Explanation: Katekavia Flight 9357, an Antonov An-24 operating a domestic flight in Russia, crashed on approach to Igarka Airport in Krasnoyarsk Krai, killing 12 of the 15 people on board.

Title: AIRES Flight 8250
Explanation: AIRES Flight 8250, a Boeing 737 operating a domestic flight in Colombia, broke apart after crashing while landing at Gustavo Rojas Pinilla Airport in San Andrés; of the 131 occupants on board, two passengers were killed and another 129 were injured.

Title: Agni Air Flight 101
Explanation: Agni Air Flight 101, a Dornier Do 228 operating a domestic flight in Nepal, crashed near Shikharpur in heavy rain, shortly after departing from Kathmandu, killing all 14 people on board.

Title: Henan Airlines Flight 8387
Explanation: Henan Airlines Flight 8387, an Embraer E-190 operating a domestic flight in China, overshot the runway and crashed at Yichun, Heilongjiang, killing 44 of the 91 occupants on board; this was the first hull loss involving an Embraer E-Jet.

Title: UPS Airlines Flight 6
Explanation: UPS Airlines Flight 6, a Boeing 747-400 flying from Dubai, United Arab Emirates, to Cologne, Germany, crashed at Nad Al Sheba Military camp, Dubai while attempting to perform an emergency landing following an in-flight cargo fire, killing both crew members.

Title: Alrosa Flight 514
Explanation: Alrosa Flight 514, a Tupolev Tu-154M operating a domestic flight in Russia, performed a successful emergency landing at Izhma Airport after suffering in-flight electrical failure; the aircraft overshot the runway after landing but all 81 passengers and crew survived the accident uninjured.

Title: Conviasa Flight 2350
Explanation: Conviasa Flight 2350, an ATR-42 operating a domestic flight in Venezuela, crashed shortly before landing at Guayana International Airport, killing 17 of the 51 people on board.

Title: Aero Caribbean Flight 883
Explanation: Aero Caribbean Flight 883, an ATR-72 bound from Haiti to Cuba, lost control in icing conditions and crashed in the central Cuban province of Sancti Spíritus, killing all 68 occupants on board.

Title: Qantas Flight 32
Explanation: Qantas Flight 32, an Airbus A380 flying from London's Heathrow Airport to Sydney, Australia, suffered an uncontained engine failure after taking off from Singapore's Changi Airport; the flight returned to the airport and safely landed with all 469 people on board unharmed.

Title: Sun Way Flight 4412
Explanation: Sun Way Flight 4412, an Ilyushin Il-76TD flying from Karachi, Pakistan, to Khartoum, Sudan, suffered an engine fire and crashed near Jinnah International Airport, killing all eight crew on board and another four on the ground.

Title: Dagestan Airlines Flight 372
Explanation: Dagestan Airlines Flight 372, a Tupolev Tu-154 operating a domestic flight in Russia, skidded off the runway during an emergency landing at Domodedovo International Airport, killing two of the 160 passengers on board and injuring 92.

Title: Kolavia Flight 348
Explanation: Kolavia Flight 348, a Tupolev Tu-154, erupted in flames while taxiing at Surgut International Airport, Russia, killing 3 out of the 124 occupants and injuring 43.

Title: Iran Air Flight 277
Explanation: Iran Air Flight 277, a Boeing 727, crashed at Urmia Airport, Iran, during a go-around, killing 77 of 105 occupants on board.

Title: Manx2 Flight 7100
Explanation: Manx2 Flight 7100, a Fairchild Metroliner III, crashed at Cork Airport, Ireland, whilst attempting to land in low visibility conditions, killing 6 of 12 people on board.

Title: Central American Airways Flight 731
Explanation: Central American Airways Flight 731, a Let L-410 Turbolet, crashed while on approach to Toncontín International Airport, killing all 14 occupants on board the aircraft.

Title: Southwest Airlines Flight 812
Explanation: Southwest Airlines Flight 812, a Boeing 737, ruptured a hole in the fuselage at 36,000 feet, causing the cabin to lose pressure shortly after takeoff from Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport. The plane landed safely at Yuma International Airport, Arizona, with, out of the 116 people onboard, two passengers suffering minor injuries.

Title: Georgian Airways Flight 834
Explanation: Georgian Airways Flight 834, a Bombardier CRJ-100 operated by the United Nations Mission in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (MONUSCO) crashed on landing at N'djili Airport, Democratic Republic of the Congo; all but 1 of the 33 on board are killed.

Title: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 8968
Explanation: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 8968, a Xian MA60, crashed off the coast of West Papua, Indonesia, while on approach to Kaimana Airport in heavy rain, killing all 25 passengers and crew on board.

Title: Sol Líneas Aéreas Flight 5428
Explanation: Sol Líneas Aéreas Flight 5428, a Saab 340, crashed off Prahuaniyeu, Río Negro, Argentina, while en route to General Enrique Mosconi International Airport, Comodoro Rivadavia due to ice formation on the wings, propellers and under the fuselage, killing all 22 passengers and crew on board.

Title: RusAir Flight 9605
Explanation: RusAir Flight 9605, a Tupolev Tu-134, crashed onto the Russian highway A133 near the village of Besovets, Petrozavodsk, Russia, while on approach to Petrozavodsk Airport, killing 47 occupants of the 52 on board.

Title: Hewa Bora Airways Flight 952
Explanation: Hewa Bora Airways Flight 952, a Boeing 727, crashed on landing at Bangoka International Airport, Democratic Republic of the Congo, killing 74 of the 118 on board.

Title: Angara Airlines Flight 9007
Explanation: Angara Airlines Flight 9007, an Antonov An-24, ditched in the Ob River, Russia, following an engine fire, killing 7 of 37 on board.

Title: Noar Linhas Aéreas Flight 4896
Explanation: Noar Linhas Aéreas Flight 4896, a Let L-410 Turbolet, crashed shortly after takeoff from Recife Airport, Brazil, killing all 16 on board.

Title: Asiana Airlines Flight 991
Explanation: Asiana Airlines Flight 991, a Boeing 747 freighter, crashed into the Pacific Ocean, 112 kilometres (70 mi) west of Jeju Island, South Korea, killing the two crew.

Title: EgyptAir Flight 667
Explanation: EgyptAir Flight 667, a Boeing 777, suffered a cockpit fire at Cairo International Airport, injuring 7 of 317 on board.

Title: Caribbean Airlines Flight 523
Explanation: Caribbean Airlines Flight 523, a Boeing 737, overran the runway on landing at Cheddi Jagan International Airport, Georgetown, Guyana, and broke in two; 7 were injured but all 163 passengers and crew survived.

Title: Avis-Amur Flight 9209
Explanation: Avis-Amur Flight 9209, an Antonov An-12, en route from Magadan Airport to Keperveyem Airport, crashed at Omsukchan, Russia, due to an engine fire, killing all 11 on board.

Title: First Air Flight 6560
Explanation: First Air Flight 6560, a Boeing 737, crashed while on approach to Resolute Bay Airport, Nunavut, Canada, killing 12 of the 15 on board.

Title: Aerocon Flight 238
Explanation: Aerocon Flight 238, a Fairchild Metroliner III, crashed near Trinidad, Bolivia, killing eight of the nine people on board.

Title: Buddha Air Flight 103
Explanation: Buddha Air Flight 103, a Beechcraft 1900D, crashed in dense fog while attempting to land at Kathmandu Tribhuvan International Airport, killing all 16 passengers and 3 crew members.

Title: Nusantara Buana Air Flight 823
Explanation: Nusantara Buana Air Flight 823, a CASA C-212 Aviocar crashed in Indonesia during a domestic flight from Medan to Kutacane. All 18 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: Airlines PNG Flight 1600
Explanation: Airlines PNG Flight 1600, a de Havilland Canada DHC-8, crashed near the mouth of the Gogol River, Papua New Guinea, killing 28 of 32 on board.

Title: Iran Air Flight 742
Explanation: Iran Air Flight 742, a Boeing 727, en route from Moscow, Russia, to Tehran, Iran, landed without a nose gear at Mehrabad International Airport; all 94 passengers and 14 crew members survived uninjured.

Title: LOT Polish Airlines Flight 16
Explanation: LOT Polish Airlines Flight 16, a Boeing 767, performed a belly landing at Warsaw Chopin Airport after its landing gear failed to deploy; all 220 passengers and 11 crew members survived uninjured.

Title: JetBlue Flight 191
Explanation: JetBlue Flight 191, the captain of the Airbus A320 suffered a mental breakdown and started behaving erratically. The plane safely landed in Amarillo 20 minutes after the incident. None of the 135 occupants on board were injured.

Title: UTair Flight 120
Explanation: UTair Flight 120, an ATR-72, crashed shortly after takeoff from Roshchino International Airport, Tyumen, Russia, killing 31 of the 43 passengers and crew on board.

Title: Bhoja Air Flight 213
Explanation: Bhoja Air Flight 213, a Boeing 737, crashed near Chaklala airbase, Rawalpindi, Pakistan, in bad weather, killing all 127 people on board.

Title: Allied Air Flight 111
Explanation: Allied Air Flight 111, a Boeing 727, overran the runway on landing at Kotoka International Airport, Accra, Ghana, and crashed through a fence; the aircraft then hit a bus on a nearby road; all 4 crew members survived but 12 on the ground are killed.

Title: Dana Air Flight 0992
Explanation: Dana Air Flight 0992, a McDonnell Douglas MD-83 carrying 147 passengers and 6 crew members crashed in a suburb of Lagos, Nigeria, on approach to Murtala Muhammed International Airport, killing all on board and 6 more people on the ground.

Title: Sita Air Flight 601
Explanation: Sita Air Flight 601, a Dornier Do 228, crashed on the bank of the Manohara River, Kathmandu, Nepal, following a bird strike, killing all 19 on board.

Title: Air Bagan Flight 011
Explanation: Air Bagan Flight 011, a Fokker 100 crash-landed on a road near Heho Airport, Myanmar, killing 1 on board and 1 on the ground while injuring another 11.

Title: Red Wings Airlines Flight 9268
Explanation: Red Wings Airlines Flight 9268, a Tupolev Tu-204 on a re-positioning flight, overran the runway on landing at Moscow's Vnukovo International Airport, subsequently breaking apart and catching fire; five of the eight crew on board were killed in the first fatal accident involving the Tu-204.

Title: SCAT Airlines Flight 760
Explanation: SCAT Airlines Flight 760, a Bombardier CRJ200, crashed in thick fog on approach to Almaty International Airport, Kazakhstan, killing all 18 passengers and crew on board.

Title: South Airlines Flight 8971
Explanation: South Airlines Flight 8971, an Antonov An-24, crash-landed in dense fog at Donetsk International Airport, Ukraine, killing five of the 52 people on board.

Title: ACE Air Cargo Flight 51
Explanation: ACE Air Cargo Flight 51, a Beechcraft 1900C-1, crashed into a mountain whilst on approach to Dillingham Municipal Airport, Alaska. Both crew members were killed.

Title: Lion Air Flight 904
Explanation: Lion Air Flight 904, a Boeing 737-800 carrying 101 passengers and seven crew members, crashed into the ocean while attempting to land at Ngurah Rai International Airport on the Indonesian island of Bali, injuring 46 people on board.

Title: National Airlines Flight 102
Explanation: National Airlines Flight 102, a Boeing 747-400 freighter, stalled and crashed shortly after takeoff from Bagram Airfield, Afghanistan, due to load shifting, killing all seven crew members on board.

Title: Nepal Airlines Flight 555
Explanation: Nepal Airlines Flight 555, a de Havilland Canada DHC-6, overran the runway on landing at Jomsom Airport, Nepal, injuring seven people.

Title: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 6517
Explanation: Merpati Nusantara Airlines Flight 6517, a Xian MA60, crashed on landing at El Tari Airport, Indonesia, injuring five people on board.

Title: Asiana Airlines Flight 214
Explanation: Asiana Airlines Flight 214, a Boeing 777-200ER, crashed short of the runway on landing at San Francisco International Airport, killing three of the 307 occupants on board and injuring 182. The crash was the first fatal accident involving the Boeing 777.

Title: Southwest Airlines Flight 345
Explanation: Southwest Airlines Flight 345, a Boeing 737-700, suffered a landing gear collapse while landing at LaGuardia Airport, injuring 9 of the 150 occupants on board. The aircraft was written off.

Title: UPS Airlines Flight 1354
Explanation: UPS Airlines Flight 1354, an Airbus A300 freighter, crashed short of the runway on approach to Birmingham

Title: Associated Aviation Flight 361
Explanation: Associated Aviation Flight 361 an Embraer 120, crashed shortly after takeoff from Murtala Muhammed International Airport, Lagos, killing 16 of the 20 people on board.

Title: Lao Airlines Flight 301
Explanation: Lao Airlines Flight 301, an ATR-72, crashed shortly before landing at Pakse International Airport under adverse weather conditions, killing all 49 occupants on board.

Title: Tatarstan Airlines Flight 363
Explanation: Tatarstan Airlines Flight 363, a Boeing 737, crashed at Kazan International Airport, Russia, during a go-around, killing all 50 people on board.

Title: LAM Mozambique Airlines Flight 470
Explanation: LAM Mozambique Airlines Flight 470, an Embraer E190, en route from Maputo International Airport, Mozambique, to Quatro de Fevereiro Airport, Angola was deliberately crashed by the captain into Bwabwata National Park in northern Namibia, killing all 33 people on board.

Title: Nepal Airlines Flight 183
Explanation: Nepal Airlines Flight 183, a de Havilland Canada DHC-6, crashed near Khidim about 74 kilometres southwest of Pokhara, Nepal, killing all 18 people on board.

Title: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 702
Explanation: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 702, a Boeing 767, was hijacked by the co-pilot while en route from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, to Rome, Italy, but landed safely at Geneva, Switzerland. All 202 passengers and crew aboard were unharmed.

Title: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370
Explanation: Malaysia Airlines Flight 370, a Boeing 777-200ER en route from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing with 227 passengers and 12 crew on board, disappeared from radar over the Gulf of Thailand. A wing part was later found in Réunion. The main wreckage of the plane was never located. All 239 people on board were presumed dead.

Title: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17
Explanation: Malaysia Airlines Flight 17, a Boeing 777 en route from Amsterdam to Kuala Lumpur, was shot down over eastern Ukraine. All 283 passengers and 15 crew on board died; it is the deadliest airliner shootdown to date.

Title: TransAsia Airways Flight 222
Explanation: TransAsia Airways Flight 222, an ATR-72 en route from Kaohsiung to Penghu, Taiwan, crashed whilst executing a go-around, killing 48 of the 58 people on board.

Title: Air Algérie Flight 5017
Explanation: Air Algérie Flight 5017, a chartered Swiftair McDonnell Douglas MD-83 operating for Air Algérie en route from Burkina Faso to Algiers, crashed in the northern Mali desert after disappearing from radar around 50 minutes after takeoff, killing all 110 passengers and 6 crew members on board.

Title: Sepahan Airlines Flight 5915
Explanation: Sepahan Airlines Flight 5915, a HESA IrAn-140 (an Antonov An-140 built under license) crashed shortly after takeoff from Mehrabad International Airport, Iran, killing 39 of the 48 people on board.

Title: Indonesia AirAsia Flight 8501
Explanation: Indonesia AirAsia Flight 8501, an Airbus A320 en route from Surabaya, Indonesia to Singapore, crashed into the Java Sea near Kalimantan, Borneo, killing all 155 passengers and 7 crew on board.

Title: TransAsia Airways Flight 235
Explanation: TransAsia Airways Flight 235, an ATR-72, stalls on takeoff and crashes into the Keelung River in Taiwan after striking the Huandong Viaduct and a passing taxi. 43 of the 58 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: Delta Air Lines Flight 1086
Explanation: Delta Air Lines Flight 1086, a McDonnell Douglas MD-88 skids off the runway at LaGuardia Airport and crashes into a fence, coming inches from Flushing Bay. Several people are injured, but there are no fatalities.

Title: Germanwings Flight 9525
Explanation: Germanwings Flight 9525, an Airbus A320, crashes in southern France en route from Barcelona, Spain to Düsseldorf, Germany as a result of a deliberate act by the first officer. All 144 passengers and six crew on board the aircraft were killed in the crash.

Title: Air Canada Flight 624
Explanation: Air Canada Flight 624, an Airbus A320, crashes short of the runway and hits power lines while landing at Stanfield International Airport, en route from Toronto. All 138 passengers and crew on board survive, with 23 treated for minor injuries.

Title: Carson Air Flight 66
Explanation: Carson Air Flight 66, a Swearingen Metro II crashes into a mountain en route to Prince George Airport, British Columbia. Both crew members are killed.

Title: Asiana Airlines Flight 162
Explanation: Asiana Airlines Flight 162, an Airbus A320, crashes short of the runway and hits a localizer while landing at Hiroshima Airport, en route from Seoul. All 82 passengers and crew on board survive, but 27 are injured.

Title: Turkish Airlines Flight 1878
Explanation: Turkish Airlines Flight 1878, an Airbus A320, is severely damaged in a landing accident at Atatürk International Airport. All 102 passengers and crew on board are evacuated without injury.

Title: Trigana Air Service Flight 267
Explanation: Trigana Air Service Flight 267, an ATR-42, crashes while en route from Sentani Airport, to Oskibil Airport in the eastern Indonesian province of Papua. All 49 passengers and five crew members are killed in the crash in the worst aviation accident ever involving the ATR-42.

Title: British Airways Flight 2276
Explanation: British Airways Flight 2276, a Boeing 777-200ER, aborts takeoff at McCarran International Airport, Las Vegas, NV following an engine fire. All 170 passengers and crew are evacuated safely.

Title: Aviastar Flight 7503
Explanation: Aviastar Flight 7503, a DHC-6 Twin Otter, crashes on a mountain 11 minutes after take-off over Palopo, Indonesia, killing all 10 passengers and crew on board.

Title: Dynamic Airways Flight 405
Explanation: Dynamic Airways Flight 405, a Boeing 767-200ER, erupts in flames while preparing for take-off at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport. All 101 passengers and crew on board survive, but 21 people are injured.

Title: Metrojet Flight 9268
Explanation: Metrojet Flight 9268, an Airbus A321, explodes in mid-air over the Sinai Peninsula due to a terrorist bomb, 23 minutes after takeoff from Sharm-El-Sheikh, killing all 224 passengers and crew on board.

Title: Avia Traffic Company Flight 768
Explanation: Avia Traffic Company Flight 768, a Boeing 737-300, touches down hard at Osh Airport injuring 8, and causing all landing gears to be ripped off. The aircraft skids off the runway and the left engine is ripped off.

Title: West Air Sweden Flight 294
Explanation: West Air Sweden Flight 294, a Bombardier CRJ200 cargo freighter, crashes while in cruise near Akkajaure in Sweden; both crew members on board are killed.

Title: Daallo Airlines Flight 159
Explanation: Daallo Airlines Flight 159, an Airbus A321, suffers an explosion shortly after taking off from Aden Adde International Airport, Somalia; two people are injured and one, the suspected suicide bomber, is killed after falling from the aircraft.

Title: Tara Air Flight 193
Explanation: Tara Air Flight 193, a Viking Air-built DHC-6 Twin Otter, flies into a storm and crashes into a mountainside at Dana, Myagdi district, Nepal, killing all 23 on board.

Title: True Aviation Flight 21
Explanation: True Aviation Flight 21, an Antonov An-26 crashes into the sea whilst trying to return to Cox's Bazar Airport, Bangladesh after an engine failure, killing three of the four crew on board.

Title: Flydubai Flight 981
Explanation: Flydubai Flight 981, a Boeing 737-800, crashes while landing at Rostov-on-Don, Russia, in poor weather, killing all 62 people on board.

Title: EgyptAir Flight 181
Explanation: EgyptAir Flight 181, an Airbus A320, is hijacked and forcibly diverted to Larnaca International Airport, Cyprus; all passengers and crew are released unharmed.

Title: Batik Air Flight 7703
Explanation: Batik Air Flight 7703, a Boeing 737-800, collides with an ATR 42 on the runway at Halim Perdanakusma Airport in Jakarta; both aircraft are substantially damaged, but all 60 occupants of the two aircraft survive.

Title: EgyptAir Flight 804
Explanation: EgyptAir Flight 804, an Airbus A320, crashes into the eastern Mediterranean Sea after a series of sharp descending turns; all 56 passengers and 10 crew are killed.

Title: Korean Air Flight 2708
Explanation: Korean Air Flight 2708, a Boeing 777-300, suffers an engine failure and resulting fire while taxiing for takeoff at Haneda Airport; all 319 passengers and crew are evacuated although 12 are injured.

Title: Emirates Flight 521
Explanation: Emirates Flight 521, a Boeing 777-300, lands wheels-up at Dubai International Airport and bursts into flames shortly after landing; all 300 passengers and crew escape from the aircraft unharmed, but one firefighter is killed by an explosion.

Title: ASL Airlines Hungary Flight 7332
Explanation: ASL Airlines Hungary Flight 7332, a Boeing 737, overruns a runway on landing at Orio al Serio International Airport; both pilots survive.

Title: Southwest Airlines Flight 3472
Explanation: Southwest Airlines Flight 3472, a Boeing 737, suffers an uncontained engine failure over the Gulf of Mexico, causing substantial damage to the aircraft and loss of cabin pressure; the aircraft lands safely at Pensacola International Airport, with no injuries among the 104 on board.

Title: Skol Airlines Flight 9375
Explanation: Skol Airlines Flight 9375, a Mil Mi-8 helicopter carrying workers to the Suzumoskoye oil field, crashed in the Yamal Peninsula killing 19 of the 22 people on board.

Title: FedEx Express Flight 910
Explanation: FedEx Express Flight 910, a McDonnell Douglas MD-10-10F, skids off the runway after the landing gear collapses on landing at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport; the left wing is severely damaged in a post-crash fire but both pilots survive.

Title: LaMia Flight 2933
Explanation: LaMia Flight 2933, an Avro RJ85, crashes at Cerro Gordo en route to Medellín, Colombia, whilst carrying the Brazilian football team Chapecoense; all but six of the 77 passengers and crew die.

Title: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 661
Explanation: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 661, an ATR-42-500, crashes at Havelian while en route from Chitral to Islamabad; all 42 passengers and five crew members are killed in the accident.

Title: Aerosucre Flight 157
Explanation: Aerosucre Flight 157, a Boeing 727-200, crashes while failing to take off from Puerto Carreño en route to Bogota, Colombia; there is only one survivor among the six crew members on board.

Title: Afriqiyah Airways Flight 209
Explanation: Afriqiyah Airways Flight 209, an Airbus A320-214, is hijacked by two Gaddafi supporters and forced to land at Malta Airport; after several hours, all passengers and crew are released and the hijackers surrender.

Title: Turkish Airlines Flight 6491
Explanation: Turkish Airlines Flight 6491, a Boeing 747-400F, crashes into a residential area upon attempting landing in thick fog in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan. The four crew members and 35 people on the ground are killed.

Title: Peruvian Airlines Flight 112
Explanation: Peruvian Airlines Flight 112, a Boeing 737-300, is burnt out following the collapse of the landing gear at Francisco Carle Airport, Jauja. All 150 people on board survive.

Title: Summit Air Flight 409
Explanation: Summit Air Flight 409, a Let L-410 operating a cargo flight crashes short of Lukla Airport, Nepal in poor visibility. Two of the three crew members are killed, one of whom dies later in hospital.

Title: Air Canada Flight 759
Explanation: Air Canada Flight 759, an Airbus A320 on approach to runway 28R at San Francisco International Airport, nearly lands on a taxiway occupied by four loaded passenger jets. No one is killed or injured.

Title: Air France Flight 66
Explanation: Air France Flight 66, an Airbus A380, suffers an uncontained engine failure and makes an emergency landing at Goose Bay Airport, Newfoundland & Labrador, Canada. No one is killed or injured.

Title: Khabarovsk Airlines Flight 463
Explanation: Khabarovsk Airlines Flight 463, a Let L-410 Turbolet, crashes short of the runway at Nelkan Airport in Russia, killing four of the five passengers and both crew members.

Title: West Wind Aviation Flight 282
Explanation: West Wind Aviation Flight 282, an ATR 42-300, crashes shortly after takeoff from Fond-du-Lac Airport, Saskatchewan, Canada. Of the 25 passengers and crew on board, all initially survive, but one passenger dies of his injuries in the hospital 12 days later.

Title: Nature Air Flight 144
Explanation: Nature Air Flight 144, a Cessna 208 Caravan crashes shortly after takeoff from Punta Islita Airport, Costa Rica. All 12 passengers and crew on board are killed.

Title: Pegasus Airlines Flight 8622
Explanation: Pegasus Airlines Flight 8622, a Boeing 737-800, skids off the end of the runway at Trabzon Airport, Turkey, and comes to rest on a cliff. All 168 passengers and crew survive without injury. The aircraft is written off.

Title: Saratov Airlines Flight 703
Explanation: Saratov Airlines Flight 703, an Antonov An-148, crashes shortly after taking off from Domodedovo International Airport, Russia. All 71 passengers and crew are killed.

Title: United Airlines Flight 1175
Explanation: United Airlines Flight 1175 , a Boeing 777-200 operating a domestic flight between San Francisco International Airport and Honolulu International Airport, suffers an uncontained engine failure over the Pacific Ocean. A successful emergency landing was made at Honolulu and all 373 passengers and crew survive unharmed.

Title: Iran Aseman Airlines Flight 3704
Explanation: Iran Aseman Airlines Flight 3704, an ATR 72

Title: US-Bangla Airlines Flight 211
Explanation: US-Bangla Airlines Flight 211, a Bombardier Q400 on an international flight from Dhaka, crashes on landing at Tribhuvan International Airport, Nepal; 51 of the 71 people on board are killed.

Title: Southwest Airlines Flight 1380
Explanation: Southwest Airlines Flight 1380, a Boeing 737-700 en route over Bernville, Pennsylvania, suffers an engine failure at cruise altitude. Some debris enters the fuselage, causing substantial damage to the aircraft and loss of cabin pressure. The crew safely diverts to Philadelphia International Airport. One passenger is killed; another seven are injured.

Title: Sichuan Airlines Flight 8633
Explanation: Sichuan Airlines Flight 8633, an Airbus A319-100, makes an emergency landing at China's Chengdu Shuangliu Airport after part of the cockpit windshield fails; all 128 passengers and crew survive the incident.

Title: Cubana de Aviación Flight 972
Explanation: Cubana de Aviación Flight 972, a Boeing 737-200/Adv, crashes shortly after takeoff from José Martí International Airport, Cuba. 112 of the 113 passengers and crew are killed; the sole survivor is seriously injured.

Title: Air Vanuatu Flight 241
Explanation: Air Vanuatu Flight 241, an ATR 72-500, skids off the runway after a flight from Tanna to Port Villa, Vanuatu. 13 of the 43 people on board suffer minor injuries.

Title: Aeroméxico Connect Flight 2431
Explanation: Aeroméxico Connect Flight 2431, an Embraer ERJ-190AR, crashes into wooded terrain shortly after takeoff from Durango International Airport, Mexico. The aircraft is destroyed, but all 99 passengers and four crew survive.

Title: Xiamen Airlines Flight 8667
Explanation: Xiamen Airlines Flight 8667, a Boeing 737-800, overshoots the runway on landing at Ninoy Aquino International Airport, Philippines, in heavy monsoon rains. All 157 passengers and eight crew are unharmed.

Title: UTair Flight 579
Explanation: UTair Flight 579, a Boeing 737-800, overshoots the runway and catches fire while landing in Sochi International Airport, injuring 18 people. One airport employee dies of a heart attack.

Title: Yirol Let L-410 Turbolet crash
Explanation: A Let L-410 Turbolet crashes into a lake in Yirol, South Sudan, killing 20 of the 23 passengers and crew on board.

Title: Air Niugini Flight 73
Explanation: Air Niugini Flight 73, a Boeing 737-800, lands short of the runway and comes to rest in a lagoon at Chuuk International Airport in the Federated States of Micronesia, one passenger dies whilst 34 passengers and 12 crew escape without serious injuries.

Title: Lion Air Flight 610
Explanation: Lion Air Flight 610, a Boeing 737 MAX 8 bound for Pangkal Pinang, Indonesia, crashes into the Java Sea shortly after takeoff from Soekarno

Title: Sky Lease Cargo Flight 4854
Explanation: Sky Lease Cargo Flight 4854, a Boeing 747-400F, overruns the runway while attempting to land at Halifax Stanfield International Airport, Canada. Three crew members are injured.

Title: Fly Jamaica Airways Flight 256
Explanation: Fly Jamaica Airways Flight 256, a Boeing 757-200, crash lands after returning to Cheddi Jagan International Airport, Guyana, after suffering a hydraulic failure 45 minutes after takeoff en route to Toronto. All on board initially survived, but one passenger died a week later due to injuries sustained in the crash.

Title: Air Astana Flight 1388
Explanation: Air Astana Flight 1388, an Embraer ERJ-190, suffers severe control issues shortly after takeoff. It lands safely 90 minutes later at Beja Airbase, Portugal. The aircraft is written off.

Title: Atlas Air Flight 3591
Explanation: Atlas Air Flight 3591, a Boeing 767, en route from Miami, Florida, to Houston, Texas, United States, crashed into Trinity Bay on approach to Houston's George Bush Intercontinental Airport, killing both crew members and the single passenger on board.

Title: Biman Bangladesh Airlines Flight 147
Explanation: Biman Bangladesh Airlines Flight 147, a Boeing 737-800 flying from Bangladesh to Dubai, underwent an attempted hijacking and subsequently made an emergency landing at Shah Amanat International Airport in Chittagong; all passengers were safely evacuated and the perpetrator was shot dead by Bangladeshi special forces.

Title: United Express Flight 4933
Explanation: United Express Flight 4933, an Embraer ERJ145XR attempting to land at Presque Isle International Airport in Maine, touched down off the runway after the pilots continued the approach despite being unable to see the runway surface due to snow; three aircraft occupants suffered minor injuries.

Title: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302
Explanation: Ethiopian Airlines Flight 302, a Boeing 737 MAX 8 bound for Nairobi, Kenya, crashed near Bishoftu, Ethiopia, shortly after taking off from Addis Ababa's Bole International Airport, following an MCAS malfunction. All 157 occupants on board were killed. This was the other of the two MAX flights that crashed causing the Boeing 737 MAX groundings.

Title: Miami Air International Flight 293
Explanation: Miami Air International Flight 293, a Boeing 737-81Q operating a flight from Guantánamo Bay, Cuba, to Florida, United States, overshot the runway on landing at Naval Air Station Jacksonville during a thunderstorm; all 143 passengers and crew survived the accident.

Title: Aeroflot Flight 1492
Explanation: Aeroflot Flight 1492, a Sukhoi Superjet 100 operating a domestic flight in Russia, suffered an in-flight electrical failure shortly after departing from Sheremetyevo International Airport, Moscow. The pilots attempted an emergency landing and returned to the airport where it caught fire after landing following multiple bounces; 41 of the 78 people on board were killed.

Title: Biman Bangladesh Airlines Flight 060
Explanation: Biman Bangladesh Airlines Flight 060, a Bombardier Q400 inbound from Shahjalal International Airport in Bangladesh, overshot the runway in bad weather at Yangon International Airport, Myanmar; all 33 people on board survived but 18 were injured.

Title: Angara Airlines Flight 200
Explanation: Angara Airlines Flight 200, an Antonov An-24 operating a domestic flight in Russia, suffered an in-flight engine failure and landed at Nizhneangarsk Airport where it subsequently overshot the runway and crashed into a building; all 43 passengers survived but two of the four crew members were killed.

Title: Ural Airlines Flight 178
Explanation: Ural Airlines Flight 178, an Airbus A321 bound for Simferopol, Crimea, suffered multiple bird strikes immediately after takeoff from Zhukovsky International Airport in Moscow, Russia, and performed an emergency belly landing in a cornfield; 74 of the 233 people on board were injured.

Title: Ukraine Air Alliance Flight 4050
Explanation: Ukraine Air Alliance Flight 4050, an Antonov An-12 en route from Spain to Turkey, crashed on approach to its intermediate stopover at Lviv International Airport in Ukraine, due to fuel exhaustion; five of the eight occupants were killed and the three survivors were seriously injured.

Title: Bek Air Flight 2100
Explanation: Bek Air Flight 2100, a Fokker 100 operating a domestic flight in Kazakhstan, crashed on takeoff from Almaty International Airport, killing 13 of the 98 people on board and injuring 66.

Title: Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752
Explanation: Ukraine International Airlines Flight 752, a Boeing 737-800 bound for Kyiv, Ukraine, crashed shortly after taking off from Imam Khomeini International Airport in Tehran, Iran, after being hit by two surface-to-air missiles launched by Iranian military forces; all 176 crew and passengers on board were killed.

Title: Delta Air Lines Flight 89
Explanation: Delta Air Lines Flight 89, a Boeing 777-200ER, dumped fuel over several schools and neighborhoods while returning to Los Angeles International Airport due to a compressor stall, injuring 56.

Title: Caspian Airlines Flight 6936
Explanation: Caspian Airlines Flight 6936, a McDonnell Douglas MD-83, flying a domestic flight from Tehran, Iran, overran the runway on landing at Mahshahr Airport, Iran; the aircraft came to a stop on a road, injuring 2 of the 144 passengers and crew on board.

Title: Pegasus Airlines Flight 2193
Explanation: Pegasus Airlines Flight 2193, a Boeing 737-800 operating a domestic flight between İzmir and Istanbul in Turkey, skidded off the runway and dropped down an embankment on landing at Sabiha Gökçen International Airport; three of the 183 people on board were killed.

Title: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 8303
Explanation: Pakistan International Airlines Flight 8303, an Airbus A320, crashed in a residential neighborhood in Karachi minutes before a second attempted landing at Jinnah International Airport. 2 passengers survived among the 99 on board. One victim on the ground later died from her injuries.

Title: Air India Express Flight 1344
Explanation: Air India Express Flight 1344, a Boeing 737-800 operating an international repatriation flight, crashed on landing at Kozhikode International Airport, skidding off the runway and plunging into a gorge; 21 occupants were killed, including both pilots.

Title: Volga-Dnepr Airlines Flight 4066
Explanation: Volga-Dnepr Airlines Flight 4066, an An-124 operating a cargo flight from Novosibirsk, Russia to Vienna, Austria, suffered an uncontained engine failure on takeoff and overran the runway upon returning to Novosibirsk. All 14 crew members survived the incident.

Title: Sriwijaya Air Flight 182
Explanation: Sriwijaya Air Flight 182, a Boeing 737-500 operating a domestic flight to Pontianak, Indonesia, crashed shortly after takeoff from Jakarta's Soekarno

Title: Longtail Aviation Flight 5504
Explanation: Longtail Aviation Flight 5504, a Boeing 747-400BCF operating a cargo flight from Maastricht, Netherlands to New York, United States suffered engine failure shortly after takeoff. The aircraft safely diverted to Liege, Belgium but two people on the ground were injured by falling debris.

Title: United Airlines Flight 328
Explanation: United Airlines Flight 328, a Boeing 777-200 flying from Denver to Honolulu suffered a contained engine failure after takeoff, scattering debris over residential neighborhoods below. The pilots used the remaining engine to safely land in Denver. None of the 241 passengers and crew were injured, nor was anyone injured on the ground from debris.

Title: Ryanair Flight 4978
Explanation: Ryanair Flight 4978, a Boeing 737-800 operating an international scheduled passenger flight from Athens, Greece to Vilnius, Lithuania, was forced to land at Minsk, Belarus after a false bomb alarm, escorted by a Belarusian Air Force MiG-29. Activist Roman Protasevich, who was on board the aircraft, was arrested.

Title: Transair Flight 810
Explanation: Transair Flight 810, a Boeing 737-200C operating a domestic cargo flight in Hawaii between Honolulu, Oahu and the neighbouring island of Maui, suffered an engine failure shortly after takeoff and ditched in the sea. Both pilots survived with injuries.

Title: Siberian Light Aviation Flight 42
Explanation: Siberian Light Aviation Flight 42, an Antonov An-28 operating a domestic flight from Kedrovy to Tomsk, Russia, crash landed after takeoff, injuring 11 of the 18 passengers and crew on board.

Title: Siberian Light Aviation Flight 51
Explanation: Siberian Light Aviation Flight 51, a Let L-410 operating a domestic flight from Irkutsk to Kazachinskoye, Russia, crashed in a forest short of the runway while attempting to land in heavy fog; 4 of the 16 occupants were killed with the 12 survivors being seriously injured.

Title: Grodno Aviakompania Flight 1252
Explanation: Grodno Aviakompania Flight 1252, an Antonov An-12, crashed whilst attempting to land at Irkutsk International Airport, Russia whilst operating a cargo flight. All nine aboard were killed.

Title: China Eastern Airlines Flight 5735
Explanation: China Eastern Airlines Flight 5735, a Boeing 737-89P operating a domestic flight from Kunming to Guangzhou, China, crashed in a mountainous region in Guangxi after entering a near vertical nosedive, killing all 132 on board.

Title: DHL Aero Expreso Flight 7216
Explanation: DHL Aero Expreso Flight 7216, a Boeing 757-27A PCF, overran the runway and broke apart during an emergency landing at Juan Santamaría International Airport, Costa Rica, due to hydraulic problems. There were no serious injuries.

Title: Tibet Airlines Flight 9833
Explanation: Tibet Airlines Flight 9833, an Airbus A319-100, aborted a take-off from Chongqing and veered off the runway. A fire erupted, but all 122 occupants evacuated safely.

Title: Tara Air Flight 197
Explanation: Tara Air Flight 197, a de Havilland Canada DHC-6 Twin Otter operating a flight from Pokhara to Jomsom, Nepal, crashed in poor weather conditions, killing all 22 on board.

Title: RED Air Flight 203
Explanation: RED Air Flight 203, a McDonnell Douglas MD-82 operating a flight from Santo Domingo, veered off the runway and caught fire after the landing gear collapsed on touchdown at Miami International Airport. There were three minor injuries among the 140 passengers and crew on board.

Title: Meridian Flight 3032
Explanation: Meridian Flight 3032, an Antonov An-12 carrying weapons and ammunition cargo from Niš, Serbia to Dhaka, Bangladesh, crashed near Kavala in Greece, killing all eight on board.

Title: Korean Air Flight 631
Explanation: Korean Air Flight 631, an Airbus A330-300 flying from Seoul, overshot the runway at Mactan-Cebu International Airport, Philippines, in poor weather and collided with airport equipment. There were no injuries among the 173 passengers and crew.

Title: Precision Air Flight 494
Explanation: Precision Air Flight 494, an ATR 42-500 flying a domestic flight from Dar es Salaam, crashed into Lake Victoria while attempting to land at Bukoba Airport, Tanzania. Of the 43 people on board, 19 were killed.

Title: LATAM Perú Flight 2213
Explanation: LATAM Perú Flight 2213, an Airbus A320neo operated by LATAM Chile taking off from Jorge Chávez International Airport, Peru, collided with a fire engine crossing the runway, killing three firefighters. All 102 passengers and 6 crew aboard escaped unharmed. This was the first hull loss of an A320neo.

Title: Yeti Airlines Flight 691
Explanation: Yeti Airlines Flight 691, an ATR 72-500 operating a domestic flight from Tribhuvan International Airport to Pokhara International Airport, crashed into the gorge of the Seti Gandaki River in Pokhara, Nepal. All 72 people aboard were killed. The crash is the deadliest involving the ATR 72.

Title: Ural Airlines Flight 1383
Explanation: Ural Airlines Flight 1383, an Airbus A320 operating a flight from Sochi to Omsk in Russia, made an emergency landing in a corn field after reporting hydraulic issues. All 165 people on board survived without injuries.

Title: Alaska Airlines Flight 1282
Explanation: Alaska Airlines Flight 1282, a Boeing 737 MAX 9 departing out of Portland International Airport experienced uncontrolled decompression when a plug covering an unused exit door blew out. The aircraft made a safe return to Portland with all 177 people onboard surviving. Nobody was seated next to the blown outdoor plug, and three injuries were reported onboard.

Title: Northwestern Air Flight 738
Explanation: Northwestern Air Flight 738, a British Aerospace Jetstream, crashed shortly after takeoff while carrying mine workers from Fort Smith, Northwest Territories, to the Diavik Diamond Mine in Northwest Territories, Canada, killing six of the seven passengers and crew.

Title: Air Serbia Flight 324
Explanation: Air Serbia Flight 324, an Embraer 195 operated by Marathon Airlines, struck landing lights on takeoff at Belgrade Nikola Tesla Airport. The aircraft flew for another hour and made an emergency landing at the same airport with a large hole in the fuselage. All 111 occupants survived unharmed.

Title: Safarilink Aviation Flight 053
Explanation: Safarilink Aviation Flight 053, a de Havilland Canada Dash 8, collided with a Cessna 172 over Nairobi National Park in Kenya shortly after takeoff from Wilson Airport with 44 passengers and crew. The Cessna 172 crashed, killing both occupants, while the Dash 8 safely returned to Wilson Airport.

Title: LATAM Airlines Flight 800
Explanation: LATAM Airlines Flight 800, a Boeing 787-9 flying from Sydney, Australia, to Santiago, Chile, with a stopover in Auckland, New Zealand, suffered an in-flight upset, on the first leg of the flight, injuring 50 people. The flight landed safely at Auckland Airport.

Title: Singapore Airlines Flight 321
Explanation: Singapore Airlines Flight 321, a Boeing 777-300ER flying from London to Singapore, encountered severe turbulence killing 1 passenger and injuring another 104 occupants. The flight made a safe emergency landing at Bangkok.

Title: Gazpromavia Flight 9608
Explanation: Gazpromavia Flight 9608, a Sukhoi Superjet 100 on a ferry flight from Lukhovitsy to Moscow, crashed near Moscow whilst attempting an emergency landing. All three crew members were killed.

Title: Voepass Flight 2283
Explanation: Voepass Flight 2283, an ATR-72-500 flying from Cascavel Airport to Guarulhos International Airport, São Paulo, Brazil, entered a flat spin and crashed in Vinhedo, São Paulo. All 62 occupants on board died.

Title: Thai Flying Service Flight 209
Explanation: Thai Flying Service Flight 209, a Cessna 208 Grand Caravan flying from Bangkok to Ko Mai Si, Thailand, crashed in a mangrove swamp shortly after taking off from Suvarnabhumi Airport, killing all nine people on board.
